locations.address: îƒˆChurch St, Brighton BN1 1YA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: The showers are always dirty and cold 50 percent of the time. Sauna and steam room often cold. Black dirt around edge of pools. My app has not worked for 6 weeks and nothing has been done to rectify it.  The only reason I give it one star is the staff are very nice and as helpful as they can be..
showerReviews.author: Kyna

showerReviews.reviewText: The showers are always dirty and cold 50 percent of the time. Sauna and steam room often cold. Black dirt around edge of pools. showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited the Prince Regent Swimming Pool in Brighton today for the steam room and sauna and sadly had a very disappointing experience. The changing rooms felt tired and not very clean. The steam room door kept swinging open, there was very little steam, and because the outlet was positioned above knee height, my lower body actually got cold rather than warmed.
The sauna was hot but so packed with people that it felt stifling and uncomfortable, rather than like a calm, healing heat. All the showers were cold as well, so instead of leaving relaxed, we left shivering. We were given a full refund, but overall it was not the restorative visit we had hoped for.
showerReviews.author: Skates Armstrong

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really difficult to find the car park. Under a tunnel between 2 residential properties.
Once in the centre, there are lots to do.
Swimming pool looks good, clean and all open.

showerReviews.reviewText: I swam there today after a two year hiatus.  It hasn't got any cleaner. It's got worse. The white tiles around the shallow pool are covered with patches of brown dirt, the floor of the pool is dirty, as are the tiles in front of the bench.  I understand it's an undertaking to clean the pools, but surely this doesn't apply to the showers and changing areas? Everything is covered in limescale, the wall of my shower was blotched with black dirt and there were huge clumps of hair in the drain. It's completely put me off returning. Honestly, Brighton deserves better than this.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Chase

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: This pool is in a very convenient location. The staff are friendly and helpful. The pool is quite large and they have lanes for different sill levels. Great activities for the family and all skill levels. Better to go during the week as there are less people and dodging kids running around everywhere.

Cons: The pool itself is quite dirty. I have seen black and brown debris in the pool. It seems as if it is not cleaned regularly. The shower areas are filthy as well and are often either very cold or lukewarm. The changing rooms and bathrooms are filthy as well. The floors are dirty and wet.

showerReviews.reviewText: When my non verbal autistic  child s local swimming lesson was cancelled while we were on our way at 6pm on a weekday evening, King Alfred was the only place that offered drop in fun sessions that time of evening within reasonable travel distance from us. Even though the centre is an old building, I didn't see any hygiene issues with the pool area. We will be back.
showerReviews.author: b kartal

showerReviews.reviewText: The hygiene standards at Freedom Leisure Centres are subpar, and the staff seem to lack adequate training, displaying a general lack of engagement and assistance. The condition of Portslade Sports Centre is particularly concerning, implying a significant management issue. It is my hope that when the new sports centre is established, the Brighton and Hove Council carefully considers the suitability of granting Freedom Leisure the license to operate it. Staff member was rude to me causing be to complain and cancel my membership, resulting in Freedom Leisure attempting to smear me and blacken my name and refusing my request to cancel my membership but instead banning me so as to save face and make themselves look good. I've had the manager of King Alfred Leisure Centre lie about me in order to save his reputation. South Downs Leisure on the other hand seem to be friendly, efficient and well trained, even welcoming me using my name, something King Alfred never do, they don't even look up and only speak to you to tell you it's time up. Don't use King Alfred Leisure Centre at all is my advise. Not unless someone else takes it over. Terrible management!
showerReviews.author: John Williams

My 1 year old loved it and canâ€™t wait to go back! excellent value for money and great attention to detail. Itâ€™s the kind of place you instantly want to recommend to friends and family. If youâ€™re in Brighton and considering it, just go you wonâ€™t be disappointed!

showerReviews.reviewText:
How this place is still open and getting positive reviews is beyond me. The changing rooms, toilets and communal areas are in a terrible state. Fixtures and fittings are completely unfit for a wet leisure centre, the benches are literally rotting, and it didnâ€™t feel clean at all. The whole place smells of damp and mould, which made me really uncomfortable being there with my child and baby.

The baby changing cubicles and tables were grim, and the lighting so dim it felt like it was just hiding how bad things were. I didnâ€™t see a single cleaner the whole time we were there.

The only positive was the staff, who were friendly and seemed keen to help, but sadly that doesnâ€™t make up for the poor condition of the facilities.

They were carrying out work to some areas whilst we were there but this was to a very poor standard.

EDIT:
In response to the owner's reply I have attached photos to show my experience.  I also, as requested by the owner, emailed them directly. They sent me an extremely unprofessional message and banned me from the venue for giving them a bad review ðŸ˜…

showerReviews.reviewText:
Took my son there for Water Babies swimming lessons and went once with my girlfriend as well and had a nice time.
The site has 3 pools although one is currently being revamped so 2 to use but all decent sizes and perfect for young kids. The only things that let it down are the parking as there is not much by way of parking for the site specifically and you have to find on road parking and the cafe / shop which doesn't have a massive selection but apart from that it is decent!
showerReviews.author: Max Collins

showerReviews.reviewText: Staff are great here extremely kind and engaging whilst also offering you plenty of privacy and letting you enjoy those precious family moments we were pleased with a pool to ourselves for an hour slot just by luck and it was delightful. Clean and warm and well maintained. Lockers are free so to speak but do not lock I think you can use a padlock but realistically your in a place for only families and itâ€™s not like your usual manic swimming centre so we didnâ€™t have much concerns about that. They also serve food and drinks the coffee smelt great on arrival. Well worth a visit as itâ€™s truly a family vibe with good facilities tailored for babies pretty cool to offer such facilities when closing themselves off to business for strictly family use to me I think that speaks volumes as itâ€™s not about the quantity of customers they could have itâ€™s the quality of facilities they can offer for a select customer thatâ€™s good business for any customers and a bold business decision on their part. Fair play to them we look forwards to visiting again.
showerReviews.author: Archie Stats

showerReviews.reviewText: Went today for the 1st time with My 4 month old. Really easy to find as have a massive banner on the front of the building. The whole place was spotless and felt really hygienic. Nice and warm as soon as you enter. Changing rooms were a good size and had several baby units you could change you baby on without having to bend down! We used the purple pool which was lovely, it had low lighting and pool was very warm. There also a small cafe as you walk in which was reasonably prices and the brownies were delicious. All the staff we met were really friendly, there was a young girl who first served us who was really nice and even offered to carry out bags as we had our hands full. Definitely worth signing up as it reduces the price of swimming and also food/drink in the cafe. We can't wait to come back again.
showerReviews.author: Becky G

showerReviews.reviewText: We visited earlier in the week, I am reluctant to leave a slightly negative review, as the people working there seem lovely. The pool we used (Pool1) was very dated and the water was extremely salty. The changing room we were told to use is shared across genders which as mothers with young children we weren't thrilled about. Also a very strong smell of urine, this may have been due to the blocked toilet across from it which wasnâ€™t ideal. I know there are seperate cubicles but stillâ€¦ we had babies and there were only two changing tables with no sanitisation inbetween babies using them, unlike other swimming schools catered for babies. That said, we did enjoy using the pool all together and the babies enjoyed it.The staff were friendly and the new pool looks really nice.  But due to the cleanliness of some (not all) areas and the changing room situation I probably wouldnâ€™t return with a young baby. I really hope this review is seen as helpful feedback and not replied to in any other way.
showerReviews.author: Lily Buckley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice facilities but quite small. There is a pool, gym, steam room and sauna. The person on the front desk was welcoming and explained how the lockers worked.

The changing rooms are quite small as well, only 2 showers. I would have liked there to be a jacuzzi as well. Because of this I would recommend not going in peak hours and weekends. It wasnâ€™t too busy but I wouldnâ€™t have wanted to be any busier as itâ€™s quite tight.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently got the spring offer to join Juvenate.
In my opinion, the cost of the membership is fair considering that it grants access to the gym, sauna, steam room, and swimming pool. ( note: gym is quite small and equipped with basic for cardio and routine work out)
But I've observed that lately, especially in the sauna and steam room, it's been really busy. The swimming pool is likewise rather warm, and the shower has extremely hot water rather than cold. If you could change the shower's or the pool's temperature, that would be fantastic. The fact that they provided lockers, wonderful shower cream, and wet bags is really good.
I would suggest that you should limit the numbers of people per hour and people should book the slots ahead per apps or something like that.
I hope my review will have a good impact and team will make the changes soon.
showerReviews.author: may chaw Win

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff are friendly and nice. Steam room and sauna are good. I joined the first time mainly to use the swimming pool but sadly some hotel guests have little regard for hygiene. I saw someone jumping straight to the pool after sweating in the sauna and he's definitely not the only one. My eyes are still itching after two days.
The gym was good though.

showerReviews.reviewText:
How can anyone justify rating this gym highly? There's no free trials for a reason. People are brainwashed to pay Â£15 a month (on offer btw atm) The pool is horrendously small and frustratingly busy, which can't be helped. Also stupidly shallow, so if you want to do the smallest length of any pool, the time you reach half way in the pool, if you're around 6ft , you'll bash your knees on the pools surface, which wasn't a pleasant experience I must say.

The fitting rooms are atrocious. Absolutely terrible, there's bench opposite the lockers which can only cater to TWO people. When I arrived, I couldn't even wait because others have to take their time sorting themselves out understandably. So, I had to makeshift a changing area for myself within the small space, which wasn't ideal and was incredibly awkward.

It's dirty, and needs revamp majorly. If not a whole new modern extension. Practically you endure every naked fellas crack in your face, *Gulp. it's beyond uncomfortable.

I'm used to premium gyms, However due to the climate and cost of living, its made it impossible to obtain a membership which costs Â£100+ - obviously this isn't a premium gym and I know that, but I gave it a go, though I really didn't know it would be this bad. It's shocking.

Trust me, you're better off going to Bognor Regis' Butlins for a better Pool experience.
showerReviews.author: Kris Vincent

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a paying member for 4 years and over the past year Iâ€™ve seen a real decline in standards of cleanliness and customer service. Staffing is woefully under resourced with often only one person on duty. Iâ€™ve completed the evaluation form on site many times but nobody ever gets in touch.

Yesterday for example there were no towels, the soap dispensers in the showers were empty and the jacuzzi was out of order. The changing rooms and the pool area are all in desperate need of a deep clean, the place is filthy.

The health club is very near to where I live and therefore very convenient, which is why so far I have remained loyal.

The standards should be higher in my opinion considering this is part of The Hilton, and the price isnâ€™t cheap.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience due to misleading advertising and poor communication.

The swimming pool water is quite cold, and memberships come with a mandatory minimum term. On top of that, cancellations require at least 30 daysâ€™ notice, which is not clearly disclosed upfront.

I saw an Instagram ad offering the current month for free. I messaged them to ask if there were any conditions, and I was told the only significant one was a minimum term of one month. No mention was made of the 30-day notice period.

I went to the facilities to try them out, but they were closing and asked me to return the next day. I specifically asked if I could swim for free that month as advertised, and they confirmed this again, with no additional conditions mentioned. I couldnâ€™t go the following day, but they later called me and we agreed I would come back, still with no further information disclosed.

I am traveling in 10 days and simply wanted to try the pool once, with the intention of signing up properly when I return to Brighton. I prepared everything in advance, including bringing my wetsuit and assembling new fins.

When I finally arrived, I was told that I would still have to pay for the following month even if I didnâ€™t use the facility, because cancellations require 30 daysâ€™ notice. As a result, I couldnâ€™t swim at all.

This was extremely frustrating. The advertisement was misleading, and despite communicating with them multiple times across different channels, this crucial condition was never mentioned. A â€œfree monthâ€ offer that still obliges you to pay for an additional month is not truly free.

The views are nice when the weather is good, thatâ€™s the only positive aspect of my experience.
showerReviews.author: Mat Mora

showerReviews.reviewText:
More than a swimming pool on the beach, which it definitely IS, but one that has a whole lot of other things in the same place as well.  More reminiscent of a pop-up box park, this little beachfront leisure complex of assorted components is no doubt marketed as a complete destination venue package for the discerningly trendy.
Beer? Yep. Coffee? Yep. Pizza? Yep. Take your pick, swimming isn't a requirement for use or entry or even access. Leisurely lounging about these interlocking wooden sustainable hipster sheds that will sell you stuff to fill your stomach and maybe your happiness meter. No guarantees  on your soul but I imagine that's a job for the sunset on a summer evening, sharing the chilled vibes with the company of your choice. (meaning person or people obv...)
showerReviews.author: Matthew Max Jackson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve visited twice - Iâ€™m a couple of hours away otherwise Iâ€™d be here all the time. Beautiful pool with lovely views, 19 degrees on both occasions Iâ€™ve visited which is warmer than Iâ€™m used to. Very clean surrounds and changing areas and staff are welcoming but unobtrusive.

A few tips:

Bring your own padlock and key for the lockers, or there are small wire cages outside in sight of the pool for small items.

The changing areas are unisex with lockable individual cubicles. Very clean. Shoes should be removed at the door.

All pool users must wear swim caps.

I booked on the first occasion but not the second - was welcomed both times and there was plenty of room to swim.

The pool is divided into several lanes (slow/medium/fast) according to swim speed.

There are warm showers in the changing rooms and both warm and cold showers poolside.

I asked the lifeguard if it was ok to take photographs. It is. As always I blur photos of other pool users outside my own family.

There is a cafe next to the pool but unfortunately I didnâ€™t have the time to try it.
showerReviews.author: Susan Herts

I am a fit4 member, and have visited almost all the gyms within the group. I really like Southwick as their reception staff are some of the loveliest and friendliest out of the whole group. They are very attentive and helpful, whether enquiring via the phone or in person.

The Leisure Centre has a large car park, with ample parking for visitors. The changing rooms were clean and well maintained.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Three  lockers in changing room got broken into.  Management delayed reporting it to police and did not carry out thorough investigations.  When we questioned them about how they conducted the investigation, they were put on the back foot and were left red faced.  They lied by saying that it was the first time such an incident had occurred only to find out later that it wasn't the case at all.  The impression we got was that they'd rather brush the security issues under the carpet than spend the additional money on upgrading their security.  They have now lost 4 customers as a result.
Advice is, only take what you need even if you are putting items in a locker.   Do not leave cash in there!  There are blind spots in that GYM that allow opportunists to go in and help themselves.  And when something does go missing, make sure you ask the GYM for a Police Ref number rather than just relying on the advice from them that they have reported it to the police.  Whist there are signs around the GYM advising customers that they are responsible for their own belongings, for the amount of money we all paid them monthly, I would have expected a higher degree of security and some decent lockers!
showerReviews.author: Sookie Suddarth

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great staff there. They have excellent changing and showering facilities. The equipment is kept in good condition, even though the don't have much. This is evident when getting a membership, as they are quite pricey (at Â£37.50 a month or Â£6 entry for non members) because they only seem to have the basic equipment, not even a pool or sauna. Despite this, the membership does allow you to get into the variety of different classes for free (otherwise Â£5 entry).
Despite the flaws, I would recommend going here, if you are looking to keep in shape and are willing to pay a little extra.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have to be real with this review. There are both pros and cons with this gym experience overall. Firstly, the positives -the equipment is good, very wide ranging weight training offering here - and itâ€™s all new, 6-months. The staff are fine - theyâ€™re nice. There arenâ€™t that many of them around. However, thereâ€™s no air conditioning - in summer itâ€™s very stuffy and hot inside. The changing rooms are in a poor state, scruffy, broken lockers, and havenâ€™t been touched since the previous tenants left, other than to remove soap from the showers. The sauna and steam room have never opened despite being advertised from the start. There are no classes here. This would be a great place to offer lifting instruction to groups but thereâ€™s nada. For the price, itâ€™s on the high side for Brighton given the pretty basic offering.

locations.title: The Gym Group Brighton Madeira Drive
locations.address: îƒˆUnit 9 Madeira Dr, The Terraces, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 1AY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined this gym earlier in the month, the first month + joining fee is taken from a card and from then on the monthly fees are taken via direct debit. I did not realise my bank account was not compatible with direct debit, so the gym contacted to let me know they werenâ€™t able to set up the direct debit. There was nothing in the email about me not being allowed into the gym.

When I went to the gym my code had been blocked and I could not enter the gym, despite the fact I had been charged Â£36 for the month. I rang the assistance buzzer at the door for twenty minutes and nobody responded. I had no access to the gym for the whole weekend and had to wait until the customer service line was open on Monday to ask them to let me into the gym.

When I rang the customer service line I explained the situation, the woman then said I have access to the gym until the 6th November. I told her I donâ€™t because I went to the gym two days ago and my code has been blocked. She then yelled at me saying she knows it wasnâ€™t working but that it works now because she just fixed it. They were not apologetic at all about the fact I had been locked out of the gym for three days. I ended up requesting a refund for the first month as I do not want to be in a gym like this, where there is no staff monitoring the gym and that I can be locked out for days for no reason.

In regard to the gym itself, the showers are terrible, they have some sensor motion things that only turn on when they feel like it. Thereâ€™s also no hairdryers, perhaps this is not a thing in the UK, Iâ€™m not from here, but I find the idea of bringing a hairdryer with me in my gym bag a bit ridiculous. The gym is also very stuffy and smells bad.
showerReviews.author: Emelene Kennedy

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having returned to the UK after living in South Africa for nearly 30 years we were eager to come and swim in the Lido as we are not keen on indoor pools. We had the most amazing morning-the pool was not busy but it was a cooler day than some. We arrived about 10am on a Sat morning. Plenty of space to swim-lovely and warm once we got in but could have been a little warmer for us.. Great to have the showers on site and change facilities if required too. We had a lovely coffee from the on site catering van -highly recommend..
We returned today to try the restaurant and were not disappointed. We had really lovely meals. I can recommend the house salad ,it was not just a pile of lettuce leaves with the usual chunks of tomato and cucumber but a delectable plate of finely mixed ingredients and gorgeous dressing -well worth the price and even  though the restaurant was busy over the lunch time and had a 'kitchen crisis' it still felt very relaxing. The staff are amazing and seemed to be really enjoying their job... There is lots more to try and we have already made a booking for a family birthday celebration.
We will be back very soon Saltdean Lido as there is more to explore...
showerReviews.author: Landi Lady

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great pool to swim in - what a fantastic setting and brilliant to see the pool and buildings being fully restored.
Pool is around 40m length and gently heated during winter to 19Â° which is quite chilly in just a swimsuit. Booked tickets in advance and the price is reasonable (especially compared to Sea Lanes). Free parking on site.
Not sure if the current changing area is temporary? These seemed fairly rudimentary and relatively few changing cubicles. Lockers available, although you'll need somewhere to store the locker key! Showers lovely and warm.
Deco cafe looked lovely, but was already full when we visited - obviously a popular spot!
Would return again when restoration fully completed. Definitely one not to miss!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: My two boys have been attending regularly for several years now .. what keeps us coming back is the quality of the teaching from the swim coaches ... Always multiple swim teachers, lifeguards and assistants in the water with little ones. Very professional setup. Changing rooms are cleaned and maintained very regularly. You can find slightly cheaper swim clubs but the teaching is usually voluntary from well meaning parents who don't always hold the qualifications.

showerReviews.reviewText: The best place to learn swimming in Brighton. We did not like the female supervisor who is working on Sunday as being less helpful and unpleasant.

showerReviews.reviewText: We've been attending the Swim School with our kids over many years - it's a great place.  Today my daughter had her 9th Birthday party there.... for 15 friends.  It was totally fantastic.  A brilliant instructor led the games in the pool (including two children who couldn't swim well..... but you wouldn't have known it, they were helped along to join in with the rest).  Then upstairs to a beautifully decorated room (banners and streamers and balloons) for party food - and a delicious cake (specially hand baked by one of the staff).  The kids had such a great time - and totally stress free for the parents.  As with the swimming lessons, there is such a wonderful atmosphere - the staff enthusiastic, friendly, attend to every detail and concern, really get to know your kids.  Can't praise it highly enough!
showerReviews.author: Rachel Cottam

showerReviews.reviewText:
My little girl, who's nearly 5, had always been a little indifferent with water and would often lose interest when we'd take her swimming so we decided to book her in for a weeks toddler course .

The first session didn't go to plan and she initially struggled but I put that down to lack of confidence and getting used to a new surrounding.

After the initial blip she didn't look back and due to the very caring and patient instructors, gained more and more confidence. She enjoyed it so much, we booked her in for another weeks course.

The instructors were excellent, mixing fun, which relaxed the children, with the serious side of learning to swim.

If you're looking to book lessons for your child, I highly recommend Brighton Swimming School.
showerReviews.author: Adrian Ventura

showerReviews.reviewText: All 3 of my children have lessons with this swim school, and we have been very impressed since switching 6 months ago. My boys have improved dramatically since starting with PWS. There is much more focus as they are swimming all the time (at other swim schools, we found there was quite a lot of hanging around), and they absolutely love it. The teachers are all lovely and very technique focused ensuring an excellent standard of swimming.

Once they reach the final stage of their swimming lessons, they will be taught how to survive in a water emergency situation and this will give me so much peace of mind and really makes these lessons stand out. I have also just joined the adult classes, a really enjoyable relaxed atmosphere and great for adults learning to swim as well. The whole team are so lovely and friendly.

A well kept secret of the city's sports facilities under the Freedom Leisure umbrella. Less of a leisure centre, more like the sports hall complex of an independent fee-charging school.   Inside: Badminton, squash and a cardio gym. Outside: basketball, 5 a side.

If only there was a swimming pool and a cafÃ© here then this place would be paying for itself hand over fist day in and day out.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Max Jackson

The staff was very helpful and polite this is why I have given the Brighton sauna 5 stars I would be definitely going here again! If you like the person and the person likes your he will give you the eye to let you know he was to have fun with you. The next tip is No means No always remember that you would get the odd drunk guy who would try it on but you have to say No, the next tip is clean your mess after your selfs when you had some fun. Itâ€™s not nice to walk into a Cubicle when there is mess every where! The other tip is make sure you drink lots of water because you can get dehydrated because it is a sauna! showerReviews.reviewText:
I wandered in with desperate need,
A primal urge, a silent plead.
A door ajar, a flickering lightâ€”
The bathroom beckoned. Not quite right.

Its hinges groaned a haunted moan,
The tiles cold as ancient stone.
The stench! It hit me like a wallâ€”
A mix of sewage, doom, and gall.

The seat, askew, was cracked and brown,
A kingdom lost, a porcelain crown.
The bowl was not a bowl at allâ€”
But some abyss, where hopes would fall.

Dark stains that told of battles fought,
Where bleach and mop had long forgot.
A smear of somethingâ€¦ unconfessed,
Like ghostly fingers, poorly dressed.

The walls were marked with tales in inkâ€”
Graffiti scrawled by souls on brink.
"Abandon hope," one message read,
"Who enters here may soon be dead."

A roach parade, in perfect line,
Marched past the crumpled â€œSanitize!â€
The paper roll? A shredded dream.
It hung like shame on broken beams.

The sink dripped brown with rust and grime,
A faucet stuck in ancient time.
The mirror cracked, yet still it knewâ€”
My face aghast, the horror true.

The soap dispenser coughed up mold,
A relic from the germs of old.
No towel, no dryer, just despairâ€”
The air itself too thick to bear.

I hovered like a tragic ghost,
Unsure of where to touch, at most.
One flush I daredâ€”it screamed and roared,
Then sputtered filth it had ignored.

The floor was stickyâ€”what with, who knows?
Some tar-like ooze between my toes.
A single fly, obese and bold,
Buzzed near my ear, too proud, too old.

I dared not breathe, I dared not cry,
I dared not question â€œDear God, why?â€
Yet natureâ€™s call was strong and clear,
And so I braved that chamber queer.

Emerging pale, I found the lightâ€”
Dayâ€™s tender gleam, a gift, a right.
I swore upon that foul ordeal:
To cherish toilets clean and real.

So if you ever find this stall,
Take heed of my poetic call.
Bring wipes, bring prayers, bring hazmat gearâ€”
The Toilet of Dread still lingers near.
showerReviews.author: Isaac

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really enjoyable experience. I often find saunas too intense and have to come out every couple of minutes but the electric one was a great temperature for me and I even enjoyed the cold baths in the middle of winter. I thought 30 mins would seem long but couldâ€™ve happily stayed for an hour.

The staff were lovely, but I do find it strange that thereâ€™s absolutely no way to contact Luna Hut over the phone. I had a booking issue that was time-sensitive and could only fill in a contact form. Luckily they did get back to me in time but I think itâ€™s weird not to be able to talk to someone when itâ€™s an experience that might come with a lot of questions!

Also, Iâ€™m obsessed with the cute felt sauna hats but after my session was told to put them back in the pile. Those hats must be SWEATY. I hope they at least wash them at the end of each day ðŸ˜¬

showerReviews.reviewText:
It wasn't very crowded when I went there on Monday night after work. They're still relatively new, I think.
The sauna has a lovely sea view from the window and is nicely maintained. Outside is a cupboard containing hot and cold water. The main drawback is that you have to change in the open air without access to a changing facility, so it's best to wear clothing that is simple to remove.
Nonetheless, they give you a storage box to keep your stuff in.
It was really warm inside ( wood fire sauna!).
I feel so good after 30-minute session, and afterwards you may have a shower in an open area by the shore.
It is a very reasonable price and if you are a member with sea lane swimming, you get Â£1 off for sauna.
Overall, I enjoy using the beach sauna experience. I will come back and definitely recommend.
showerReviews.author: may chaw Win

locations.title: Bristol Gardens Health Spa
locations.address: îƒˆ24-26 Bristol Gardens, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 5JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been to this lovely spa multiple times and love it. There is a nice cafÃ© area for drinks and light meals, a full relaxing spa down the spiral stairs and rooms upstairs to rest. It's inexpensive for the amount of time and facilities you can use too. Very clean and the water is tested regularly. The big jacuzzi is lovely and the cool pool is good to plunge in after the sauna or steam room for circulation. I know some use this spa for adult reasons, but I find it amazing as a regular spa. A good winter retreat from the cold weather and so relaxing. Remember to take a big towel if like me you're on the bigger side. Unfortunately you'll always get a few bad apples in the public who try to buck the rules, but the staff are firm with them so if you think you can film, put hands on women without consent, stay beyond a session time or try to hide and stay as a single male during couples spa time you'll rightly be told to leave. I appreciate the rules and keeping us safe. The owner is lovely btw!
showerReviews.author: Philippa Saunders

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been to this lovely spa multiple times and love it. I appreciate the rules and keeping us safe. The owner is lovely btw!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Friendly staff and warm welcome. Nice range of temperatures in the steam rooms, saunas, hot tubs and pool. The manager has a great sense of humour and I can imagine the only reason why people may have found her abrupt (which Iâ€™ve read in some reviews) was if they were breaking a rule (and the rules are in place to keep people safe and having an enjoyable experience). She was especially fantastic when I was getting changed at the end and had lost a contact lens by bringing in a little mirror with light to help me locate it! Thank you :-)

I went on the Saturday evening session from 5.30 and enjoyed the atmosphere and balance of couples. I am not sure i would enjoy it if I attended mid week and found it full of lots of guys but the time at which I attended I felt very safe and comfortable and had a relaxing evening. Lockers are provided with a key that you return to reception - so no need to pack a Â£1 or to carry the key around for anyone who may be wondering.

Also parking is right outside on the street with a pay by phone app. Very convenient.
showerReviews.author: Lucy L

showerReviews.reviewText:
Friendly staff and warm welcome. Nice range of temperatures in the steam rooms, saunas, hot tubs and pool. The manager has a great sense of humour and I can imagine the only reason why people may have found her abrupt (which Iâ€™ve read in some reviews) was if they were breaking a rule (and the rules are in place to keep people safe and having an enjoyable experience). She was especially fantastic when I was getting changed at the end and had lost a contact lens by bringing in a little mirror with light to help me locate it! Thank you :-)

I went on the Saturday evening session from 5.30 and enjoyed the atmosphere and balance of couples. I am not sure i would enjoy it if I attended mid week and found it full of lots of guys but the time at which I attended I felt very safe and comfortable and had a relaxing evening. Lockers are provided with a key that you return to reception - so no need to pack a Â£1 or to carry the key around for anyone who may be wondering.

Also parking is right outside on the street with a pay by phone app. Very convenient.
showerReviews.author: Lucy L

showerReviews.reviewText: Really good huge space, manager inisist very firmly that this is naturalist spa and no hanky pinky, however top floor is lots of chill out areas with mirrored rooms etc clearly designed for play and staff avoid the area. The swimming pool steam rooms etc are truly awesome and this is definitely a place I would go back to

showerReviews.reviewText:
After three years, this gymâ€™s quality declined consistently. Thereâ€™s a scarcity of machines, the changing rooms and toilets are old and malodorous, perpetually humid.

Currently, a water leak plagues the menâ€™s changing room with no resolution in sight. Considering the issues, the high price tag doesnâ€™t match the experience.

Once my personal training sessions are over, Iâ€™m out!

showerReviews.reviewText: For the price point you'd expect the quality of equipment and facilities to be in a decent condition but unfortunately not. Though the staff are lovely and accommodating, and the location is perfect for the train station, the machines and equipment are old and tired, the showers don't have locks on the doors, and one of the female toilets doesn't even have a toilet seat on it with the other stall having toilet paper on the door hook instead of the toilet paper holder. This is only the cusp of the problems. The bathrooms and changing rooms look as though they are rarely cleaned and there appears to be an over abundance of cardio machines in comparison to squat racks (only 3!). I could go on, but at the end of the day I think it's clear I wouldn't recommend this gym. It needs a massive overhaul in terms of renovation, cleaning schedule and new machines.
showerReviews.author: Bella Reynolds

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member for around a year now, but I've cancelled my membership today. The place isn't being maintained, and in the short time I've been a member, it's deteriorated substantially. Mouldy showers, broken tiles, the steam room is rarely working, the dry heat sauna has a leaking ceiling its benches need repair.

On a positive note, the staff have always been friendly and supportive. The gym equipment seems OK but probably could do with updating.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stopped for something to eat, there was a Burger King there. We got lukewarm food, cold fries. This restaurant should be closed down because of the filth I haven't seen in a long time. Where is the food prepared, fries and leftovers on the floor, dirty tables and chairs. And there was uncollected rubbish and leftovers lying around. Where is the food hygiene control. It's a scandal that something like this still exists in the 21st century. We will never go back there and will warn our friends and acquaintances about this service.

showerReviews.reviewText: I didnâ€™t stay in one of their rooms, just stopped off for a 45 minute break, went to the counter, validated my token and was asked if Iâ€™d like to shower or use the toilets and was directed to where I needed to go. Facilities and supplies are plentiful and staff were not only very polite and friendly, but also falling over themselves to help with whatever I asked. Food looked and smelled amazing (I was gutted to be completely devoid of any sort of an appetite during my visit) and was very reasonably priced indeed. showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing place. Yes it's get full fast, yes it's on a slope  in some places..... but.... food is absolutely winner 10/10

Top price (as you have a few options) is Â£35 with Â£12 food voucher. Other options  are for Â£6/Â£31  and so on. Â£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  Â£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

All place  very clean and tidy, don't forget to take token for a shower(7min plenty enough)  shower  room with massive space and regulated temperature of water ðŸ˜ŽðŸ’¦ðŸ˜ so in summer - winner.

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at Â£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, weâ€™ll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didnâ€™t. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but itâ€™s let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText:
Reliable stop for fuel & convenience. With a 24/7 Londis shop, it offers a fresh bakery, coffee machine, and Subway sandwiches, making it a versatile pitstop. The station also includes a car wash & cashpoint. The staff are friendly, and the shop is well-stocked for quick grabs or late-night needs. Looks a bit tired, could do with a refresh.

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment I drove into the Esso petrol station, I knew this was going to be no ordinary fuel stop. It was a journey into an oasis of automotive care and exceptional service.

First, I treated my car to a spa day in their self-service wash bay. The equipment was state-of-the-art, user-friendly, and incredibly efficient, leaving my car sparkling like a diamond under the summer sun. The water pressure was perfect, and the soap suds had a delightful aroma that made the whole experience surprisingly enjoyable.

Next, I moved on to the air pump station. Here too, Esso impressed with its precision and ease of use. The air pump was like a gentle giant, perfectly inflating my tyres to the ideal pressure, ensuring a smoother, safer drive. It was a breeze to use, and my car seemed to drive away happier for it.

The screen wash top-up was another highlight. The fluid was of top-notch quality, leaving my windshield crystal clear with a streak-free finish. It's the little things that make a big difference, and Esso clearly understands this.

But the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance was the super petrol fuel. This wasn't just fuel; it was like a performance enhancer for my car. The engine purred with contentment, and I could feel the difference in power and smoothness as I drove away. It was as if my car had been given a new lease on life.

Throughout my visit, the station was immaculate, well-organized, and radiated a sense of pride in service. The staff, though I had little interaction with them, were smiling and ready to assist.

In conclusion, this Esso petrol station isn't just a place to fill up your car. It's a haven for vehicle enthusiasts and anyone who wants to give their car the treatment it deserves. Five stars don't do justice to the exceptional experience I had. Esso, you've set a new standard for petrol stations everywhere!
showerReviews.author: Jake

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a HGV driver after 12 plus hour day i do look forward to a hot shower in clean facilities. On the whole in nearly 40yrs on the road, I have put up with some terrible facilities, even temporary ones when updates are in progress but this evening (11/11/25) the temporary shower (only 1) provided was freezing cold in a shower room which was awash, floor and flat surfaces soaking wet.
Found a staff member who confirmed shower was cold, next staff member (smiths) went to find manager, manager finished at 18.00 so at 18.10 I was left with............... no solution, no alternative  offered. Unlike other services providers who actually set up a room in motel for drivers to shower, MOTO doesn't.
So so fortunate I hadn't actually paid for my parking first. I departed, disappointed as yet another huge provider of service's to the motorist and rinses them while doing it, sticks 2 fingers up at the men and women who transports this country's goods 24/7/365.
showerReviews.author: Andy Martin

showerReviews.reviewText:
Itâ€™s the last chance, or the first I guess, to  have a wee, get fuel, food, papers or just a coffee on the M1 Motorway. I didnâ€™t used to like it much because the potholes were big enough to take your tyre of its rim and I dread to think how many were and how the Miriad of delivery mopeds coped. The certainly didnâ€™t need traffic calming measures but guess what? They had the biggest road humps I think Iâ€™ve ever seen.
Anyway thank the gods all those problems have gone. Tarmac is good and smooth and the traffic humps are normal. The most used part of the services are always the toilets and these are placed through the front entrance and down to ,the right. There is a Game Zone on the corner. Due to it being just below ground level the are both a few steps and a ramp for the less mobile of us. Toilets are fine with the weird Dyson hand driers stolen from scooter handlebars but they work great despite that. Coming out of the â€œLooâ€™s â€œ there is a Waitrose and then WH Smithâ€™s on your right and then round to the left you have Subway and then Burger King. To finish the food and drink there is a Starbucks as you come in the Services entrance who have a sit in and an outside seating area for when itâ€™s nice weather. Outside there is a washing machine pod where you can wash upto 20kg  (or so the sign says).
There are 24 Tesla superchargers then 4 Grid serve chargers by the walkway to the entrance and all round the outside left of the car park (with your back to the entrance) there are 24 charging points, but Iâ€™m not sure of the company who operates them,

locations.title: Four Points Flex by Sheraton Brighton
locations.address: îƒˆ139-141 Kings Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 2NA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Budget seafront hotel.

Delivers what you should expect from a budget seafront hotel in an old building, but with room for improvement.

The photos clearly show the standard of accommodation.
Breakfast is basic, not worth paying the Â£12.50 unless itâ€™s included in your rate.
Staff are very good.

The major negatives to be aware of (some of which management could fix!):
No in-room safe.
No air-con â€“ my room was unbearably hot even with the windows open in November.
Poor shower pressure.
As with some older properties, the floors are squeaky and not level, with poor noise isolation overall.

Higher-tier Marriott Bonvoy members should NOT expect to receive a good room upgrade â€“ as a top-tier Bonvoy member, I was given one of the smallest rooms without a view, when many better rooms were available.

Note for Marriott Bonvoy Elite members that stays at Four Points Flex:
(1) earn only ONE Elite night credit for every two nights stayed
(2) earn HALF the number of Bonvoy points compared to the majority of other Marriott brands

P.s. Note that this was previously the The Kingâ€™s Hotel until July 2025.
showerReviews.author: Michael C

showerReviews.reviewText:
Seadragon was a pretty basic hostel overall. The price was very fair, and the amenities reflect the budget accordingly. The beds were comfy, but there is no curtain or anything for privacy. There is a power strip of outlets near the bottom bunk bed for the entire bed, so the person at the top must have a long wire to reach the top, which might be in the way of the person below. There is no surface near the top bunk for placing anything, such as a phone or book. Most other hostels have a small shelf or a bag that hangs for small items beside the bed. The room I stayed in had a reading light for each bed that clipped onto the railing, and 4 out of 4 of the lights did not turn on. My roommates and I all tried ours and discovered they were a useless accessory. This meant the only way to have light in the room was the overhead light, or individual flash lights.

There are not many bathrooms, but they are all individual which is nice for privacy. However, this means if three people want to shower at the same time, you cannot use a toilet. This was also the worst shower I've ever had in a hostel. The showerhead was very tall, probably about 1.8m high, and it had the "rainfall" shower head, but the pressure was so low that the water came out as a light drizzle, and by the time it reached me, it was cold, even when the heat was set to the highest setting. It was the most ineffective and useless shower system, I would have been better off filling a cup in the sink and rinsing off with that.

As far as reception: when I booked the reservation, I had a received an email from the hostel that confirmed my check in date and stated that "Reception is currently open 10am to 5pm, If you are arriving after reception hours, please contact us so we can email you self check-in details for late check-in." However, when I messaged them on the day of my check in to tell them I would arrive at 3pm (before reception was supposed to close), they responded that "reception is operating on reduced hours, closing at 1pm" which should have been communicated in the original email or as soon as the decision to close reception early had been made. One would think that, since they had known the date of my check in when sending the confirmation email, they would be able to see at that time whether or not reception was operating on normal hours or not BEFORE sending an email with incorrect info. During my two night stay, I never met a single employee or staff member of the hostel. It felt very impersonal and strange.

OVERALL though, for what you pay, it's suitable and tolerable. Bedding and facilities seemed clean, which is a key detail for many. The location is a bit far from the main attractions in Brighton, but still less than a 20 minute walk. I would not stay here again, but I would not say that my preferences are a deal breaker for everyone.
showerReviews.author: Mika

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked this hostel for Pride weekend and couldnâ€™t have asked for a better locationâ€”super central and easy to get to. The instructions for accessing the building and our room were clear and straightforward, which made arrival smooth.

We were a group of six sharing a room. The space was decent, but it did get quite warm and stuffy. Thankfully, the staff provided a fan, and when that wasnâ€™t enough, they quickly brought us a second one. Big shoutout to the teamâ€”they were incredibly helpful and responsive throughout our stay.

A few cleanliness issues to note:

â€¢ The toilet bowl was stained and could really use a deep clean with proper bleach.
â€¢ The shower worked fine, but there was visible mould around the baseâ€”something a quick spray could fix.
â€¢ Doors had noticeable hand marks and could do with a good wipe down, especially since rooms are shared by strangers.

Overall though I would deffo recommend staying here and would happily book again! :)

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked this hostel for Pride weekend and couldnâ€™t have asked for a better locationâ€”super central and easy to get to. The instructions for accessing the building and our room were clear and straightforward, which made arrival smooth.

We were a group of six sharing a room. The space was decent, but it did get quite warm and stuffy. Thankfully, the staff provided a fan, and when that wasnâ€™t enough, they quickly brought us a second one. Big shoutout to the teamâ€”they were incredibly helpful and responsive throughout our stay.

A few cleanliness issues to note:

â€¢ The toilet bowl was stained and could really use a deep clean with proper bleach.
â€¢ The shower worked fine, but there was visible mould around the baseâ€”something a quick spray could fix.
â€¢ Doors had noticeable hand marks and could do with a good wipe down, especially since rooms are shared by strangers.

Overall though I would deffo recommend staying here and would happily book again! :)
showerReviews.author: Antony Pilmoor

showerReviews.reviewText: Many people are there long term and I thought it was interesting that they requested I paid via bank transfer but I was having issues and they were very accommodating and let me pay in person. showerReviews.reviewText: Rooms are clean, with a large bathroom. Staff was very nice, the bar/lounge area is very enjoyable as well and you couldn't find a better location if you tried. It is literally right on the beach front. There are no lockers in the rooms though (at least mine didn't have any).
showerReviews.author: Emma Le Hecho (MagicalMusic15)

showerReviews.reviewText:
The good: The view from our room was amazing. We had a clear view over the Brighton coast and a small view of the sea from our room. The bed was relatively comfortable and the room was spacious, but thatâ€™s where the pleasantries end.

The bad: Our first shock of the trip comes from when we entered the door, and we were made aware it was a hostel, not a hotel. There was extremely little advertising that this was not a hotel, and after looking at other reviews, this seems to be a common complaint. After this shock, we sat down in the lobby as we had arrived quite early (thatâ€™s not their fault to be fair). We asked roughly when the room would be ready and we were met with so much uncertainty we were worried weâ€™d even booked the room. We then tried to check in after roughly 2 hours of waiting for the room to be ready, only to be met with surprise forms and ID checks. This is our first time travelling together, so this may be common place practice, yet the service was quite frankly rude and mean. We asked why we had to do this and we were met with a face being pulled and a very abrupt â€œJust do it.â€ After another hour of filling in forms, we finally arrived at our room, and in their favour, the room was initially quite good. It was spacious and the bed was comfy, yet then we entered the bathroom, and found that the bathtub was out of order, but more on that later. We then checked the shower, only to find that the shower head could not stay up on its own. After requesting a fix from the desk and waiting another two hours, our request was fixed, so props to them for that. Now, we had paid extra for breakfast and, if Iâ€™m honest, we were not pleased. The food was luke warm at best, and the general selection was just poor. A weird mix between a full English breakfast and a continental breakfast. This just irked us the wrong, and really cemented a 2/5 for us.

The ugly: Now, as mentioned before the bath was out of order, and after a quick glance inside, it was made apparent this was because of a mysterious substance that was inside the tub. I donâ€™t know wether the cleaning staff didnâ€™t want to or couldnâ€™t get it out (I donâ€™t know which is worse) but we had paid for a bathtub, and so we expected a bathtub. We will be enquiring as to a partial refund for this, as the room in total cost us ~Â£130 for the night. After doing some research ourselves, we found a travel lodge room for a family of 4 costing the same. And I bet they at-least had a working shower at time of check in.
showerReviews.author: Harry Heywood

locations.title: Kipps Brighton
locations.address: îƒˆ76 Grand Parade, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 9JA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: My room was on 4th floor and came with a kettle, coffee/milk sachets, a TV, a sink and 2 singles which suited my group well. I felt the room was too cold so I tried to put on the heater or the radiator, but neither were working at the time. We had to message the company to ask for the heating to go on and they replied promptly  saying that the heating will automatically turn on for a few hours each evening, but we didn't notice it turn on whilst we were in the room. To access the hotel and rooms the company send 2 codes to enter the main door and another to release the key from the key-safe that is on the wall outside of the room which worked well.  I think each floor has its own communal bathroom. Annoyingly the communal room with shower/toilet on my floor was small. Overall it was an okay place to stay for a short time in my opinion and it's in a good location very close to Brighton Pier, and even closer to the famous Pavilion gardens and to the famous Brighton Lanes
showerReviews.author: Marco Cioni

showerReviews.reviewText:
TOTAL SCAM!! AVOID!!!!

This place is a complete joke. Itâ€™s advertised as a hotel but feels more like someoneâ€™s rundown house. The moment I arrived, I knew something was off. Thereâ€™s no reception, no staff, no welcome. Just a code to get in and a weird feeling like I was intruding on someoneâ€™s private home.

The room itself was shocking. The â€œen suiteâ€ isnâ€™t even separated by a wall â€“ just a curtain in the corner of the room hiding a shower. No privacy whatsoever. Youâ€™re literally sleeping a metre away from the dirty sink. Itâ€™s uncomfortable, awkward and honestly disgusting.

Water stopped running from the shower half way through it. No hot water, no pressure, NOT. A. SHOWER.

For the price, itâ€™s daylight robbery. No service, no proper facilities, no soundproofing, no comfort. I felt completely misled by the photos and description. If youâ€™re expecting a proper hotel stay, do yourself a favour and book literally anywhere else.

A total scam. Never again.
showerReviews.author: Gabriel Garcia Lippe

showerReviews.reviewText: The room was clean, spacious, and the location was excellentâ€”just a short walk to Brighton Beach, pubs, and restaurants. However, the bathroom facilities were very disappointing. There was no hot water or water pressure, making it impossible to shower. I contacted the hotel multiple times via email and the booking app but received no meaningful response. A late reply promised maintenance, but no one showed up. Even the communal toilet had issuesâ€”clogged and no hot water. I also left a Â£10 facewash behind and never received a reply when I messaged to collect it. Great location, but poor service and unresponsive management. Would not stay again.
showerReviews.author: Jitender Singh Shekhawat

showerReviews.reviewText: Location good and the worker was nice but it was an awful experience. We booked a room that was seemingly decent in size but on arrival were placed on almost the top floor in a tiny room which my boyfriend had to duck his head to enter. Looked nothing like online photos. We were lucky enough to walk past the worker who helped us get in as we werenâ€™t given the correct code. Sheets were clean but the floor was dusty and the place smelt of smoke and other substances. Huge gap under our door and could hear other people in their rooms. The floor was tilted and it felt like we were walking on a boat, like it was going to break. There were cigarette buts all below the window on the roof of the lower floor, and we couldnâ€™t open our window as it was broken and held by a screw. It was humid and dusty, so hot. The worst part is that when we were home, we recieved an email that we were charged Â£20 for a stained towel but when checking out, we left the door open for cleaning, so feel like someone put their stained one in our room. There was no invoice for the charge and it was taken without notice or conversation. We yet have to deal with this. It is definitely worth spending a few hundred extra for a nice place, as it made the whole Brighton trip feel like a misery. We left as soon as we could and even considered sleeping in the car instead
showerReviews.author: Lizzy Rose

locations.title: YHA South Downs
locations.address: îƒˆYHA South Downs, Itford Farm, Beddingham, Lewes BN8 6JS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Right next to the train station. Plenty of parking. Easy check in. Lovely lounge and kitchen areas. Nice cafe serving hot food and drinks. The room was a bit small and noisy as you'd expect. There was a green light that kept the room lit up, so that was a bit annoying, and I had to sleep with the windows open, because even though the thermostat was set to 6 degrees, it was above 26. There were 4 shower rooms and 3 toilets for 7 rooms, but you are able to go to other areas to use the toilet.

They'd partnered with Waitrose to provide drinking water fountains.

It was great value for money.
showerReviews.author: Maggie Cheung

showerReviews.reviewText: I wish I didnâ€™t have to leave such a poor review as I stayed in lots YHA years ago, but for Â£100 for a cabin, ours was infested with wood lice (one fell on me during the night)! And again for that price we had to share two showers with a building full of school aged children, which seems odd. Location was far from everything, which we didnâ€™t realize - closest pub was quoted asÂ£60 return by cab, especially as the roads were closed. Staff was nice but they just said there should have been no wood lice when we mentioned it. Linens were clean. But again, when we went to get dinner, given there is not much else around, they didnâ€™t defrost the fish for fish and chips. I wouldnâ€™t recommend it.

locations.address: îƒˆS Downs Way, Shoreham-by-Sea BN43 5FB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This was my first experience of staying at a youth hostel and I was really impressed. The location is lovely, right on the South Downs Way with views down to the coast. I booked a private room which was very clean and comfortable and the nearby shared facilities were well kept. The shower was great, hot and powerful and just what I needed after a long day of walking. I took advantage of the burger and beer offer in the cafe which was really good value for money and very tasty. Breakfast was plentiful with self service for continental options and the cooked breakfast made to order. All the staff I encountered were really helpful and friendly and from what I observed in their interaction with other  guests it seemed that nothing was too much trouble. Well done Truleigh Hill, you have inspired me to try youth hostelling again in the future ðŸ˜Š

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.  Rooms AND building is filthy. rundown isnâ€™t the word itâ€™s more like a crack den meets concentration camp.  Cant get hold of any staff even though their reception is apparently 24 hours. Itâ€™s impossible to get a reply for anything. They are quick to take your money but returning it is another matter. Still waiting for my Â£100.00 deposit to be returned 17 days tomorrow. How they take a deposit for that place is beyond me, you canâ€™t possibly make that place any worse. Shower had no door just a curtain. We had a half used wet toilet roll left for us. We couldnâ€™t even find hand soap! Which is absolutely just appalling. The beds were stained mattresses with a plastic sheet over. I genuinely couldnâ€™t believe my eyes. We had no heating, all the walls and skirting are cracked chipped and terrible with paint slapped over it. We had dirty mugs in our room, half the plug sockets didnâ€™t work, our door had definitely at some point been kicked as you could see a huge chunk of the wood missing in the lock of the frame. This is the first hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in where I havenâ€™t wanted to take my shoes off.

But thatâ€™s not all. When I complained I got sent pictures to say it was similar and in fact they had not been misleading with the pictures. Laughable well, Iâ€™ve uploaded the pictures so you be the judge of that. No matter how cheap you need to budget a stay PAY MORE AND GO SOMEWHERE ELES!

showerReviews.reviewText: The hotel was absolutely awful. The shared toilet was disgusting. With the sink ripped out, leaving the pipes loose and an out of order shower. The carpet in the room was dusty in the corners and sticky. The blinds wouldn't work in the room, I had to get the receptionist to come and close them. I flew from Prague and because the listing said free toiletries, I didn't bring any.  The free toiletries, were hand and body wash. No shampoo or anything else. The shower in the room was so caked with limescale only a dribble of water came out. Certainly not worth the exorbitant cost. I would expect so much more for the Â£153 I paid for one night. I have stayed in Brighton on many occasions, in much cheaper rooms, and have only ever had positive experiences. Such a shame.
showerReviews.author: Trudi Purdy

locations.title: Hudsons Guest House
locations.address: îƒˆ22 Devonshire Pl, Kemptown, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 1QA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Dirtiest and noisiest place I have ever stayed in. Rooms are small, covered in dust and debris, and rubbish left from previous guests. Only the bed linen were freshly changed. The bathroom doors don't close, and the shower has loads of rust, black mold and is just not clean. Windows are bolted shut, however they remain open and there is no way to close nor open them manually. We tried to talk to the woman in reception, and said after 7-8 years working there these issues have never been brought up. She went on about how much money they spent on refurbishing the place. We inquired about the room we booked, she confirmed pictures in Booking.com are several years old, and they don't have any intention to change them. She then had a phone call with someone speaking loudly from reception about the fact we came to complain, and saying she priced rooms low so that "guests don't have high expectations". We are never coming back to this attempt of a guesthouse, and I would strongly recommend anyone to stay far from them too.
showerReviews.author: Mario Medina Arranz

They advertise â€œseparate washroom,â€ but in reality I had to go outside and use one that was four doors away. The washroom itself was unbelievably tiny with no ventilation â€“ impossible to use without feeling trapped. I went back to reception straight away, but there was no one there. I pressed the bell, waited more than 20 minutes, tried calling many times, and still got no response. Their â€œ24/7 front deskâ€ is a total lie. Disgusting service, misleading advertising, and a waste of money. Donâ€™t book this place.

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed with four friends at Chalky Downs for 15 days while we were waiting for completion on our houses, and it was incredible! For such a reasonable price, the location is absolutely beautiful and so peaceful, with everything we needed. There are three showers and five bathrooms, plenty of plug sockets, and even a kettle! The staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful, and they had everything well stocked, such as fire pits, logs and kindling. My friends and I made such amazing memories here, and Iâ€™d highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great camping experience.

Weâ€™ll be back!
showerReviews.author: Mike Cobb

showerReviews.reviewText: Pegs and Pitches is a truly special campsite. The pitches are private and peaceful, the facilities are spotless, and the eco-friendly touches make it feel unique, especially the hot water bucket showers . Evenings by the fire and the calm of the countryside made it the perfect escape. The staff are welcoming and clearly care about every detail. Already looking forward to coming back!

showerReviews.reviewText: Once again I had the most wholesome stay at Wild Boar Wood! Such a gorgeous woodland with all the young green leaves coming out, blue bells flowering and insane birdsong in the mornings. The new wardens, Nikita and Suki, have done a marvellous job setting this place up again and looking after it and their campers. It's been such a pleasure and inspiration getting to know them a little. The bell tents are well equipped and so nice to wake up in. The facilities are great. Clean and functional. Bucket showers... BEST way to shower ever! Hot water from a tap or wood burner. It's just an all around lovely place to be. I will never get tired of watching the steam train on the bluebell railway chuffing past either. THANK YOU to the whole team at Pegs&Pitches for a memorable time. Will definitely be back! Have a great season x

The toilets, showers and washing up area are all eco and chemical free, there was always plenty of hot water. You can hire a fire pit and buy logs. We'll be back! Thank you

Stayed at the Secret Campsite near Hastings. Great little campsite, very peaceful and perfect if you want to feel like you want to camp in the wild but still have your creature comforts (there is a loo and hot running water for a shower).
The Hosts are great people, super helpful. Don't really understand some of the one star reviews here, this is proper camping - not glamping. We loved it, will definitely be going back and we are taking all our friends!

Car free camping field which makes camping with toddlers less stressful.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really rude staff. Poor facilities - only one toilet for about 100 campers in Our section on a busy weekend,  it was blocked and not cleaned out the entire weekend. More toilets (approx 4) available in the family campsite but this is a further walk away.

The two showers in our campsite were broken and we had to queue to use the only one available in the family campsite.

When we asked for some help with our tent we were sworn at and I could hear them talking and laughing about it when I walked away. Very unprofessional. Put us off asking for any further help during our stay. I have a disability so was quite uncomfortable for the remainder of my stay knowing the staff members would not assist with any problems we had.

Could be a lovely place if the staff were more professional and had some basic customer service skills.
showerReviews.author: Kat M

showerReviews.reviewText: Â£140 for 2 nights and it was pretty much an empty tent with an inflatable bed. Nowhere to charge phones, even had to take our own rubbish home with us (instructed to by the proprietor) as they didn't have the facilities to dispose of it on site. We were pretty much completely self-sufficient for the whole weekend. The breakfast roll on Saturday was delivered along with tea, coffee, and orange juice. It was hot and tasty but was extremely overpriced at Â£7 per-head. The showers were no-frills, functional, but relatively decent. However I still say you are better off paying less and taking your own tent along with phone charging capability. It's cheaper and you know what you're getting. Â£140 each for 2 nights is an extortionate price for effectively just letting people sleep in a field you own. Will never be going back.
showerReviews.author: rosson1983

Great campsite, as other reviews said the toilets are immaculately clean, modern and flushable. The showers looked great too, also fridges, sockets and further basins by the washing up area.

There's also a cute, extremely thoughtfully stocked shop/coffee shop at the reception, the coffee and croissant was delicious!!

Very handy for the South Downs Way route which I walked some of. The only note on location is you can hear traffic, didn't bother me at all but could potentially others.

Everyone I spoke to was so friendly, I'll be back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a little gem of a campsite, hubby and I booked for 5 nights wanting to visit Brightion amd surrounding areas. Large but very tranquil site. We stayed on a serviced pitch, one tip get proper pegs if booking on a serviced pitch.

Knowing that the site is non profit for a lovely charity supporting those with vision issues made our choice seem even better.

The wardens both the older lady and younger girl were very pleasant and friendly  (sorry I didn't get names). We arrived much earlier than the normal check in time and as the pitch was available we were able to get on earlier.

The toilet block is clean and the pressure on the showers were something else!

I understand you can hire fire pits although we didn't need too.

Location is great 15 minute walk to Hassocks town and about 20 minute walk to train station where you travel to Eastbourne, London, Brighton etc.

Gates are locked at 11pm which adds to the sense of security and one of the only sites that allows day visitors at no cost. A couple of family members joined us for one day and stopped over at a very moderate extra cost.

We decided we needed bikes to get around and not wanting to pay the hire fees in town we purchased some locally on Marketplace - they were a god send and the lovely gardener loaned us his spanner to adjust the seats.

The countryside is spectacular and Brighton very vibrant.

Check out time of noon enabled a smooth and less chaotic set down and we will shortly be doing our second leg of our travels.

Faultless site and we would definitely come again and maybe upgrade to Electric bikes!
showerReviews.author: Michelle Acuna

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a little gem of a campsite, hubby and I booked for 5 nights wanting to visit Brightion amd surrounding areas. Large but very tranquil site. We stayed on a serviced pitch, one tip get proper pegs if booking on a serviced pitch.

Knowing that the site is non profit for a lovely charity supporting those with vision issues made our choice seem even better.

The wardens both the older lady and younger girl were very pleasant and friendly  (sorry I didn't get names). We arrived much earlier than the normal check in time and as the pitch was available we were able to get on earlier.

The toilet block is clean and the pressure on the showers were something else!

I understand you can hire fire pits although we didn't need too.

Location is great 15 minute walk to Hassocks town and about 20 minute walk to train station where you travel to Eastbourne, London, Brighton etc.

Gates are locked at 11pm which adds to the sense of security and one of the only sites that allows day visitors at no cost. A couple of family members joined us for one day and stopped over at a very moderate extra cost.

The countryside is spectacular and Brighton very vibrant.

Check out time of noon enabled a smooth and less chaotic set down and we will shortly be doing our second leg of our travels.

Faultless site and we would definitely come again and maybe upgrade to Electric bikes!

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed at Southdown Way Caravan & Camping Park a week ago and found an excellent location and friendly staff.The site was fairly well maintained but unfortunately the shower and toilet block were very poor indeed and would benefit from full renovation work. There are only 6 toilets and showers for women and the same for men. This is a huge site which caters for caravans, camper vans, motor homes and tents and there are just not enough toilet/showers for the numbers who are on site at any one time. The  standard of cleanliness was very poor too, very disappointing as it was more than Â£50 per night for our serviced pitch and for that kind of money you expect a higher standard.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited the LivingWell Health Club at the DoubleTree by Hilton Brighton Metropole and had a really good experience. The gym is well equipped with everything you need for a solid workout, from cardio machines to a decent range of weights. It is not the biggest gym in the world, but it is well maintained and never felt overcrowded.

The pool area was the highlight for me. The swimming pool is a comfortable size for proper laps, and the water was pleasantly warm. The sauna and steam room were both clean, relaxing, and exactly what you want after a long day â€” a proper little escape.

Overall, the facilities are well looked after and offer good value. A great spot if you want a workout followed by a bit of relaxation. I left feeling refreshed and would happily return.
showerReviews.author: Donald Hp Majurira

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked a last minute trip down to Brighton for a 2 night stay in August with my 2 teenage children. I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised with how nice and clean this hotel was for it being an "old" hotel. Our room was clean, bright and spacious with a lovely seaview and huge balcony. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. My son was even comfortable on the pull out bed which can be hit-or-miss in some hotels. The bathroom was a little odd-the layout was strange and the shower was tiny for how big the room and bathroom were. It also didn't have a very luxurious feel to it, although it was fine.
The location was perfect for us for walking around to the pier, shops, and restaurants we wanted to go to. We were impressed by the lobby and hallways with the tall ceilings and chandeliers and giant staircase. We really felt like we were in a fancy historic hotel. We enjoyed skipping the lift and walking up and down the main staircase instead. Breakfast was decent, nothing spectacular although the dining room was very grand and pretty. We checked out the pool and gym. Although it seemed great and fully equipped with everything we may have wanted to use, we ultimately did not choose to use it because it felt a little stuffy being down in the basement level. Overall a great experience and would stay here again if we want a seaside escape from London!
showerReviews.author: Victoria F.

showerReviews.reviewText:
