showerReviews.reviewText:
Dania and her team were brilliant. They helped us pick the most appropriate property and room for our needs (they have seven properties to choose from in Brighton) and sorted out the on-street parking permits we needed (obviously, there is an additional charge for the permits).

We had a minor maintenance issue when we were there (caused by the previous guests) and requested housekeeping on one occasion (housekeeping is on demand, so no need to worry about them banging on your door to change the towels at inconvenient times). In both cases, the reception team were a text away (you can call them if you prefer) and both requests were dealt with promptly - housekeeping were in fact there within 3 minutes of me texting!

Friendly professionalism from every team member we encountered, either via text or in person.

The location was great and the room was perfect for our needs - Room 2 has the full kitchen, which we didn't use other than the kettle and fridge, but it gives you extra space to move around and leaves the bedroom to be just that, as they feel like two separate rooms.
showerReviews.author: Gary Coventry Coyle

showerReviews.reviewText:
Self-check-in was fuss-free; the day before our stay we were emailed instructions that were clear and we had no issues. The room itself (G/F, room 2) was lovely, more a studio apartment, with fitted kitchen and so-on and it was, apart from some water staining to the bedroom ceiling from an obvious leak and the inside handle to the shower room was becoming detached but I am genuinely just nit-picking because it's how we found the room. The room itself had everything we needed (and more besides) for our brief stay, and it was in great order (nitpicking aside), decently sized and comfortable. The bed extremely soft and decent pillows and lovely bedding supplied, oh and the concealed TV in the base/footboard, a nice touch!

We can't comment about other rooms, or floors, only the check-in and room 2 experience and summarising: decent location (Brighton on the Beach venue at the end of the road, the pier around 8 to 10 minutes' away); decent space and amenities and a decent price, too. Oh, and relatedly, if you need somewhere to park, the Buzz Bingo car park is in Eastern Rd, about 5 minutes away and Â£18/24hr and worked well for our stay.

The answer is an emphatic "yes", asked whether we would stay again! And we likely will, too!
showerReviews.author: Stu & Curly GILES

Despite being a paying member, I faced constant issues at Leys Leisure Centre. The membership card access didnâ€™t work for the entire year, forcing long queues at reception to log in manually â€” often with only one staff member assisting while others stood around chatting. The app and website were unusable, making it impossible to manage or cancel my membership.

Facilities were frequently unavailable due to refurbishments, and swimming sessions were regularly interrupted by lifeguard breaks. The sauna was consistently dirty, and the cold water showers near it remained broken despite multiple complaints. Overall, the centre failed to meet basic standards of cleanliness, professionalism, and customer service.

Iâ€™ve now cancelled my membership after being charged Â£70 without warning, and I wouldnâ€™t recommend this centre to anyone seeking reliable or respectful service.

locations.title: Ferry Leisure Centre
locations.address: îƒˆDiamond Pl, Summertown, Oxford OX2 7DP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Since MORE started managing the centre, there are changes for the better but more, in my opinion, for the worse.
Gym. Replacing the old machines with new and modern ones is on the plus side and their maintenance is better. However, all the cardio machines - treadmills, bikes, rowers, elliptical machines are now jammed in a small narrow space with poor or no air conditioning. You walk in from the air-conditioned corridor and are hit by warm and stuffy air and a stink of sweat. Now there is no air conditioning in the whole gym.
Changing rooms. New showers in the pool changing room and a new coat of paint (already peeling off at places though) in the dry changing - good. However, since the wet changing was closed for refurbishment, the dry changing room is a mess: rubbish and pools of water on the floor everywhere and the toilets are often disgusting. The reaction of one of the ladies at the reception was: â€œBut now people come there from the pool to change!â€, implying What do you expect? Well, exactly because of that and because MORE people use the showers and toilets, anyone would expect the staff to mop the floor and clean the toilets MORE often. Also, the hand and hair dryers didnâ€™t work last Monday.
Pool. For years before MORE has taken over, the midday lane swimming was available at set times without any problems. Now, nothing is certain, they change the timetable from day to day and from week to week or cancel the sessions altogether in favour of other activities or for unknown reasons. The staff argue that there are morning and evening sessions. Yes, but not everyone is able to do vigorous exercise early in the morning or close to bedtime, and there are people who can only come at their lunch breaks. Besides, it will be dark in the evenings and mornings soon and some people, especially elderly or disabled, may be unable or reluctant to walk or drive to the centre in the darkness.
Overall, the centre has the lowest rating of all the public leisure facilities managed by MORE in Oxford. Is it something that should be taken with the city council? Some of the problems, not all though, may be due to the current refurbishment situation, but we are paying the same membership fees while the conditions and services have substantially deteriorated, and the refurbishment is planned for a few more months.
showerReviews.author: Larisa

locations.title: Barton Leisure Centre
locations.address: îƒˆWaynflete Road, Oxford OX3 8GA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a very distressing experience at this swimming pool.

When we arrived, there was no lifeguard present, yet other swimmers were allowed into the pool. As a parent, I sat poolside to supervise my child, which is entirely reasonable in the absence of a lifeguard. Despite this, I was repeatedly challenged by a member of staff.

Rules were applied inconsistently and selectively. Safety rules were ignored when it suited others, but were repeatedly and rigidly enforced against my child and myself. My child was also told to stop using equipment based on unclear guidance, which we immediately complied with.

After multiple confrontations, my child became extremely upset, stopped swimming, and cried, stating that he felt singled out and discriminated against. He is normally a confident and competitive swimmer, yet this experience left him anxious and fearful of swimming.

Regardless of intent, the impact on a childâ€™s emotional wellbeing was significant. A swimming facility should prioritise safety, consistency, and safeguarding, especially where children are concerned. Unfortunately, this was not our experience.
showerReviews.author: Dandan Qin

showerReviews.reviewText:
Extremely Disappointed with Service at Barton Leisure Centre

I am truly disappointed with my experience at Barton Leisure Centre. From the start, the service was far below expectations, and I encountered several issues that have left a very negative impression of the facility.

One of the most upsetting experiences occurred when my partner and I arrived lateâ€”around 10 to 15 minutesâ€”for an aqua class. We were eager to join the class, but when we approached the swimming pool, the coach refused to let us in. Instead of explaining the policy or offering a helpful solution, the coach spoke to us in a rude and dismissive manner. This was not only unprofessional but completely unnecessary. Since that incident, we have not returned to the gym. We even made an effort to give it another chance by trying to use the swimming pool again, but we left almost immediately due to the negative atmosphere.

The overall environment at the gym felt unwelcoming, with staff attitudes that lacked basic courtesy. The customer service is absolutely terrible, and the gym itself isnâ€™t as clean as it should be. We have been so put off by the experience that we tried calling them on the 21st of this month to cancel our membership as we are not going anyway. However, we were told that we had to give a one-month notice period and that we would still be charged for the next month. This feels incredibly unfair, especially since we have no intention of ever returning. Iâ€™ve never experienced such poor service in my life, and itâ€™s frustrating to know they will take our money for a service we donâ€™t want.

In all my years of using gyms in London and Oxfordshire, I have never encountered such a negative experience. I would not recommend Barton Leisure Centre to anyone based on my experience, and I hope this feedback encourages them to improve their customer service and cleanliness.
PS: I shouldâ€™ve checked the ratings and read the reviews before signing up for the membership. If I had, I would have avoided this frustrating experience altogether.
showerReviews.author: neila KABLI

locations.title: Iffley Road Sports Centre
locations.address: îƒˆIffley Rd, Oxford OX4 1EQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is truly terrible. It's always filthy; covered in spiderwebs, dust, and chalk. Nobody has any incentive to clean their equipment after use because it's so dirty already. At least one of the (extremely limited) cardio machines is perpetually broken. The glass in front of the squat racks has been shattered for months. Most of the equipment is in absolutely awful condition, including the ragged bar pads and rusted cable machine attachments.

Last week I went for a workout and there was an enormous shard of glass in front of the rack (see photo). Unbelievable health and safety violation. When I reported it to the front desk the woman seemed totally unconcerned and unapologetic. Today in the women's changing rooms I watched a receptionist use the bathroom and return to the front desk without washing her hands.

I genuinely can't believe the university lets this place operate in this condition. The price you pay for what you get is extortionate. I'm gutted that this is the only gym within cycling distance of my house.

The only upside is the personal trainer, Paul, who is always cheerful and happy for a chat.
showerReviews.author: Sydney White

showerReviews.reviewText:
Regretfully, the gym does not seem to heed to constructive feedback. A litany of serious issues appear to fall on deaf ears so to speak.

Make sure you record time / date of any conversation with front of house/ gym reception team. For example, I was able to provide evidence of location, date , time and asked for cctv footage when it was brought to my attention Poppy ( gym supervisor) felt intimidated when I spoke to her about a health safety issue alongside the cobweb on gym equipment ( see photos attached ). Surprisingly, the gym had no veritable evidence of alleged intimidation. I do recall Poppy laughing at the picsâ€™ description.  Do you think the photos attached are hilarious for a gymâ€™s maintenance?

I have used this gym for many years living locally and as a student it is convenient. I have membership to better gyms which I rotate with Iffley Road sportsâ€™ club.

From my perspective, the staff at the gym have become laissez faire and extremely rude over the past couple of years especially reception front of house in terms of regulating gym and monitoring safety and well being.

For example, one particular personal trainer bullied my partner so often to hurry with equipment; she ceased her membership. He prioritised and monopolised gym equipment for his private fee 121 session.

Generally the entire gym / track seems to be in continuous disrepair. There are no notifications. You turn up and itâ€™s not uncommon something is awry.

At the moment the track is being repaired and the outdoor gym is affected by limited space which creates tension amongst users due to limited space.

Disabled menâ€™s toilet on/off out of use for months.
Menâ€™s toilet cubicle out of use for months.

1. The staff especially on reception seem bothered when you ask legitimate questions. Many a time, they are using their personal phones while allegedly working ( 5/6/25 ) is the most recent example where Poppy was upset I had troubled her over her teamâ€™s questionable etiquette.

2. I have reported potential health and safety issues only go be met with scorn.
I have photo evidence yet this seems superficial to the front of house reception.

3. Poppy  ( duty leader /front reception ) a typical over promise under deliver attitude especially after reporting one of her support team, Ruben for violating health and safety standards by talking to me while I was working out pushing a heavy loaded sled.
R.  thought I was creating drama when I mentioned his misdemeanour to Poppy after my workout.
Incredulously he was telling me to put away the weights after use while I was working out on a set!  Despite Poppy promising to send an email to acknowledge my complaint within a time date she miraculously failed to do so. I asked her upon my next visit why this was the case but she was too occupied using her personal phone with a buddy at reception and giggling away.

4. I have shown photos of floor damage inside gym where potentially anyone can twist/ sprain  an ankle or worse; alas to no avail; staff have laughed it off. The photo of the gym floor shows the disrepair alongside a sizeable piece of stone.

After 2 months of raising this potential issue it was finally rectified.

5. Gym equipment with cobwebs while the staff amble around glued to personal phones not interested in genuine feedback.

6. Gym membership cancelled each month by defective gym software for past six months yet the blame is directed at me and, more recently, my bank.
I be would turn up to gym have booked online a session in Pulse gym to be turned away on several occasions.

7. Many userâ€™s monopolise gym equipment and are on their phones which makes using equipment tiresome.

The gym is collectively used only by a select number of  serious people who want to have a productive workout.

The biggest red flag is the staff. Several tears ago there was a good productive vibe in the gym but nowadays itâ€™s very solemn.
showerReviews.author: Sharing Is Caring

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I could give zero stars, I would.

This gym is a wreck, yet they keep raising the prices â€” which, honestly, I'd love an explanation for. Are we paying extra for the ambiance of unchecked mould on the walls? Because I notified them about it over a year ago, and not only did they ignore it, but the mould has spread like itâ€™s aiming for a takeover.

The equipment? Old, broken, or just sticky with... whatever it is, because it clearly hasnâ€™t seen a cleaning cloth in ages. When a machine breaks, expect it to stay broken for months, like a permanent "Out of Order" exhibit.

And don't get me started on the mirrors and lighting. Half the mirrors are cracked or just gross, and the lights? Flip a coin if youâ€™re there at night; itâ€™s a game of â€œWill I Be Working Out in the Dark?â€ every time.

Summer workouts are an absolute joy, too â€” no air conditioning. But hey, theyâ€™ve got a big, dusty fan that looks like itâ€™s still holding onto particles from the pandemic. Real commitment to hygiene there.

So, bottom line? Save your money, your time, and maybe even your health.
showerReviews.author: Juno T

showerReviews.reviewText: Regarding the gym. The equipment is ageing and outright broken in some instances. It's OK but there are cheaper and more modern options in Oxford. They do take cleanliness seriously during covid times. The staff are excellent. The pool is OK but it's close to impossible to get a booking slot if you want to lane swim. I noticed, as a slow swimmer, the speed of the lanes wasn't always enforced which is irritating. Beware the parking. There is a constant shark swimming around waiting to plaster tickets on unsuspecting motorists despite the generous space they have up there.
showerReviews.author: Urban Haka

locations.title: White Horse Leisure and Tennis Centre
locations.address: îƒˆAudlett Drive, Abingdon, Oxfordshire OX14 3PJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is gross. Like disgusting gross. If you care about cleanliness in the least, it is not the gym for you. In the actual gym area, there are zero steps taken to encourage gym goers to wipe down sweaty equipment they use. In fact, about 50% of the time I arrive (2-3 days a week), there is no cleaning spray at any of the three stations, or there are no paper towels to use. Every time one is out, I have to walk to the front desk to request one of the two. About half of the time, thereâ€™s no actual cleaning spray or towels in the building - theyâ€™ve run out and neglected to get it ordered on time, and wonâ€™t get a substitute from a local store. The other half of the time they have it in stock, but nobody has bothered to check and refill any of the stations.

Gym goers sweat all over the machines, then walk away. There are no signs requesting people to wipe down machines. Even trainers working one-on-one with members have their person use a machine then leave without wiping it down. So cleaning is not taught or emphasized from the get go.

It is the responsibility of the gym to create some kind of culture of cleanliness. White Horse does the opposite.

I have arrived several times (today included) where I have either sat waiting for 30 minutes for someone to arrive with cleaning spray, or have not worked out at all because thereâ€™s no cleaning solution at all. I refuse to touch these disgusting machines without cleaning them first, since only about 1% of members wipe anything down. There have been days I have watched the gym full of 40 or so people, and track only one or two others who actually clean their gross sweat off the machines without cleaning theyâ€™ve used. This place would be shut down in the States.

I have complained many times, asked to speak to whomever is in charge. Sometimes I get validation, sometimes I get dismissed. But at the end of the day the same. thing. happens. Nothing changes. If I had access to literally anywhere else I would stop coming here.
showerReviews.author: Courtney Rolfe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Generally I love this swimming pool and I travel 20 minutes to get here rather than using my local. I find the booking process easy and it's usually much cleaner than others.
Lately though the Learners Pool isn't heated to the same celsius as before and it's been much less appealing for babies/ very young children. Their skin is turning purple after half an hour despite lots of splashing about and we struggle to stay the full hour. On the other hand the showers are then scalding hot so we also can't stand under them for long as it's unpleasant.
Not sure what has happened to the management of the pool area recently, it doesn't seem like anyone is checking the temperatures.

locations.title: Ferry Swimming Pool
locations.address: îƒˆ16 Ferry Pool Rd, Summertown, Oxford OX2 7DT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I took out annual membership of the Ferry Leisure Centre in March 2025 and have visited its gym most days. The general standard of the facilities is good (in particular, I like the 8 e-gym machines, which are accessed by logging in with an app that tracks your progress and remembers the settings for each machine). At about Â£380 for a year's membership I also think it's pretty good value for money.

However, the centre as a whole is badly let down by its management, which is completely unresponsive to complaints about items requiring maintenance or repair. This includes such vital items as the air conditioning in the gym, half of which has been inoperative for about a month. What started off as minor annoyances have therefore become major frustrations as repeated reminders of even such small issues as a loose toilet seat which would only take about 3 minutes with a spanner to fix are persistently ignored. Three separate individuals at the reception desk told me they would sort that problem out themselves, and all of them broke their undertaking.

Other things that could be improved are the lack of air conditioning in corridors and changing rooms, and the fact that there is only one urinal plus one toilet cubicle in the men's dry changing room. I also dislike the fact that music I have not chosen is often being pumped out over the gym's PA system instead of having silence. Half the users are trying to listen to their own headphones while exercising, and it must surely be a nuisance to them too to have to try to mentally shut out the noise from the PA system.

I haven't yet used the pool (25 metres, wide lanes), but it looks to be in excellent condition.

The pool's shower area is unisex and lacks privacy for both showing and changing.

The men's dry changing room also has showers, but the fact that swimmers who have exited the pool would need to use the showers in the men's dry changing room if they wanted to shower without their costumes on strikes me as pretty awkward. I assume that female swimmers would face a similar problem.

It is the poor management of the leisure centre that induces me to give the facility only two stars, otherwise I would have given it four stars. An upgrade of the changing and toilet facilities would be required for me to give it five stars.
showerReviews.author: Erik Kowal

locations.title: Hinksey Outdoor Pool
locations.address: îƒˆHinksey Park, Oxford OX1 4PZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely Horrendous Experience â€” Avoid at All Costs!

If I could give this place zero stars, I absolutely would. This was by far the worst experience Iâ€™ve ever had at any leisure facility â€” not only in Oxford, but anywhere.

First of all, there are NO clear signs or verbal warnings at the reception informing guests about the strict and frankly ridiculous rules: no drinking (not even a light, low-alcohol beverage), no eating, no jumping, no swimming unless someone gives you some kind of unspoken green light. Apparently, youâ€™re expected to be psychic.

My friend had a mild alcoholic drink â€” weâ€™re talking about something barely stronger than juice â€” and the moment we were told it wasnâ€™t allowed (for the first time, mind you!), she respectfully and immediately put it away. No attitude, no argument. But somehow, that wasnâ€™t good enough. Instead of a polite reminder or even a written notice, we were treated like criminals.

And then, as if that wasnâ€™t enough â€” we werenâ€™t even allowed to swim. Yes, you heard that right. Despite paying for the time slot, for the sun loungers, and for the access, we never got to enjoy the pool. The moment I stepped into the water, an ALARM was triggered. A literal siren. Staff came rushing over and actually threatened to call the police. It was humiliating, aggressive, and completely disproportionate.

What kind of hospitality is that? You sell people a service and then punish them for using it?

There was no kindness, no understanding, and absolutely no customer service. Just cold faces, zero communication, and unnecessary drama.

We paid full price for what ended up being a deeply unpleasant, hostile encounter. No swimming. No relaxation. Just rules that nobody bothered to explain, and treatment that made us feel like criminals for simply existing.

Save your money. Save your dignity. Go literally anywhere else in Oxford. This place is a joke â€” and not a funny one.

I can understand everything, but no one warned me personally that you can't drink. There are no signs. And my friend immediately cleaned everything up after the first remark. To tell the truth, I realized that the employee of this complex simply EXCEEDS all authority!!! They have no right to turn on the siren and kick you out of the pool. If you have any strict rules! Write down who and talk about it before you sell tickets and sun loungers!

a Recommendations and Not Rules!!! Talking in advance or about alternatives, for example, you can go swimming in an hour!
showerReviews.author: Hanna Khazova (hanna.bright_)

showerReviews.reviewText:
A very tranquil and picturesque outdoor pool. The water is heated to a very toasty temperature (around 28Â° I'd say). The pool is an unusual shape - like a figure 8, with a deep/laned in one half of the 8, and a shallow pool for little ones in the other. The pool has been updated over the years but it's nice to see one of the old fountains (now being used as a giant planter) and the retro outdoor changing cubicles.
At Â£5.70 a swim session (around 50 minutes) was good value. No lockers on site. Showers were warm, toilets were clean, as was the pool (even with the ducks swimming in it between sessions). The attendants/ lifeguards are quite strict on session start and end times - not a problem for lane swimmers, but I dread to imagine the fallout of the end of session whistle for family sessions!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: An absolute terrible experience - I took my two-year-old to Hinksey Outdoor Pool today. When we arrived there were only 30 minutes left in the session, which is actually enough for a toddler. The staff member at the desk told us we could wait and come back for the next session and that weâ€™d then have two hours; she never said that wouldnâ€™t be possible. We waited by the pool for half an hour, but when the next session started a different staff member was on duty and she refused to let us in under any circumstances. My husband and I explained that this was their colleagueâ€™s mistake and that my two-year-old shouldnâ€™t have to pay the price for it, but she still wouldnâ€™t allow even 15 minutes in the water. I had to take my childâ€”who has been unwell for a month and had been looking forward to swimming - home in his swimsuit, in tears. The lack of coordination and the unkindness from staff - refusing even to let a small child dip his feet in the water - was very disappointing.

When we arrived there were only 30 minutes left in the session, which is actually enough for a toddler. The staff member at the desk told us we could wait and come back for the next session and that weâ€™d then have two hours; she never said that wouldnâ€™t be possible. We waited by the pool for half an hour, but when the next session started a different staff member was on duty and she refused to let us in under any circumstances. My husband and I explained that this was their colleagueâ€™s mistake and that my two-year-old shouldnâ€™t have to pay the price for it, but she still wouldnâ€™t allow even 15 minutes in the water. I had to take my childâ€”who has been unwell for a month and had been looking forward to swimming - home in his swimsuit, in tears. The lack of coordination and the unkindness from staff - refusing even to let a small child dip his feet in the water - was very disappointing.
showerReviews.author: Leila Bagha

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful park!

Playground for children of all ages. Little toddler climbing frame and slide, swings. Sand pit, climbing frame for older kids too. Warning, the toilets are gross so I wouldnâ€™t recommend letting your little ones use it.

There is also a splash park, heated swimming pool, and tennis court facilities too.

You can also see the train tracks and oncoming trains if you go over the bridge and climb the stairs. Great for kids!

There is a community cafe with hot drinks and cake/soup available, which is open on Tuesday 10:30 till 2pm, and Thursday 1:30pm till 3:30pm.

Coffee van from Jericho coffee traders are there too, not sure what days specifically.

Parking here is limited, I never come by car but I always see cars having to leave as there are no spaces. Gets really busy during school holidays and sunny days.

showerReviews.reviewText: This pool is a little gem! Booked via the Better app for an evening lane swim. At Â£6.80 this was good value for money. Parking nearby is free after 6pm (you still have to enter your reg and get a ticket) and then a short walk over the bridge to the pool. Male/female changing rooms with toilets, hot indoor showers, and lockers (Â£1 refundable, get a band for the locker key from reception). It was the end of a long, hot day so the changing rooms were a bit dirty/smelly, but I could forgive this as the pool was an absolute dream. Heated to around 28Â°, immaculately clean, well organised lane swim which wasn't crowded. Pool regulars and staff were friendly too. I'll be stopping off here again - thanks for a relaxing swim in a lush pool ðŸ™

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love this pool but itâ€™s hardly ever open and itâ€™s really barely heated at all.
On top of that the showers are cold (womens side canâ€™t speak for mens) and the changing rooms are pretty grubby.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a very uncomfortable situation in the changing rooms at the swimming pool today.
Firstly I'd like to say how lovely the pool is and how clean it all was, however when I popped back into the changing rooms with my 6 year old daughter we saw an elderly lady fully naked drying herself in the middle of the changing room. My daughter was very confused and uncomfortable as neither of us knew where to look!
I mentioned it to the members of staff ( 2 young women) and they did not seem bothered at all. I just put it down to a weird experience and went back into the pool with my daughter. When we had got showered and got changed (in a cubicle, I might add!) we saw another lady in the shower naked, washing herself. I told my daughter to look away again as it's just so inappropriate for the lady to be doing this. I then went and spoke to the members of staff at reception again, and again they did not seem bothered nor willing to want to talk about it, they actually turned away from me and went round the corner of their reception where I couldn't see, while a male member of staff spoke to me. He said in the morning and evening adult only sessions then they allow it but it shouldn't be happening when there are children about and he would put a sign up. He basically  insinuated there wasn't anything else he could do about it as it would mean entering the ladies changing room, my answer to that would be to send a female member of staff in then! If only to just say could the ladies use a cubicle or shower in their bathing suit during the times when children are about!
I'm just appalled that this is basically accepted infront of children! The staff didn't seem to care and clearly the ladies deem it okay to appear naked infront of children. I don't feel comfortable bringing my child back here again if this is what I can expect. Such a shame as the pool is lovely. Just too disturbing and inappropriate in the changing room for children.
showerReviews.author: Jade B

showerReviews.reviewText: I saw they had a Â£5 for the first month promotion. So thought Iâ€™d give it a go. Went there with my friend, the place is an absolute dump. Filthy equipment, music blaring, liquids and bottles spilled all over the gaff. Good selection of equipment but a lot wasnâ€™t in good condition. The whole place is nasty. Went twice and I shall not be returning, even at a quiet time at 5am it still wasnâ€™t worth it. Iâ€™m usually not fussed about showering at a gym, but this place is a no go zone. I canâ€™t believe JD have attached their name to these abysmal location and equipment, disgusting. It wouldnâ€™t surprise me if Covid originated from this disgusting place. If you go then wear a hazmat suit and take anti aids medication.
showerReviews.author: Roddy Stewart

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a Member for a little over 3 months and love it. Equipment, while a little older than Pure gyms, feels great to use with a much heavier emphasis on weights rather than cardio like some other commercial gyms.

Love the boxing area a great way to unwind after a stressful day with a nice amount of bags for multiple people to use at once.

Sauna is fantastic and is a great way to relax after a long session at the gym as well as the showers are great especially with the cold shower allowing you to do a sauna then cold plunge.

Only issue I have is that equipment can be out of order for a long time and it's just due to general wear and tear from lots of use.

Even with the little issues I plan to keep going on a regular basis.
showerReviews.author: Dylan Warner (Swagmaster6676)

showerReviews.reviewText: Extremely unsanitary gym and way, way too busy. If the gym insists on taking on so many members then it must keep up with hiring more cleaning staff and providing more sprays and towels to clean equipment. There is none provided in the womenâ€™s section for members to wipe down their machines. The toilets are dirty with sanitary towel bins overflowing and the soap dispensers empty of soap most of the time. The hairdryers I doubt are ever wiped clean as they feel greasy to even touch, and the matts in the womenâ€™s area are often dirty and muddy. The gym is so busy even outside of peak hours, but if you do attend at peak hours, donâ€™t expect to find any parking at all!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Now..... 15/02/24

Disappointed Decline: My Updated Experience with JD Gym

Ten months ago, I eagerly signed up with JD Gym, excited about the prospect of getting fit and healthy. Back then, I was genuinely happy with the gym and even left a positive review. However, things have taken a nosedive since then, and I've had to make the tough decision to cancel my membership and find another gym. Let me break down why.

First off, let's talk about the changing rooms and toilets for men. It's honestly a nightmare in there. The smell hits you the moment you walk in, and there's just no escaping it. It's like there's zero ventilation. The floors are always wet, the sinks are busted, the soap dispensers are always empty, and don't even get me started on the mess â€“ it's like nobody ever bothers to clean up after themselves. Plus, half the lockers are busted or missing doors, which is just inconvenient and makes you worry about the security of your stuff.

I want to give credit where it's due â€“ the staff are really friendly and helpful. They're always there to lend a hand or offer advice. But unfortunately, their positive attitude can't make up for the fact that the gym itself feels like it's falling apart. The equipment is getting old and worn out, and it seems like nobody's bothering to maintain it properly.

So, as much as I hate to say it, JD Gym just isn't cutting it for me anymore. The decline in cleanliness and the state of the facilities have made it clear that it's time for me to move on. I'll miss the friendly faces, but I need a gym that prioritizes hygiene and upkeep.

Initial review upon joining 10 months ago
===================================================
JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent place for fitness enthusiasts to work out. As soon as you enter the gym, you will be greeted by the modern and clean facilities. The gym is spacious, with plenty of room for everyone to move around without feeling cramped. The gym is equipped with a wide range of modern equipment, which is well-maintained and in great condition. This ensures that you will always find what you need to get a complete workout.

The staff at JD Gym are friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. They are always available to assist you with any queries you may have and are willing to listen to your feedback. This dedication to customer satisfaction is reflected in the gym's amenities, which include free parking for members, saunas, and showers. These extras allow you to relax and refresh after a workout, making your experience at the gym even more enjoyable.

In conclusion, JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent choice for those looking for a modern, well-equipped gym with a friendly and dedicated staff. With ample space, high-quality equipment, and great amenities, JD Gym is sure to meet your fitness needs.
showerReviews.author: Cyrus Wolf

locations.title: JD Gyms Coventry
locations.address: îƒˆBelgrade Plaza, Upper Well St, Coventry CV1 4AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a shame with how lovely the staff is, but the quality overall seems lacking.

Some improvements since the last review, but it seems like they forgot to put any money into actually improving/fixing machines.

I don't know if the owner willingly ignores the quality issues with machines, or for some other reason pays no attention and just doesn't allocate money or resources.

The bench press assistance arms are still broken on some, the benches themselves move more than they should and are not stable.

Both of these wouldn't really be issues at low weights, but when you you're nearing and going past 100, stability starts to become a bit more important.

I suppose they're just waiting for someone to injure themselves so they can go "whoops", knowing nobody will challenge them on it.

Leg press backrest is loose. Foam on the quad extension roller is almost fully worn. Few quid to fix it? Nah, not with how busy they are. It's so bad you either need to be willing to hurt yourself on it at higher weights, or use shin pads.

I'm sure there's more issues around, just haven't bothered to look so closely.

Rules are hit and miss. Go topless in the middle of the gym while crowded? Sure. Not frequent but still happens.

No real enforcement if at all with putting weights back, or on clothing. No bike signs downstairs are more suggestions.

Even the small puregym near the Transport Museum had it in it's budget to place a cleaning station or two with paper towels around, but this was too much for JD with its higher prices and much larger footfall. Got to clean up the sweat and grime of everyone and their mother with your own things.
showerReviews.author: Codrin Gherman

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually like JD Gyms, but this branch is really disappointing. Thereâ€™s a clear lack of gym etiquette among many users. People regularly leave weights lying around instead of putting them backâ€”expecting someone new or less strong to unload multiple 25â€¯kg plates from a barbell or leg press is unreasonable.

Dumbbells are often left scattered on the floor near benches, creating obvious trip hazards. If someone were to fall or injure themselves because of this, it could easily lead to legal action. Safety should be taken seriously. If someone is strong enough to lift the weights to use them, thereâ€™s no excuse for not racking them properly afterward.

I also canâ€™t stand how some people have no respect for personal space or hygieneâ€”including groups of students and Uber drivers who seem more interested in staring at women than actually training.

I understand people need to rest between sets, but itâ€™s frustrating when they take 10 minutes just staring at their phones or having long conversations, with no regard for others waiting to use the machine.

On top of that, some of the equipment is badly in need of maintenance or replacement. For example, one of the calf raise machines feels like the bearings are shot, and the loading pole on the leg press is so angled it looks like the plates could fall off at any moment.

Overall, the entire branch feels neglected and seems to be relying solely on the JD Gyms name to keep attracting members. With so little competition in the area, it feels like thereâ€™s no incentive for management to address these issues.
showerReviews.author: Latif Ad Din

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice gym, plenty of cardio equipment. The free weights area is now better after the refurbishment.
I try to avoid the times between 4PM-8PM as that's most busy and you may struggle to find a bench, barbell, dumbell or plates. Also some members just hog the equipment when it can be shared between sets.
Plenty of lockers available but just 2 urinals and 2 toilets.
I suggest management should invest in more frequent cleaning and maybe some sort of air freshener equipment around the locker room and the main entrance.

locations.title: DW Sports Fitness
locations.address: îƒˆOzone Leisure Park, Grenoble Rd, Littlemore, Oxford OX4 4XP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
No customer service. Nothing ever gets fixed - showers have been broken for at least 6 months, steam room/sauna/hot hub are frequently out of order, at least one shower in the pool area is always broken and recently pool heating has stopped working intermittently (cold pool on at least 4 visits over the past few weeks). Changing rooms and pool area often dirty, used to regularly see a cleaner but haven't seen one in months. Staff are generally friendly with a couple of exceptions but management are powerless to do anything. Have been a member for over 7 years (long before dw took over) and in that time there has barely been any maintenance and it has gone severely down hill.

Strongly recommend avoiding and finding another gym.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Goodman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dirty facilities - its not that there aren't cleaners on duty whenever you go there it is that they just seem to mooch around not doing very much at all and they are really up against it as the facilitis are run down and tired looking.

Old machines - The running machines and the cardio machines which I use a lot are from the dark ages without media support unless you want to listen to the DW Radio which is played throughout the gym, they are also not equipped with very many workout options

The weight machines are OK. I dont use free weights so can't comment.

The Jacuzzi always closes early so if you want to use it last thing its not possible. The reason given is that it is either being cleaned or out of order.

I have been a member for about 9 months and at no time ever have both showers in the swimming pool area been working. The showers in the mens changing rooms are always faulty.

The swimming Pool is OK.

There are no swimming trunk driers in the changing rooms.

Initially I thought it was funny when during the first week I noticed that the interactive DW screen (where complaints can be made) didnt work well you guessed it 9 months later it still doesnt.

There was one machine which worked all the time. The Lucozade vending machine

The final nail in the coffin for DW Fitness Club for me was when I went into cancel my membership on the 2nd of January as I thought the Club was closed on New Years Day! and they told me that I would have to pay another 2 months membership as I hadnt given a full months notice!!!

It is definitely not worth the membership.
showerReviews.author: Duncan McInnes

The final nail in the coffin for DW Fitness Club for me was when I went into cancel my membership on the 2nd of January as I thought the Club was closed on New Years Day! and they told me that I would have to pay another 2 months membership as I hadnt given a full months notice!!!

It is definitely not worth the membership.
showerReviews.author: Duncan McInnes

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really thought that after DW took over from Kassam things would improve but no. I've come in today to find the water fountain isn't working in the gym. This is on top of the pool, spa pool, sauna, showers & steam room being out of order on a regular basis & the air con hasn't worked in over a year. They have a portable unit but that's it. The spa pool doesn't get hot anymore so no point using it. My other half tells me a lot of the doors in the men's changing room have broken off.
The gym has joining offers constantly. They should be giving their existing members money off for putting up with all the problems!
showerReviews.author: Deborah Pym

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall, I am very happy with the service provided by DW Fitness. The members of staff are always very professional and friendly to speak to. The facilities are brilliant. But unfortunately, when the facilities are broken, it takes them a long time to get fixed. In addition, it would be useful if members had access to a timetable for the use of the swimming pool, as there seems to be an increase in kids swimming lessons, and personally I would prefer to avoid these times. The reason for the reduction by one star, is due to the swimming lessons. As the children don't seem to be watched by their parents or the parents decide to sit in the changing room and have their weekly catch up, instead of doing it in the cafe area. Which isn't nice for members because (1) it takes up space and (2) there isn't any privacy.
showerReviews.author: Danielle Pryke

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at Welcome Break Oxford Services (M40) while driving from London to charge my Tesla and take a short break. It turned out to be one of the better service stations Iâ€™ve visited. The toilets were spotless, with plenty of cubicles available even during a busy afternoon, which made the stop quick and convenient.

Thereâ€™s a good range of food options including Burger King, Subway, and KFC, along with a well-stocked WH Smith for snacks, magazines, and travel essentials. The EV charging area was easy to find and worked smoothly, though itâ€™s worth checking availability ahead if youâ€™re stopping at peak times.

Parking is free for the first two hours, which is perfect for a short rest or a quick meal. I also appreciated the step-free access and other accessibility features, which make the site welcoming for everyone. The green frontage and small water feature give it a relaxed, open feelâ€”nice to unwind for a few minutes before getting back on the road.

Overall, this service area is a clean, comfortable, and well-equipped stop for anyone driving along the M40. Whether youâ€™re recharging your car or yourself, itâ€™s a sound choice with everything you might need. Just plan a bit of extra time if youâ€™re depending on EV chargers or particular restaurants during rush hours.

showerReviews.reviewText: Spacious parking for trucks, food court with variety of places to choose from but most will be your standard fast food shops. Truck stop stinks of piss even tho there is a toilet about 50 meters away (shows the truck drivers culture really well). All in all it's ok but I would avoid parking here if I can. Toilets in the main building are ok and have been refurbished recently, showers are ok too. I personally use this services for fuel only, lack of security, poor food choices and  stench of piss put me off parking here overnight.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at Welcome Breakâ€™s Oxford Services on the M40 (J8A) recently during a long drive, and it was a surprisingly polished and diverse pitâ€‘stop. The place is clean, bright, and even has a free piano you can tinkle on while taking a break. The food court offers something for every craving: KFC, Burger King, Subway, Chopstix, and the bright The Good Breakfast breakfast bar (stepâ€‘free access and allâ€¯â€“â€¯ideal for stretching your legs)  . If you're in the mood for coffee, thereâ€™s both a Starbucks inside and a separate Driveâ€‘Thru, plus a Taco Bell that opened in March 2025. And for a slightly more upscale sitâ€‘down, thereâ€™s a PizzaExpress and a good-sized Waitrose & Partners for everything from grabâ€‘andâ€‘go sandwiches to snacks  . Between those options and WHSmith, Krispyâ€¯Kreme, and the petrol forecourts, it really does feel like a small food village on the motorway.

From my point of view, itâ€™s one of the best serviceâ€‘station experiences on the M40. Youâ€™ve got the classicsâ€”KFC, McWhopperâ€‘style flameâ€‘grill from Burger King, Subway subsâ€”plus hotâ€‘food diversity with Chopstix noodles and Taco Bellâ€™s new menu. I particularly enjoyed the sitâ€‘down at PizzaExpress; it felt like a proper break rather than just refuelling. The two hours free parking, clean babyâ€‘change areas, EV chargers, showers, and a Ramada hotel onâ€‘site make it practical for any kind of stopâ€”whether itâ€™s a quick food run or a short-freshenâ€‘up break. Iâ€™ll definitely be adding this to my travel rotaâ€”Iâ€™d rather stop here than settle for a rushed snack at a less appealing service station.

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Swindon Truckstop
locations.address: îƒˆSwindon truck stop Oxford road, Oxford Rd, Swindon SN3 4ER, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow! Onroute Truckstops have been very busy at Swindon! What an amazing difference! My last visit to Swindon was shall we say, â€˜below expectationsâ€™; I really struggled to believe this was the same place.

On arrival the entrance was clean, clear and has obviously been attended to with the usual rubbish and debris cleared away. The security hut has had a complete refurb which was much needed. As a driver attending any truck stop if your first line of sight is dirt, rubbish and dilapidated buildings it immediately raises alarm bells as to what sort of site youâ€™re visiting.  Signage to parking was clear and concise, and there was ample space available.  Traffic flow was moderate and free.

First engagement was the canteen, by which entry was via a newly developed entrance.  Stunning.  New groundworkâ€™s was colourful and very pleasing to the eye.  There were new picnic tables positioned outside - and were being used.  New plants were positioned, giving the homely welcome.  A huge effort has been made to greet customers to this area and the transformation from the old side entrance is worlds apart.  There are new big screens displaying menus, new information points, leaflets, all safety measures present, serviceable, in date and correctly placed where applicable.

I met â€˜Claireâ€™ behind the counter, who was welcoming, bright and bubbly and just what you need to lift your spirits from the drama and stress of the highways. Also in attendance were approximately 4 other staff and the whole food counter experience was top class.  A very nice touch was a bowl of free healthy fruit for visitors. Well done there.  Food service was very quick - top marks.

The canteen was spotless. There were plenty of customers throughout the day (I was there for a 24hr stop) and I watched with interest the positive energy this team had going on. Everyone was greeted with a welcome and a smile.  No name badges though, Iâ€™d like to have seen that - itâ€™s a more personal presentation to thank someone and show appreciation by referring to them by name. Itâ€™s also awkward to have to ask, maybe this should be considered. On the opposite side of the coin it equally encourages staff to deliver excellence as itâ€™s much easier to identify individual failings. Certainly not the case here today however.

No sooner had a diner finished a staff member was instantly on hand to clean and disinfect and prepare the space for the next customer.  There was also excellent promotion and encouragement by the staff to download and use the Onroute app.

Feedback: drivers are still struggling to find the SNAP terminals to pay for parking and are constantly having to queue and ask at the counter, disrupting staff from the catering flow.  The terminals hidden away in the toilet corridor and are not signed. A staff member had put a handwritten sign on the access door to highlight the location but was told by management to take it down. This was a poor decision and negatively impacted good staff initiative.  It may not have been ideal or as professional as a custom branded sign, but it was better than nothing!  There is still no clear signage to the SNAP payment terminals and needs addressed for full score achievement.

The shop was well stocked and inviting. Itâ€™s bright and has most of the essentials needed for drivers. As soon as I approached the shop a member of staff was there to assist if needed. I made several purchases and the whole experience again was very good.

The toilet corridor from the canteen leads to access snap terminals, ladies, gents and disabled toilets, and showers.  It was clean, fresh, clear of debris; and both snap terminals were fully functional. All fire safety measures were present, in date and clearly identified.  Health & Safety measures were also in place and being used effectively.

Unfortunately I canâ€™t give any further details as Iâ€™ve run out of characters! Happy to be contacted if necessary. Staff deserve special credit for a near perfect experience. Well done. Very well done.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText: It's been upgraded. Tepid soup was the order of the day and it just about made it out of the "cold " bracket. It's now a very small space in which the drivers eat compared to previously. Showers and toilets get the thumbs up though. I've eaten better food for less money. Next time I'll go to Sainsbury's next door and just buy something from there, it will be tastier than what I had. Do something about that soup, it's really bad, it was the vegetable soup and it was like someone just decided it would be best to use the old vegetables up by making a soup. The chef can't be happy, or doesn't have a tasting spoon. A dreary 1 star. Overall the old place was better for space. It feels cramped with 10 people in there
showerReviews.author: Mick Ward

showerReviews.reviewText: Great location, very clean and the heater in our private room kept it plenty warm. Train noise from the nearby station woke us up a couple of times, but it was fine. Apparently both hot water heaters had failed the day before we arrived, which we were promptly notified of upon check in and offered 25% off our booking - good on them for being upfront and generous about it! They had a backup water heater going by the morning though so we did get a short hot shower anyway. Would certainly stay here again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros:
The people at the reception are very helpful, the rooms are large, with a large table for studying, kinda large bed, a lot of storage space, a lot of power sockets, the kitchen is kinda small but has everything necessary. Because we have a reception, all packages are delivered there and securely stored. There is Sainsbury's in just a 2 minutes walk towards city center which is open till 11pm. The number of washing machines is large enough so I've never seen a queue.

Cons:
The heating is kinda shit, personally I'm always cold. Because there is a car park, it is often noisy. The windows don't open, there is only a vent window (which is fairly enough for ventilating though). The shower is very uncomfortable because it is very small and has only a wall-mounted showerhead. The washing machine's usage is kinda expensive.
showerReviews.author: Alesia Ivanova

showerReviews.reviewText:
We discovered a bedbug infestation in our room â€” multiple bites and clear photo/video evidence. It happened in the middle of the night (around 3 a.m.), and we couldnâ€™t sleep at all because of it. This is not only unacceptable but also a serious health and hygiene concern.

We immediately reported the issue and requested a full refund, but the compensation offered was insufficient given the situation. Having to deal with bedbugs during a stay is distressing enough, but the lack of proper resolution made it even worse.

Iâ€™m sharing this so future guests are aware â€” please check your room carefully before staying here.

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely shocking. The room has not been cleaned in a while as several dubious stains in shower, sink, floor and bins tell me. No respect of privacy, I was let into another personâ€™s room to use their en-suite by the staff without any consent from the guests. Location was not what it was promised. The owners are cheating people out of their money in a gross abuse of the insane accom prices in Oxford during the summer. Bed not uncomfortable but about to fall apart whenever I moved during the night. Would not enter room or shower without shoes on. Whatever level of dirty you imagine, itâ€™s way way worse. Worth it to pay a little more to keep your dignity. This review is not to punish the owner as I am sure they will not be bothered by another bad review. It is genuinely to warn anyone off from making the same mistake as us. Good luck.

locations.title: Valley Farm Campsite
locations.address: îƒˆLane house, Eynsham Rd, Farmoor, Cumnor, Oxford OX2 9NL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a truly wholesome and enjoyable three-day stay here. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with friendly staff and fellow campers from all over Europe.

Our pitch was fantastic - spacious, well-kept, and perfectly located for both exploring Oxford city centre and travelling on to other areas.

The facilities were good, with decent washing-up areas and everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The site itself had a lovely, relaxed feel, making it easy to unwind and enjoy the surroundings.

My only small criticism is that there didnâ€™t appear to be any recycling facilities on site. Everything was going into general waste bins, which was a shame - especially as encouraging recycling could help reduce the bin overspill. With such good washing-up facilities already, it would be easy for guests to rinse and recycle their containers.

That said, if the lack of recycling is my only complaint from the whole stay, Iâ€™d say thatâ€™s a great result. We left with happy memories, having met lots of lovely travellers and enjoyed a very comfortable, well-located base.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Hannon

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a wonderful place. Had 2 fabulous nights here and can't praise it highly enough. Fantastic, comfortable and roomy tents with everything you need. Beds are very comfy with crisp clean  sheets.
Amenities are excellent, toilet/shower block is very clean with good showers. Washing up area again clean and practical and the kitchen area has 3 ovens  & hobs, microwave and fridges.
Each tent has an outdoor seating area and a firepit/barbecue with charcoal logs and kindling supplied, and if you run out there's an honesty box to get more.
The location is perfect, open countryside, a short walk across the meadow to the Thames its just so peaceful and relaxing. My only regret is not booking in for longer.
Thank you for a wonderful stay

locations.title: Bridge Villa Camping and Caravan Park
locations.address: îƒˆThe St, Crowmarsh Gifford, Wallingford OX10 8HB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely, friendly site in a perfect location with a friendly family running it.   Prior to booking a pitch in November we were slightly concerned that it was grass only.  However, despite the rain, the ground remained firm and driving on and off the pitch was not an issue.
The facilities block was clean and the shower cubicles were spacious.  Showers were electronic and water flow was timed.  This wasn't a problem as the control sensors were easy to use.
Location was excellent with a short stroll into the town or the Thames walk.  Buses to Oxford were regular (a 40 minute journey) and Reading (a 50 minute journey).
A positive recommendation from us.  Next time we'll book a longer stay as we could only fit in two nights on this occasion
showerReviews.author: Helen Tweddle

locations.title: Diamond Caravan Park
locations.address: îƒˆIslip Rd, Bletchingdon, Kidlington OX5 3DR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only pros we found were the site close to the park and ride into Oxford Â£5 to park for 16 hours which includes your return bus fair for two adults - cheap as chips. And the radio piped into the wash block. Here come the cons:
- the Diamond website states before booking to note there's no longer a swimming pool, that's fine, no problem. The website still advertises, whether on their site location, facilities or gallery that they have a bar, a play park a pool table and football table in the 'games room'. They have none of these! (there is a 'games room') PLEASE FULLY UPDATE YOUR WEBSITE!
- a large amount of people appear to be living on site (site workers etc with families), I've no problem with that, they we nice friendly people, however I felt like we were living in there home as it were. They left wet washing from the washing machines on the washing up draining boards, a sponge and razor behind the pipes of the shower, and left for work really early (the campsite is covered in thick gravel which is very noisy, especially at 7:30am).
- the campsite is very tired. Nothing seems to get fixed when broken. Spinning taps in the toilet block, broken soap dispensers, cracked plug socket in the laundry room are just a few examples. The 'games room' never got tidied or cleaned, with beer cans filling the bin. There was a dartboard in there, but the workmen who live on site seem to use this so we didn't get a chance to have a game. The site just had a general unkempt feel, with bits of detritus left lying around.
- the road noise is very loud, which kicks in at around 6:30am.
- not the site's fault, but there's hardly any phone signal (we're on O2 no idea on other providers) and their free WiFi didn't reach our pitch. Again, not the site's fault, just a niggle.
- not the site's fault.again, but the only pub within walking distance is permanently closed.
We booked our stay on incorrect information, which is the most frustrating thing of all. We have stayed on nicer sites for less.
showerReviews.author: The Wanderers

Also the games room/shed is no more. Itâ€™s also housed to people that seem to be living on site working community!  Coming and going all day. showerReviews.reviewText:
A Perfect Family Escape at D'Oyleys Farm

Just returned from an unforgettable camping trip at D'Oyleys Farm with the family, and I honestly can't stop smiling. From the moment we arrived, it was clear this place is something special.

Clean, Spacious, and Serene
The site was spotless, with plenty of space to spread out and relax. Each pitch was generously sized, giving us privacy without feeling isolated. Surrounded by nature, we were treated to the sights and sounds of wildlife all aroundâ€”pure bliss.

Comfort Meets Nature
Hot showers were a welcome luxury after long days of exploring and playing. Everything was well-maintained, making the whole experience feel effortless and comfortable.

River Adventures
The river was the highlight for my two boysâ€”they were in it at first light and last light every day, laughing, splashing, and making memories that will last a lifetime. Watching them enjoy the water so freely was a joy in itself.

Warm Hospitality
The owners were absolutely lovelyâ€”friendly, helpful, and genuinely welcoming. They made us feel right at home and added a personal touch that made all the difference.

Captured Moments
We took some amazing videos and photos that we've already shared with extended family, who were seriously impressed. Itâ€™s one of those trips that makes you want to pack up and go back the moment you get home.

Final Thoughts
If you're looking for a peaceful, family-friendly camping spot with nature, comfort, and charmâ€”D'Oyleys Farm is it. We can't wait to return and do it all over again.
showerReviews.author: D D

locations.title: Camping By The River
locations.address: îƒˆ43 Drayton Rd, Sutton Courtenay, Abingdon OX14 4HB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This is â€œParadise Foundâ€! A serene and beautiful camp hideaway on a pretty bend of the River Thames surrounded by meadows, where Stephen and Annemarie warmly welcome you to off- grid luxury. Itâ€™s taken years of searching to find this gem - a pocket of tranquil river countryside offerIng a small encampment of 5 gorgeous yurt tents. Think camp fires and BBQs and hot outdoor showers and hot tub and luxury beds â€¦ not forgetting the kayak for river adventures. Stephen and Annemarie have conjured up camp magic, and their hosting is wonderful! They make one feel instantly welcome and relaxed, nothing is too much trouble, and they keep the camp immaculately. Canâ€™t wait to return soon with family and friends!

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely campsite on the banks of the River Thames, surrounded by nature. The owners, Stephen and Annemarie, are very welcoming and provide everything you need, including a hot shower. The wood-fired hot tub and kayak are fantastic additions. The pretty village of Sutton Courtenay is a 10-minute walk away where you can find a few nice pubs and visit George Orwell's grave. Abingdon is a historic town that's worth a visit and is 10-minute drive away. There are also lots of walks along the Thames within easy distance. My friend and I had a very relaxing stay and will probably return again in the future. Highly recommend if you're looking for a reasonably priced glamping holiday
showerReviews.author: Lyndsay R

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely campsite on the banks of the River Thames, surrounded by nature. showerReviews.author: Lyndsay R

showerReviews.reviewText: Camping by the River is a real gem, perfectly nestled on a private section of river in an absolutely picture perfect opening nestled around a short area of woodland. The site has 4 large bell tents, clean inside and out, and offer all of the amenities you'd need. There's no grid electricity or plumbing but Stephen and Annemarie have considered all aspects. There's lockboxes to charge devices via solar panels, fridge freezers, amazing outdoor showers which are the perfect temperature and heaters inside the tents should you need. Each pitch has a BBQ, fire pit and picnic bench. The standout part of our stay was the wood fired hot tub which was expertly set up by our hosts to a perfect temperature, the hot tub is located in a private area opposite the river and you're shielded by lots of trees and river plants. The hot tub was a welcomed treat after a long day of walking. Our hosts made us feel incredibly welcomed and we really cannot wait to return. Thank you Stephen and Annemarie.

It's perfect!!! The tents are lovely and large and full of everything you'll need for your stay. The kitchen is also well equipped and the whole place has been designed beautifully with asthetics key. The location couldnt be more idyllic - its on a quiet spot on the river which we made full use of with our swimming, paddlboarding and kayaking. In the evening we played in the hot tub and relaxed around the campfire. The owners (Steve and Anne-Marie) were around if we needed them and super friendly and helpful. 100% recommend this place but hope everyone ignores this review so we can book again easily for ourselves..
..

showerReviews.reviewText: Just spent 3 nights here Â£139 for 3 nights so expensive as Toilets & Showers dirty, black mould all round showers. Always had to go into 5 toilets before you found a cleanish one to use. Showers only stay on for 5 seconds and designed for people under 5â€™. As soon as we got there Thursday there was clearly a situation with the toilets and lack of drainage. The showers were not draining and nothing was done until it flooded on the Saturday and all toilets/showers out of order. They should have done something about it sooner!  No compensation offered and they didnâ€™t have anything to say to us when we said about the lack of cleanliness. Kids are allowed to scream and parents are obnoxious. I had to keep my dog on a lead and quiet, so why is it any different for peopleâ€™s rude kids. Wonâ€™t be coming back, so disappointed with this campsite.

showerReviews.reviewText:
On the positive side, the place was really cheap and the location by the lake is beautiful. The staff were friendly. On the negative side, there was noise from the nearby rally track - and the facilities: we urgently needed to do some laundry, but the machines were completely overpriced and we didn't have enough coins or any bills left. So when we went to pay, we asked to pay by card and get change in coins. This was simply refused, as management would not allow it (thanks for that).
The shower buildings are catastrophically outdated. There is a single drain running through the showers, toilets, and sinks, which smells accordingly. Tiny cubicles with no benches. Poor push-button showers. In the women's area, the water in the sinks and showers was only lukewarm, and my wife came back completely frozen. In the middle of it all, the lights go out: in the dark, you have to open the shower curtain, open the door, and stand naked in the hallway to get the lights back on â€“ disgusting and dangerous. Since there is only one building at the front reception, it is a long way from many of the pitches.
showerReviews.author: Martin W

A beautifully green and well kept site. It was quiet which is just what we wanted. The staff were very friendly and helpful and you can tell that they are really invested in making this into a nice place to stay. The facilities were clean and the showers were lovely and warm! Also a pizza oven van arrived on the Saturday evening which was an added bonus and saved us cooking.
The site is also so close to the wildlife park and if you buy tickets at the camp shop you get a discount.

Little shop available too. Dog friendly areas and bins around so you can bring your dogs, just need to keep them on leads or tethered.

A bonus is the wildlife park entrance is literally opposite and they sell discounted tickets in the park shop. You can even hear the lions roar in the evening which we thought was pretty magical.

We'd come back again. Clean, peaceful and green site which we really enjoyed staying at.

locations.title: Dormy House
locations.address: îƒˆWillersey Hill, Broadway WR12 7LF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Dormy House for five nights in Studio 42, and it was a wonderful experience overall.

The Room:
Studio 42 was spacious, beautifully designed, and full of thoughtful touches â€” from the full drum kit and vinyl player to the sound system in every room. It even had two toilets, which was surprisingly convenient. The bathroom featured a modern setup with both rain and handheld shower heads, excellent water pressure, and precise temperature control. Everything about the room felt carefully considered and of high quality. Complimentary snacks and drinks were provided, the room was spotless, and the cleaning staff were consistently warm and friendly.

The Service:
Service throughout our stay was fantastic. While the team seemed small â€” often just one or two receptionists â€” they were exceptionally friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help. They assisted with dinner reservations and even offered complimentary rides within the property.

The Food:
Breakfast was classic English fare, served in a lovely setting with attentive and cheerful staff.

The Spa:
Though on the smaller side, the spa is very well equipped â€” featuring a steam room, sauna, warm and tropical showers, and even a snow machine! Itâ€™s compact but thoughtfully designed and never felt overcrowded.

The Grounds:
Beautifully maintained, with complimentary electric vehicle parking available.

Minor Notes:
Thereâ€™s no elevator, and we arrived with heavy suitcases that had to be carried up the stairs. There werenâ€™t any male staff around at the time, so I felt a bit bad watching the female staff struggle to help us with the luggage â€” but they were gracious and insisted nonetheless.
showerReviews.author: Julia

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visually beautiful hotel. Sadly the spa is far too busy and given the age of the hotel, rooms are really not soundproof in the slightest, you can hear next door rooms and doors opening along the corridor etc.
The booking was for a birthday which was told beforehand to the hotel, at check in it was mentioned a â€˜sweet treatâ€™ would be waiting in the room as a gesture. Unfortunately there was nothing, was not recognised by the person showing us the room, nor was it rectified at any point during our stay.
There are no fridges in the rooms but communal Smeg fridge in the corridor with unlimited water/milk available.
The rainfall shower was outstanding.
Ended up ordering room service for dinner (but had to run down to find someone each time we did as the phones were never answered) due to there being no tables available at the time we were wanting to dine, but the food was delicious. Drinks arrived in good time, food felt slow.
When watching tv, someone trying to connect to airplay would continuously interrupt us watching tv as it would try and connect our tv and turn off what we were watching. Which was obviously rather annoying.
No turndown service offered on check in or any camomile tea in the room. Only last three teas available when asking reception. No offer to get any more.
The bed in the room we were in (Room 11), was not made for anyone around 6â€™0â€, unless youâ€™re happy with feet dangling off the bed. Not mentioned on booking. But super comfortable bed and bedding.
Breakfast the next morning was incredibly slow service for hot food, verging on painful and the cold buffet selection was pretty average.
Shame the spa was so busy, it would be good if you were able to book onto an allotted time, so it doesnâ€™t get hogged.
Thoughtful gift bag when checking out/leaving. Glad to have stayed, but not sure I would again. Nothing particularly outstanding that blew me away.
showerReviews.author: Suzanna Hemming

showerReviews.reviewText:
Attended here with fire aid in Hythe for a STCW Refresher course in the dive pool. Facilities were excellent, staff friendly and helpful. The cafe is reasonably priced for snacks and coffee etc
Only one downside is the hairdryers in the ladies changing facilities are extremely underpowered compared to other large pool/gym facilities. Prepare to be there for some time if you don't want to risk going out in the chilly air with wet hair. The splashpool, jacuzzi and waterslide looked fantastic but we're not open during my visit as it was during the day.
showerReviews.author: Victoria Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText: I am a wheelchair user and finding places that are wheelchair accessible is hard work. The staff here make me feel very welcome and help me in and out the pool with the pool lift. They are encouraging of my goals and make sure that lane swimming is just that. They have had some issues with the building yes but they also do their best to resolve it. The gym is not directly accessible by lift so when i go to do my gym workout i have to tell them im coming in advance so they open the gym door for me. But that is no hard ship. I have had a lot of good advice what i could do in the gym to help with my upper body strength as i cant do anything with my legs. I have found them very kind and welcoming and i look forward to my visits.
showerReviews.author: Emma Melaney

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited the lagoon pool here recently and 'it's ok' sums it up. The kids enjoyed it but the entire pool is in desperate need of a revamp or maybe even just a deep clean. Half of the water spouts and facilities weren't working. Staff were friendly and the changing rooms and lockers were really well sized. You do need your own padlock for the lockers which is unusual and due to the design, even when the padlock is on, you can open the locker enough to reach in so consider what you want to leave in them.
showerReviews.author: Simon New

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the second time I have visited the lagoon. Both times the water slides were not operating due to staff shortages. This time the water spouts were also not operating and half the lagoon was cordoned off half way through- again due to not enough staff. The family changing rooms were diabolical. They stank of urine and were filthy and clearly in need of refurbishment. There were also many single males changing in there which made me very uncomfortable to use the showers with the young children I hade brought with. I certainly will not be visiting
again in a hurry.
showerReviews.author: Kate Elliott

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely appalled by the state of Southampton West Quay Leisure facilities. This place is an utter disgrace and a complete health hazard.
1.	Lockers? Most of them are broken, forcing members to carry their belongings around or risk leaving them unsecured.
2.	Toilets? Frequently clogged and reeking â€” clearly no proper maintenance routine in place.
3.	Despite paying for a membership, you canâ€™t even access the leisure pool without pre-booking. The worst part? They could easily do it at reception, but the staff are so arrogant and unhelpful, theyâ€™d rather argue than assist.
4.	Shower heads barely work, some donâ€™t run at all â€” disgusting after a workout.
5.	Steam room? Out of order for months, with no explanation or compensation.
6.	The floors are slimy, covered in fungus and grime, making it feel more like a neglected public toilet than a premium facility.
7.	Constant lifeguard shortage, raising serious safety concerns, especially with so many kids around.

This place is falling apart â€” a complete rip-off. I deeply regret purchasing an annual membership here. Whoever is managing this facility should be ashamed. Avoid at all costs unless you want to pay to be disgusted.
showerReviews.author: Nagendra Mishra

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is in regards to our child's swimming lessons, we book them on a Tuesday as that's our availability. Now on 2 occasions they have been cancelled. Fine, we were under the impression after the 3rd there would be possibly refunds baring in mind the price has shot up since the take over.

But no, because they have 'offered' us days to have a lesson despite us not being available it doesn't count as a cancelled lesson. This is disgusting behaviour and just purely greed related. You're paying for a service at a time slot that gets cancelled. It's cancelled.

Poor service, 0 regard for customers availability and using a loop hole to save themselves money.
showerReviews.author: dan fleat

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is a center for the community in the truest sense.
The staff are friendly and do their best to keep it clean, which can't be easy in the dated facilities.
I only use the pool and the changing areas desperately need an upgrade, but for me that only knocks off 1 star because I commend the center for keeping their prices achievable for their diverse clientele in all walks of life.
I love seeing families of all backgrounds taking part in the children & infant classes, people of all shapes and sizes in the lane swimming sessions, singing a song with an elderly lady in the next shower, positive affirmation Graffiti in the changing cubicles and noone ever batted an eye over a modest swimsuit.
showerReviews.author: Nodis Isweird

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Jubilee Centre stands out with its recently expanded, state-of-the-art gym, offering over 200 fitness stations and dedicated zones for cardio, strength, and functional training. Users consistently praise the high quality and variety of equipment, including adaptive options for inclusivity.
In addition to the gym, key facilities include a six-lane, 25m swimming pool, multiple fitness studios with a wide selection of classes, a climbing and bouldering wall, and three squash courts. The centre's design is bright, spacious, and welcoming, creating a positive atmosphere for all usersâ€”students, staff, and the wider community. While peak times can be busy, the quality of the facilities and the dedication to inclusive fitness make this a premier spot for training and recreation.
Highly recommended for its impressive facilities and comprehensive offering! ðŸ‘
