The only thing I will say is that the sink water temperature in the ladies toilet is very hot, sometimes too hot to use and the pressure of the taps is a bit all over the place. showerReviews.reviewText: Our kid has been going to Shirley Swimming Pool for about 3 years. Started in the small pool and has moved to the big pool (Tadpoles) some months ago. He loves his swimming lessons and is keen to go, which is great to see. His swimming skills have been improving steadily and gradually. showerReviews.reviewText: My 5.5 year old daughter Iris attends one of the Thursday backstroke classes. The teachers are all lovely and engage the children with the structure of the lesson. She's been attending for a long time now, each term they check their progress, give certificates and email some feedback. The children progress classes as their skills improve. I like the swimming pool as there is always parking on site, and there's a little playground and cafe If children want to play before or after their lesson. The best thing in my opinion is their online booking system. You are able to cancel lessons you cannot attend, and they give you a virtual token and you can book another lesson to cover the one they lost. I find this useful and it means we never waste a lesson. Children members can also book public swims free of charge, however adults that accompany need to pay. The pool is large, and clean. The temperature is okay. The only con is the female changing rooms, as at times they can be wet and messy. They could do with more regular checking and cleaning and free hair dryer. Other than that I certainly recommend this pool, especially for children's lessons.
showerReviews.author: Mersa Mos

showerReviews.reviewText:
The instructors at Shirley Swimming Pool have been absolutely fantastic in building my sonâ€™s confidence in the water. He was initially terrified of going underwater, but after a year of lessonsâ€”and thanks to the patience and guidance of AJâ€”heâ€™s now a confident and capable swimmer. My daughter has also flourished there and is very comfortable in the water.

One feature we really appreciate is the flexibility of being able to cancel and reschedule sessions, which is incredibly convenient for a busy family.

The only downside is the condition of the changing rooms. By the end of the day, they can become quite wet and dirty. With the no-shoes policy, it means you often have to stand in the wet area unless you opt to wear protective shoe covers, which are available.

Overall, weâ€™re extremely happy with the lessons and plan to continue as members. Weâ€™re also looking forward to enrolling our youngest child when the time comes.

showerReviews.reviewText: We hired the small pool for a birthday party. It was excellent value for money and would highly recommend. We could use the pool for one hour and have a maximum of 30 people in the water but one adult for every 2 under 8.  Our party was only 10 children and 3 adults in the water and this gave the children loads of space to play. The centre provided floats, noodles, sinkers and balls to make the party really fun. You can also hire a room for your own food after, at an extra (but reasonable) cost. The pool was well maintained and looked after and the lifeguards were doing a great job too. changing facilities were clean and showers worked well.

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a really lovely spa day here. The venue was quiet with a lovely pool and spa and good facilities; it's tucked out the way which made it easy to switch off! Towel and a huge fluffy robe were provided; worth remembering slippers or pool shoes though. Lunch was a bento box which was nice enough but nothing special. The treatments (facial and massage) were excellent, however I would have appreciated it if the therapist had spent a couple of minutes speaking with me first... I climbed on the couch and the treatment started with barely a word. Overall a wonderful treat and excellent value for money, I'll certainly be back in the future.

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a really lovely spa day here. The venue was quiet with a lovely pool and spa and good facilities; it's tucked out the way which made it easy to switch off! Towel and a huge fluffy robe were provided; worth remembering slippers or pool shoes though. Lunch was a bento box which was nice enough but nothing special. The treatments (facial and massage) were excellent, however I would have appreciated it if the therapist had spent a couple of minutes speaking with me first... I climbed on the couch and the treatment started with barely a word. Overall a wonderful treat and excellent value for money, I'll certainly be back in the future.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Brightwell

showerReviews.reviewText: The male changing room was disgusting,  the smell of urine as you walk in, I needed a wee so went to use the only cubicle, NOPE!!, piss all over the floor, had to carefully use the urinal which absolutely stank of urine, pubic hair on both â€¦

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently signed up to a swim only membership.
The pool is lovely but changing rooms could do with a update and deep clean.
The only reason I am giving 3 stars is because I have had to call twice recently due to the swim timetable being incorrect, and nearly turning up when I couldn't use the pool.
I also find it very hard to get hold on someone via socials or on email.

showerReviews.reviewText: Today me and a friend decided to go in the pool and we was using some of the inflatable boards to float with like we have done before however today we was told we could not use the inflatables as we was not using them for practicing swimming, we thought it was a bit strange because we had been told previously by staff members that it was ok to use them and it was not busy at all with there only being 4 total people in the pool including me and my friend and we was keeping away from the other swimmers. Even though we thought it was a little unfair we stopped using them and moved on. Later we decided to get out the pool and dry off and we decided to use the hairdryers that are available there that we usually use every time we get out the pool however this time we was prompted by the same staff member that we cannot use them and we need to bring a towel even though we have never been asked to not use the hairdryer before. Again we thought this was strange but we listened and stopped using them but soon after we got changed we saw a lady also using the hair dryer who was using it completely unbothered and we felt a bit targeted and believe it was unfair as we never have had that issue before.
showerReviews.author: Redworm 77

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have noticed a decline in the last 4 months. The family changing area is always grubby with brown scum rings around the posts where the cubicle posts go into the floor, around the edges of the cubicle are the same. Only two out of four showers are working. The steam/sauna room shower is broken and lots of people use the swimming pool to cool off so essentially the swimming pool is now the shower.
When I mentioned this to a member of staff they said that â€œRosâ€ knows (presumably this is a manager)  but hasnâ€™t done anything about it. â€œI will have to let him know againâ€ they said.
I am now looking for an alternative that is cleaner and managed better.

showerReviews.reviewText: While the classes and facilities are great the cleanliness leaves somewhat to be desired. The new aqua Zumba instructor was great and really listened to feedback from users to make the class work well for us. The app makes it super easy to know availability - but I have trouble using the system to book so over have to call to do so. Prices for non members a little on the high side - especially as I feel classes are limited due to the struggles you face with lack of instructors, itâ€™s difficult to get classes around my work schedule so would like to see more classes available. The pool facilities and changing areas really need a good clean (a lot of dust, mould and grubby areas) the showers are very small and limited at this centre - and often found the hair dryers arenâ€™t great.

showerReviews.reviewText: Arrived at 10am, the pool was pretty quiet and empty. The changing rooms absolutely stunk of stale urine, the floors were filthy considering it wasnt busy and it was pretty early in the day I wouldnt expect to see it in that condition. Its pretty obvious whoever is supposed to be cleaning them isnt doing their job at all. I took my 1 year old and couldnt even put her on the floor while I got myself changed it was so disgusting. The change table could do with having safety straps as I couldn't keep her safely still while I changed her and myself and I had to keep her up on the change table because of the state of the floor. If anyone is planning to go I would wear socks if you dont want warts, verrucas, athletes foot and god knows what else could be lurking on that floor! I think the only plus is that the staff we did encounter were lovely.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Bailey

locations.title: PureGym Southampton Central | New Kit Just Landed!
locations.address: îƒˆMountbatten Retail Park, Western Esplanade, Southampton SO15 1QJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Look, it's a cheap gym, so I am not expecting it to be premium inside. There is however, a few basic things that they need to addressed..... the air conditioning could be so much better. Downstairs it doesn't seem so bad but the upper lever where most of the cardio machines are, its warm and the A/C really needs looking at.
Blue roll for wiping down machines etc, in an abundance on the lower level, but upper level, the dispenser is always empty and not always a roll there to be used. I guess staff stay downstairs most of the time at their desk and don't see it needs replacing upstairs.
Small gents locker / changing room. Half the showers have doors missing off them. I have visited 3 out of 4 days recently and the same smelly dirty clothes have been hanging up on the hooks and the place doesn't look like its had a good clean.
Fix the bloody taps, one tap in particular is pushed down to use then just stays on wasting hundreds of litres of water. Every time I've been in there it just runs and wastes so much water.
Quite a few elliptical machines make weird squeaky noises as you use them, so irritating to hear while working out.
Like I said, it's not a premium gym but on the whole it is fairly good value for money but please get the basics such as A/C, cleaning and maintenance right.
showerReviews.author: Leeds Womble

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very friendly gym with relaxed atmosphere with brilliant classes. There is some new equipment so hopefully some investment on the way because some equipment such as treadmills are out if date, they work but compared to other gyms they are very outdated. One thing that needs urgent attention is the changing rooms, lots of the lockers don't lock and the showers are temperamental.  If you are lucky enough to find one that has hot water it can quickly go to freezing cold.
The PT's are very friendly and approachable and the classes are very good. It doesn't matter what level of fitness you are you can do the classes and feel you've achieved something.

DONT SIGN THE CONTRACT

This is mine and my partners experience, don't sign it's no longer worth it

What once was a nice gym and center is now just used to get you signed into a contract you can't get out off. Notified member of staff that there was blood and glass in one of the changing rooms and got an "brilliant" as a response,

The place isn't kept well, pool isn't realy heated (not me being picky, have had others say it, your local leasure center is better)

Tried to cancel my membership and stuck paying over Â£100 monthly for the next half a year now. I could be writing about the place for ages but I'll let you make your decision on the gym...

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have recently signed up to this gym! The facilities are amazing, this gym has a lot to offer from swimming and wellness, to classes, racquet sports and the club itself!

A big thank you to Liv, who was very friendly and kind! Liv showed me around the gym and took a genuine interest in my goals for the gym, getting to know me and explaining the gym facilities, which made me feel at ease instantly. Liv made joining an easy and welcoming process!!

I am excited to start and make the most of my membership!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently joined this gym and couldn't be happier with my decision. From the moment I walked in, the staff made me feel welcome and taken care of.

Liv Ellis was particularly helpful during my sign-up process. She took the time to understand my fitness goals and made sure I enrolled in the package that was the right fit for me.

The facilities themselves are well maintained. Everything is very clean, from the workout areas to the locker rooms, which makes for a much more enjoyable gym experience. It's clear the team takes pride in maintaining high standards.

I was also pleasantly surprised by the restaurant - the food is delicious and offers great healthy options that complement my fitness routine perfectly. It's convenient to grab a quality meal without having to leave the premises.

Overall, I am pleased to be part of this gym community. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a clean, well-run facility with staff who genuinely care about their members!
showerReviews.author: Justin 888

showerReviews.reviewText: Very good place to work out, especially as a new gym person. The entry is a bit of a pain at first, but is very secure. The phone app is helpful, and can track things like your time at the gym, or how many people are at the gym (so you know when its quiet). The machines seem decent to me (I have no comparison) and have different workout options or manual. The bathroom is clean every time, however there's no hairdryer, if you plan on showering there. The thing that annoys me is that there could be more weight machines, as a lot of the time they are taken up by someone else (though sometimes it feels like they're just sat there). Theres plenty of options of free weights, boxing and ropes too, if that's your thing. The lockers are okay, kinda annoying if you dont have a lock, or yours doesnt fit, however they have a vending machine, and you can buy one for Â£5. The machines and gym are cleaned by staff, very decently I must say. I've recommend this gym to my friends, and now to everyone.
showerReviews.author: Lucy Bailey

locations.title: David Lloyd Southampton West End
locations.address: îƒˆBotley Rd, West End, Southampton SO30 3XA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I had the pleasure of having a tour with Helen as I was looking to join the gym and swimming facilities. West end is currently going through it's refurbishment but you can see the potential of what the finished product will be. There has been every effort made to minimize disruption to the members and I appreciated that they recognized this in their treatment of their current members. Helen was really friendly and understood the reason I had for joining the gym and what I needed from David Lloyd to make this happen regarding childcare. I would recommend booking a tour as there is potential discounts that are being run which are only available when you enquire directly. All staff were really friendly and approachable including the reception staff and also the manager Kev who had a quick 10 mins to talk to us and also explain the introduction of the e-gym later in the year. I was really happy with the service and I look forward to being able to enjoy the facilities at West End.
showerReviews.author: Sian Louise Dyke

locations.title: Romsey Rapids Sports Complex
locations.address: îƒˆSouthampton Rd, Romsey SO51 8AF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Facilities are very appealing to families with children (very child friendly place to be fair.)

Below are the reasons why I rated it 2 stars but I'm happy to review it in the future and hopefully rate it higher...

-As a monthly paying parent of a child who attends swimming lessons I have to say that recently the place has been making some poor business decisions (which have been noticed by monthly paying families as a collective).

We all understand that prices tend to go up and especially when they've now implemented what they call "the 50 week a year system" but on top of that having to pay extra for soft playground after kids swimming lessons where they have a bit of an opportunity to socialise with their friends of their groups is being looked at as a very bad decision. It would make more sense to pay extra for it if someone wouldn't be on a monthly plan.
Costa would also benefit a bit more from it as parents socialise and for example "hey let's grab a coffee and catch up" or the kids burning their energy and then ask for snacks which would be a "win-win" for all parties. I've mentioned this in the reception but all I was told was "it's a different company"...

I hope Mr Ian sees this review and actually consider giving access to those who have an active monthly plan for their kids at least. Even if it's indeed different companies.... both would only benefit from kids who have classes playing freely right?

On top of this, it would be nice to see the cleaning standards improved since the prices have increased; the floor in the changing rooms is usually pretty messy and perhaps add a couple of extra family changing cubicles?!
showerReviews.author: Francisco Fraga

showerReviews.reviewText:
Facilities are very appealing to families with children (very child friendly place to be fair.)

Below are the reasons why I rated it 2 stars but I'm happy to review it in the future and hopefully rate it higher...

-As a monthly paying parent of a child who attends swimming lessons I have to say that recently the place has been making some poor business decisions (which have been noticed by monthly paying families as a collective).

We all understand that prices tend to go up and especially when they've now implemented what they call "the 50 week a year system" but on top of that having to pay extra for soft playground after kids swimming lessons where they have a bit of an opportunity to socialise with their friends of their groups is being looked at as a very bad decision. It would make more sense to pay extra for it if someone wouldn't be on a monthly plan.

I've mentioned this in the reception but all I was told was "it's a different company"...

I hope Mr Ian sees this review and actually consider giving access to those who have an active monthly plan for their kids at least. Even if it's indeed different companies.... both would only benefit from kids who have classes playing freely right?

On top of this, it would be nice to see the cleaning standards improved since the prices have increased; the floor in the changing rooms is usually pretty messy and perhaps add a couple of extra family changing cubicles?!

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been here and it was a pretty good time for a picnic which can be ideal to go there. But the hygiene has caught my attention which they should focus on because I went to the toilets and the floor was with pure disgust there should be janitors there. There are some activities in the paddling pool which can be good giving fun to kids, but also hygiene again there was some mud there and grass and sand there which rubbed onto my body. The aftermath of being in the pool there should have been some changing rooms available because I was very uncomfortable changing outside with other people. Safety is also important as I did not see any lifeguards. I would probably not recommend this 2/10. Only for picnics in my opinion.

locations.title: Lymington Sea Water Swimming Baths
locations.address: îƒˆBath Rd, Lymington SO41 3SE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a great place for all ages. The water is cold but you can hire wet suits for Â£6.  The sessions are almost two hours so itâ€™s decent value for money.  Also a nice little cafe and New Forest ice cream.  Showers and changing rooms are sufficient. Lots of seating dotted around for spectators.

Parking is sometimes busy so leave plenty of time.

We did the 11am-12.50 session followed by a drive in to the new Forest for a picnic after, making for a good family day out.

Adults can spectate for Â£2.50 or swim in the separate section for just Â£4.50â€¦ or of course take part.

Special mention to staff today who were fab and super informative.  We were greeted by a lifeguard who gave us a rundown of the rules and safety info which was much appreciated.  Also everyone has to wear a buoyancy aid, which is provided.
showerReviews.author: Kerry Bunn

showerReviews.reviewText:
Everyone seemed to be having a great time here.

The lagoon is split into three areas, the swimming area, which is a decent size, split into a family area and lane swimming. It's very cheap to book too (Â£2.25 per child, Â£4.50 per adult for 2 hours).

The inflatables, which are a lot more expensive (around Â£70 for 4 people) but it's a very large course and they get nearly 2 hours on it.

The third area is sectioned off for paddleboarding (Â£10/hour)which was not very busy, they say a maximum of 8-10 people at a time but for the first hour there were only 2 and then 3 during the second hour.

Wetsuits can be hired for Â£5.

Lifejackets are provided in the entry cost.

There were staff everywhere, around 10 lifeguards too. All very helpful and friendly.

On entry to the site a lifeguard greets each family/group privately and inducts them.

The site is a little shabby around the edges but doesn't let it down too much.

Â£2.50 fee for spectators which doesn't get you anything other than entrance seems a little unnecessary.
showerReviews.author: Gary Bowdery

locations.title: YMCA Southampton
locations.address: îƒˆ8 Cranbury Pl, Southampton SO14 0LG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
my child went here for a school trip, it costed me almost Â£300 and a Â£10 deposit. I am a single mum. found it dificult to pay such a extourcinate price but my daughter desperately wanted to go. my child, age 13 came back filthy (due to the disgusting shower facilities there which she refused to use), hungry, upset and scammed. she tells me the food was, excuse the wording but, minging. One night, she could only have one undercooked sausage instead of two undercooked sausages becuase her group thingy was served last, which is plain unfair. she went hungry. my daughter said the rest of the food was in fact in-edible even if there was enough to go round. lake is no different to swimming in sewage- bring swimming shoes. apart from the decent water activities, this establishment offers many great activities such as making teenagers do team building (activities they are too old for) with wooden building blocks! (also proceeding to pour water on girls wearing WHITE tops "for a bit of fun" , which I will add to). tuck shop was expensive for what it is. made our kids run about in activities during a HEATWAVE (37 degrees approx) which is unhealthy.
I could be here all day explaining why you shouldn't go here. its all run down and trashy and an over all poo hole.
not to mention your 'workers', which one male volunteer touching some girls who were on the trip in order to draw on eachother with pen (and I don't see a problem with having fun like that on camp but touching girl's faces as a grown man in order to draw on their face is unnecesary) this was the same man who poured water on the childeren including girls (who made it very clear they weren't up for this) with white t shirts on! Clearly careless on who they allow to volunteer. If you need a little summer job, defo go here because they'll take anyone!
in conclusion, disgusting food, noncey staff, unnaceptable accomodation (slept on cold wooden floor) unhygenic, uncleaned facilities, don't go here.
p.s: I am not exaggerating with my negativity at all so don't take this down! x

locations.address: îƒˆFairthorne Manor, YMCA, Southampton SO30 2GH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Campsite review only  (not the activity centre, who were fantastic)

We have recently had a large group at YMCA Fairthorne for the second year running.
We were shocked this year at the state of the shower/loo block. Overflowing sanitary bins, blocked and dirty loos, toilet paper all over the floor. I did mention this at reception at the time but nothing was done about it. We were there for 2 nights and they were not cleaned once. It really ruined our experience and we won't be returning next year. Such a shame because the setting is lovely.
This review is purely based on the state of the campsite/toilet block. The staff down at the river were wonderful and really helpful.

showerReviews.reviewText: If you are visiting Southampton, Cartland are opening a new truckstop in Southampton docks opening 1sept 2025 6am with 130 parking spaces , shower / toilets 24/7 - a menu with home cooked food open 6am - 22.00 Monday - Friday - 8am -14.00 Saturday closed Sunday for food . Dock gate 20 though security gate 3rd exit roundabout truckstop sign posted . More details to follow.

showerReviews.reviewText: If you are visiting Southampton, Cartland are opening a new truckstop in Southampton docks opening 1sept 2025 6am with 130 parking spaces , shower / toilets 24/7 - a menu with home cooked food open 6am - 22.00 Monday - Friday - 8am -14.00 Saturday closed Sunday for food . Dock gate 20 though security gate 3rd exit roundabout truckstop sign posted . More details to follow.
showerReviews.author: David Monk

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a relatively new truck stop, but the showers and toilets are disgraceful.

There are 2 showers for 130 spaces plus any that want a break. The showers spray water everywhere but down towards you. The shower heads are full of limescale it is clogging the holes in the shower head. The water temperature is hit and miss, if it is freezing outside then the showers will be cold. If it's hot outside then the showers will be very hot. The showers look as if they have never been cleaned, they are yellowing, slimy and mold is starting to grow.

The toilets are filthy and are only cleaned once a day if they are lucky. There are 4 toilets (2 are unisex instead of female only) for 130 truck drivers plus any that stop for a short break. The toilets and floors will be covered in wee and poo. Toilet  paper and soap regularly run out. They have replaced the electric door locks that failed to work 100% of the time with flimsy flip locks that can be easily broken.

They have switched off heating in the disabled/unisex toilet which has stopped the hand dryer from working. The water to wash your hands is freezing cold unless you have 5 minutes to waste to run the water until its warm.

For something that's less then 6 months old, it is falling apart fast. The management have neglected the facilities as it costs them money.
showerReviews.author: Nathaniel Crowe

The toilets are filthy and are only cleaned once a day if they are lucky. There are 4 toilets (2 are unisex instead of female only) for 130 truck drivers plus any that stop for a short break. The toilets and floors will be covered in wee and poo. Toilet  paper and soap regularly run out. They have replaced the electric door locks that failed to work 100% of the time with flimsy flip locks that can be easily broken.

They have switched off heating in the disabled/unisex toilet which has stopped the hand dryer from working. The water to wash your hands is freezing cold unless you have 5 minutes to waste to run the water until its warm.

For something that's less then 6 months old, it is falling apart fast. The management have neglected the facilities as it costs them money.
showerReviews.author: Nathaniel Crowe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well done on the investment, parking was great, food was great, showers and toilets are a joke to whoever designed it!
It's like they ran out of money, toilets are better in the Tesco Rdc (and that's saying something)
Need to look at the stock yard truckstop at their shower block and replace asap..
Other that the showers and toilets, this would be a superb place to stay, but drivers will avoid due to the above..

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for two nights before our cruise.  Based on the photos on their website, it creates a cozy but somewhat spacious room. Unfortunately for us, our experience was not in line with the photos provided.  The room was extremely small and dated. For the price paid per night Â£106 we felt this was very overpriced.  The bed was fine for sleeping, but again, for the price I expected better.  The bathroom looked renovated but was very small and closet like.  The shower pressure was decent, but there was no light above the shower, which created a dark area.  The window in our room was broken, and I'm not saying it wouldn't open. It was literally smashed. It's not very appealing to look at.  The front hallway/stair area had a smell of urine (stale cat pee) again, not appealing.  Finally, the worst thing we experienced was the ridiculous noise coming from the lower street bars and clubs.  They messaged us prior and said there was "possible nightlife noise." This was an understatement.   We could hear the music loud and clear even with the windows closed.  This went on until at least midnight.  As the night went on, the vibration from the bass was so intense that it shook the room.

The entry instructions for the room were detailed on WhatsApp.  The owners advise on the message to not hesitate to call or message if there are any issues.  We messaged 4 times (10 pm last night) with video evidence of the noise, but we still have not received a response (nor have they read these messages).

The only positive thing we will say is that the location to the city is great. It is within 5-10 minute walk to the town center and cruise ports.  Which is what we wanted.  The issues above, though, trump the location.

In conclusion, we will never return to this location, nor would we recommend staying here.  Find anything else in Southampton.
showerReviews.author: John Hruska

locations.title: ibis budget Southampton Centre
locations.address: îƒˆ3 W Quay Rd, Southampton SO15 1RA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Second time staying at this great budget location. Not sure how much you miss out on with this versus the full price version. We did not have a kettle, coffee maker, or safe. Bath towels but no hand towels. No USB outlets or outlets by the bed. If you can live without these things, then this is a great deal. The place is clean and modern and well maintained. Nice firm bed. Housekeeping does a great job here. There were no issues with the room. The location is optimal for the Horizon cruise terminal across the street, and a 10-minute walk. However, it's further away for the other ones. Still, it's only a 20-minute walk to the Ocean cruise terminal. No breakfast included unless you've paid for it. However, there is a microwave. Coffee is extra in the eating kitchen area. The common lounge/ dining area seems to be open all the time. Staff are friendly, helpful, and accommodating, especially if you're just as nice to them. The location is actually great considering it's an easy walk from the bus depot, central train station, and the cruise ship terminals. The main downside I would say is the noisy McDonald's ventilation system just outside. You can't sleep with the window open and even with it closed you'll hear it.
showerReviews.author: Cory Sakai

I don't care what people do but don't want the smell of it in my room.
Advertised chocolate at the desk but apparently don't sell it anymore said the guy behind the desk while not removing the sign saying they do.
No tea/coffee and I'm no germ fode but the breakfast, as sparse as it was, croissants etc, was available to be touched and examined by the aforementioned smokers when the came back in, no hand washing or anything, just yuck!

The staff were nice and the location for cruising was excellent.

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked a caravan, and two pitches for entire family to celebrate my brothers 50th. We had a few issues to begin with, entirely my fault. MDL went above and beyond to ensure I left happy and satisfied. It is a great park, small and quiet. Toilet and shower block are the best I've been too. The marina bar/restaurant is lovely, staff are friendly and great. Our grandson loves the cheesy garlic bread. Would highly recommend- if booking a caravan, double check your details of who's staying first! We did leave early, but only because one dog ended up at emergency vet, during the first few days we were told our landlord was selling our house and we had six weeks to move! And then my grandson choked on his bacon at the nearby cafe!! He's OK now! We just felt unable to relax! ðŸ˜‚

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have recently returned from 3 nights at Lepe Meadows site, which is separate to the beach site. The free kitchen pack swayed us and I'm so glad it did. We stayed as a family and with another family.
The toilets and washing up area were exceptionally clean, the whole time. We saw them being regularly cleaned. The showers were warm and very pleasant.
There was SO much space for the kids the play in. You must take bikes or scooters. Ours spent hours on them every day.
Riley the very friendly campsite dog was a huge hit.
It was great having the option to order breakfast baps in the morning and delicious wood fired pizzas for dinner.
The icing on the cake was the very hospitable host, Nick and his helpful colleague Jack. Nick was very friendly and approachable. He would regularly check in with guests to make sure they were enjoying their holiday and would go out of his way to make sure everything was OK. That kind of personal touch really makes a place stand out from others.
If you're looking for a family friendly, tranquil place with lots of space, then you won't be disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Fran sewing

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wouldnâ€™t recommend and wonâ€™t be going back. The website makes it sound as if youâ€™ll be camping on the beach - that is not the case. The website also notes that campers have a 10 metre pitch so you donâ€™t feel like youâ€™re on top of each other - thatâ€™s not the case either.
This is a large field, and was full of families and groups. Itâ€™s a short walk to the sea, big open skies at night and the kids were having a wonderful time running around with flashing toys at night - Iâ€™m sure they all had a lovely time, but not a peaceful private escape to Iâ€™d hoped for. Iâ€™d suggest the website is updated to reflect that.
In 40 years of camping I have never been anywhere with so many signs and instructions. Ever ðŸ¤£
Compostable toilets which reminded me of a festival block - stinky. Very basic showers - you wouldnâ€™t want to touch anything.
I can see the staff work hard and they were all polite and helpful. But there are many sites across the UK that have far more charm and offer better value for money. Not for me, sorry.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve stayed here once a year for about 4 or 5 years in a row and always had a great time. The last visit was a complete washout â€” the weather was awful, and the campsite was almost empty, maybe six other campers in total. But, my friends and I decided to stick it out to have a good weekend like done previously.

Because of the rain, we managed to get our hands on a gazebo so we could at least try to enjoy the weekend. Before we even had it set up, the male owner came over and told us weâ€™d have to pay extra if we wanted to put it up.

Now, I completely understand this rule when the site is busy, itâ€™s fair if the gazebo takes up valuable space. But when the campsite is empty and weâ€™re just trying to make the best of a miserable, wet weekend, it felt a bit money-grabbing. Iâ€™m sure the hundreds of other campers who didnâ€™t show up that weekend didnâ€™t get refunds, so the campsite wasnâ€™t losing out.

It was disappointing after so many good stays, and it definitely left a sour taste this time. I have since taken my yearly camping trip elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: alex

locations.title: Three Trees Campsite
locations.address: îƒˆAmpfield hill, Romsey SO51 9BD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for two nights. Very peaceful.  Arrival was easy with a friendly greeting from Kay.  We took as recommended the number 66 bus (just a few minutes walk around the corner from the campsite) into Romsey which was a very pleasant town.  The White Horse Inn near to the campsite we can recommend for food with a nice interior or garden area.

We paid Â£70 for two nights.  The facilities were a little basic for the price, we did feel in comparison with other campsites.  The showers were annoyingly on 5 second timings and there was a distinct smell from perhaps the dirty mops /water bucket left out for patrons to clean behind themselves.

Overall though we did enjoy our peaceful stay. Thank you.
showerReviews.author: anna nardecchia

showerReviews.reviewText:
Greedy Owner! Typical or likely. Visited the UK recently and visited The Three Trees campsite and quite disappointed.The owner must not care about anyone or anything and just racking that cash.ðŸ˜ž

Bad points:

-No internet at all! Absolutely atrocious!
(Where are your towers?)

-Use mobile ðŸ“± data this will help you get connection for 50% 60% of the time.

-No WiFi (awful and not safe having no connection in a  foreign country/new area)

-Potholes everywhere! Damages your car and scratched the RV.

-Dangerous at night(No lights anywhere) and walking in pot holes nearly twisted my ankle 2x to 3x(a hospital visit) not good as we are older.

-No Lights anywhere (any murderer/Bush weirdo could be walking around your motorhome or camping out in the bathroom at night  and wouldn't see them) I would be nervous for my wife/partner if she was here

-No barriers(no protection for the RV) and anyone! Literally anyone can walk on the site 24/7...I didn't feel safe 100%

-Stones everywhere that hit and scratch your motorhome(very disheartening  if you pay triple figures)

-Toilet blocks quite clean but mold around.

Its like a ghost campsite all dark slow and boring like an outdoor hospice at times no campsite night life, felt sad.

GOOD POINTS.

-Nice Warden(Site mananger)

(Welcoming/Warm/Caring/Very Helpful and does a good job helping and advice)

-Nice and quiet to sleep at night

-Locals on town are freindly with Romsey Swimming centre nearby.

-Beautiful animals and nature.

-Marvellous Tree ðŸŒ³ scenery.

-Very helpful people kind people on site.

-Relaxed atmosphere.

-In nature with ambient nature sounds.

-Close to Shops/Department store 2k-5km into Romsey Town.

-Good Electric hookups and water this was brilliant!

-24/7 Security cameras.

-Toilets and bathroom ðŸš» clean.

-Fantastic Showers almost perfect very hot.

-Decent Drainage system.

Overall:

The Campsite has good potential but needs a lot of work and extras done.The land owner does need to get their act together as this can be and has great potential for a decent small campsite(perhaps even extend the campsite)

Three Trees is a  traditional English town/Village and is a Must visit campsite and town for a day or two.
showerReviews.author: Karen

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice adults only site near Romsey with very spacious pitches. Some road noise with a difficult to spot entrance. The facilities are in need of some improvement, we experienced cold showers, toilets that wouldn't flush and flooded floors. The washing up sink was too small and with no cover, meaning you would need an umbrella if it rains! Enjoyed our stay at this great location but sadly will not be inclined to return unless the shower block is given an update.

Could do with more lighting around the park.
If you have a big car and van the pitches are small and struggle to put on an awning.
Good location to walk to Romsey which has everything need and a lovely canal walk.
Dogs welcome and no issue with having 4.
Bin available but no recycling  which not an issue to us.

locations.title: Shelley Oaks Farm & Campsite (New Forest)
locations.address: îƒˆShelley Ln, Romsey SO51 6AS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just returned from a wonderful mini break and Shelley Oaks Campsite, and would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone. The space between pitches is huge, so despite having neighbours, we didn't feel at all overlooked or cramped. The site is tucked away from the main road, and although you can hear it sometimes, it's really not at all intrusive.
The toilet and shower block is great! Immaculate at all times of day and night, with plenty of hot water and two sinks for washing up dishes etc. The fridge freezer and phone charging point is a plus too.
Being just outside of the new forest has the bonus of BBQ's and fire pits, while everything within thew new forest is easily reachable.
The host, Caroline, was very helpful and friendly. No pressure to get up and out on departure day, in fact a text was received in the morning, to that effect! Zero stress, just what you need on a holiday.
We would definitely come again, if we're in the area.
Gareth, Laura and Euan
showerReviews.author: Gareth Purves

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a warm and friendly welcome from Stacey when we arrived. She was also helpful in finding areas of interest for us to make the most of our break. The park is quiet and clean and the accommodation, whilst fairly basic, was clean and practicable.

Shower was excellent with lots of hot water - the best I have experienced in a caravan. We also needed a little heat first thing, believe it or not, on day 2 and this was also very effective and almost immediate. The only downsides, from my point of view, was the bar prices. Â£6+ for a bottled beer was a bit steep in my opinion. Also, the location of the park is a little remote from the main attractions such as the New Forest on the other side of the water.

Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a quiet and pleasant stay but not much for kids to do. That suited us!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I chose to come to Long Meadow mainly because it was about the only campsite still open that late in the year (the week before Halloween 2025) and I was not disappointed.

The only hiccup was on arrival where I arrived 10 minutes after the office closed for a 3 hour long cleaning interval so I did not know where to pitch my tent. The staff, after I explained I did not want to wait 3 hours to pitch, went into the office and found my pitch so that made it OK in the end but do be aware that between 11 and 2 the office is shut!

With that out of the way I can say my daughter and I had the best time. The site is flat and tents are pitched easily, the facilities are excellent - there are hot shower, toilets, washing up facilities and even a washing machine and tumble drier.

I was under canvas however there are lots of options for different pitch types including for caravans and campers.

We took a walk through the nearby woodland and found it to be a really fun place for kids (and dads) to play. Location wise you can't go wrong with Brockenhurst with it's easy access to many different fun activities.

The staff were really helpful, as I've already said, and made both of us feel really welcome. For my daughter's first camping experience (that isn't in the back garden) this was spot on.
showerReviews.author: Bradato Kopele

showerReviews.reviewText: We rented a private caravan for 2 weeks whilst house sale went through. Stayed in a lot of the parks around the area and this is definitely up there with the best of them. Extremely clean and well kept grounds, lovely ancient woods for walking the dog, football pitch, golf course, driving range all superb. Only slight disappointment is the pool which is very shallow all the way and often half is closed off for lessons or activities which makes swimming lengths pretty much impossible but good for young kids I guess. Sauna and steam room are nice, jacuzzi is pool temperature so not great compared to others. Club house is lovely and other than pool and jacuzzi it's a hard park to fault. Great location for accessing everything in the area.

showerReviews.reviewText: What a great caravan holiday park, they have got everything right, large spacing between caravans, access from the park straight into the new forest, onside shop and two electric charging points. locations.title: Hoburne Naish Holiday Park
locations.address: îƒˆChristchurch Rd, Naish Estate, Barton on Sea, New Milton BH25 7RE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Amazing week with my husband and our Dog.
Found this place last year on our way home from another holiday park and decided to book a week as it offers Dog friendly apartments.
Greeted by Lovely ladies upon arrival and Found our apartment and were really pleased with it.
A big double bedroom down stairs and a good sized bedroom upstairs with 2 single beds and plenty of storage space.
Good sized kitchen area with everything we needed for our stay and 2 decent sized sofas in the living room area.
The views from the windows were amazing and we could actually see the sea.
Short walk down to the beach which we had a code for the gate and it was lovely.
The bar/restaurant was really surprising as it looks smaller than it actually it But there was plenty of tables and chairs and as it's Dog friendly there were even Dog mattresses to sit on.
Nice sized arcade with plenty of machines and games to play on.
Indoor pool which always had lots of people visiting and offering adult only and family swimming sessions.
Really lovely setting and well maintained and spotlessly clean.
2 bus stops within walking distance and we took various trips into other places.
Really really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be booking again and would definitely recommend this lovely holiday park
showerReviews.author: jacqueline gibling

showerReviews.reviewText:
DREADFUL cafe ruining a quite lovely centre.

Started swimming here regularly as it's close to my office and the pool and leisure centre are lovely, clean changing rooms, warm showers and a generally pleasant experience. Unfortunately this is let down by the atrocious service in the cafe.

Today i was third in the queue, but the lady serving decided it was more important to have long meandering chats with the two customers before me, and then a separate customer, and then when i did eventually get to the front of the queue she decided it was a better customer service choice to then very slowly prepare the salad to go with the toasties she had literally JUST put in the machine than serve another customer! I even asked if she could serve me but was totally ignored. Eventually after about five minutes or waiting ignored i had to leave. Atrocious customer service that needs looking at ASAP

locations.title: South Reading Leisure Centre
locations.address: îƒˆNorthumberland Ave, Reading RG2 8DH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I rejoined this gym 8 weeks ago.  Have used it on and off over the years.

Myself and a work colleague decided it was time to start to get into shape.

We used the gym for a week then thought we'd ask for a gym indication as on the app none available after school hours which we needed ( as work in a school)   we spoke to a gentleman on the reception desk , and he said he would pass our details onto the lady who does it.  She emailed me the next day and advised she could fit us both in thr next day.  Her name is Lisa,  she showed us around the gym and was very thorough  and polite and very helpful.

During the October half term, I managed to try out some day classes and daytime swimming and aqua aerobics.

All of the instructors were so helpful as it was our first time, classes were great fun and made us ache the next day.

We one day saw lisa , and asked if she'd could show us how to use some.different machine, and she did, again she was brilliant.

The staff there are always polite , say hello, day goodbye and make general chit chat.  Always feel welcome , even on the days I feel nervous about doing a new class I know ill be fine as they are all very polite.

Hopefully in a year ill be a fitter and healthier person. And I know I will be thanks to the support off the staff here.

Thankyou :-)
showerReviews.author: Jaime Price

showerReviews.reviewText:
Positives first. The very small amount of staff we did see, were lovely. The pool was ok, but we booked a family fun swim which stated plenty of toys available, but we found these had to be asked for, and 3 balls were bought out, nothing else. I expect with so few staff, they can't get too much out because of time having to be spent clearing it back up.

The negatives - the changing rooms (female) were so dirty. The no shoe rule is not mentioned when you arrive and it's certainly not.followed by anyone. The ladies changing rooms also seemed to be the only available female toilet in the building, where as there is a stand alone male toilet by the hall. Meaning more shoes being worn through the changing rooms.

The floors were visibly dirty, nobody was in and out cleaning like you see at other Better Centres.

After our swim we found there was dog poo from someone's shoe on the floor near the lockers, which i alerted staff to and the lad i spoke to was lovely and was apologetic, and said he'd tell his manager but that there were no female staff to enter the changing room and in the 40+ mins we spent in the changing rooms, it was not cleaned nor was a warning sign put up to allow people to avoid that spot at least. Nobody even came to look at it. It's my understanding you are able as staff to enter the changing rooms if you announce yourself, and wait for response.

In the group changing area there was blood stained boogers (yes, really!) dried on the wall on the right side as you walk in. Unbelievable really.

Really disappointing, with the right amount of staff and standards of cleanliness this place could be an asset but it's not being cared for.

On leaving there was nobody at the welcome desk and I should think that if that's a regular thing, anyone can walk in there which isn't safe in today's society.

I'm sorry to leave a bad review to be honest. But needs must.

Do Better.
showerReviews.author: Hazel Vockins

locations.title: Palmer Park Leisure Centre & Stadium
locations.address: îƒˆWokingham Rd, Reading RG6 1LF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great facility overall but too crowded and in need of a tighter control for swimmers.

Pros: It's a new facility only 2 years old so obviously the changing areas, gym equipment and overall facilities are good. Nice showers, hot water, etc.
Aerobic area in the gym has a lot of different machines and covers all basis.

Cons: Pool and classes are super crowded and you have to book days in advance if you don't have flexibility with your times.
The pool is too shallow (only 90 cm one end) so for anyone trying to do competitive swimming this is a no-go, you can't turn properly and you are likely to touch the bottom if you have long arms. The pool is designed for kids and 'teaching' which is fair.
There's a booking process but some people don't respect it and some days you find 30 people in a pool which has 6 lanes, obviously this is too much. Lanes are 2 slow (for people who can't swim and who just want to go and float in water), 2 medium and 2 fast. So if you want to swim you are restricted to 4 lines which is not good enough.
Also some people access the pool with gym t shirts and underwear and while I understand it is complicated to challenge this, it has to be done.

Outside velodrome / athletics court... Very difficult to understand who can access and when. Staff refer you to website and app to find out what activities you can do, they are not aware. There's huge potential for using this but most days it is empty so clearly underutilized which means I am not the only one who is not clear about the rules.

Conclusion - improvement needed to make it more user friendly and control crowds a bit in the pool.
showerReviews.author: Carswift

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great facility overall but too crowded and in need of a tighter control for swimmers.

Pros: It's a new facility only 2 years old so obviously the changing areas, gym equipment and overall facilities are good. Nice showers, hot water, etc.
Aerobic area in the gym has a lot of different machines and covers all basis.

Cons: Pool and classes are super crowded and you have to book days in advance if you don't have flexibility with your times.
The pool is too shallow (only 90 cm one end) so for anyone trying to do competitive swimming this is a no-go, you can't turn properly and you are likely to touch the bottom if you have long arms. The pool is designed for kids and 'teaching' which is fair.
There's a booking process but some people don't respect it and some days you find 30 people in a pool which has 6 lanes, obviously this is too much. Lanes are 2 slow (for people who can't swim and who just want to go and float in water), 2 medium and 2 fast. So if you want to swim you are restricted to 4 lines which is not good enough.
Also some people access the pool with gym t shirts and underwear and while I understand it is complicated to challenge this, it has to be done.

Outside velodrome / athletics court... Very difficult to understand who can access and when. Staff refer you to website and app to find out what activities you can do, they are not aware. There's huge potential for using this but most days it is empty so clearly underutilized which means I am not the only one who is not clear about the rules.

Conclusion - improvement needed to make it more user friendly and control crowds a bit in the pool.
showerReviews.author: Carswift

showerReviews.reviewText: One of the best parks in Reading to spend time with friends and family. The park has a good sand pit area for kids and an outdoor gym area for adults. The leisure centre is also very good. The swimming pool is a good one for beginners but not suitable for seasoned swimmers. The only downside is parking, if you come in any evenings (both weekdays or weekends) you will have a tough time finding a spot to park.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Loddon Valley yesterday(saturday),and me and my wife were extremely pleased with the experience and customer service we received.

The front reception and the lady at the cafe,were extremely welcoming,and very polite and cheerful.The cafe was very neat,and the lady was very engaging,and gave us a quick service!!

Two young gentlemen at reception,named Jack and another named Emran,bless them both were very amiable and cheerful.
Jack provided us with sufficient information,regarding the facilities and the new refurbishment which had taken place at the gym,he was extremely patient and told us everything there was to offer,including prices and extra information which isnâ€™t advertised.
Emran provided my wife with a comprehensive tour of the leisure center, detailing the diverse range of classes available and information regarding swimming lessons,my wife was very sold off and will be getting a membership for herself,and our daughter.

On the whole, the leisure center is impressive. However, the reason for the 4 star is, the presence of numerous unsupervised children in the gym impacted my experience/view. Implementing a clearer policy regarding gym usage and ensuring consistent staff supervision would significantly improve the environment.

The Centre was also notably crowded during my visit. While I am unsure if a maximum occupancy limit is enforced, staff did mention an event was taking place, which may have contributed to the increased volume of users. Perhaps clearer communication about event-related crowding could be beneficial.

Overall,seems like a massive upgrade since the last time we came!
showerReviews.author: joseph wane

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym is overall good. Could do with a few more pieces of equipment but can still get a good workout done.

Pool is fantastic, sauna and steam rooms too. Showers and numerous changing rooms, and squash, badminton and outer tennis courts.

Biggest downside is the admin fee they charge for membership (Â£30) which is an utter scam, on top of an already hefty membership charge.  Their reasoning is "to set up the direct debit" which is obviously nonsense. Worse is, if you cancel your membership you will have to pay the fee again.

You can pause your membership for Â£5 a month. They also provide a 5 day trial for free which is nice.

Overall - good equipment and facilities, friendly staff, but the pricing can be hard to stomach and it's obvious they're making undue money off said fees.
showerReviews.author: Bijoy Das

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall, it's not bad. The problem is definitely the music played so loudly in the room that I can't hear myself think. Some people don't understand that others come home from work to work out, and the music they like won't always be liked by others, and it's not always so loud. If I want to go to a disco, I know where to go. I don't mind the music, even if it's not my style, but sometimes I really can't hear the guy next to me. The steam room definitely needs to be cleaned after a long day because it's dirty. The showers are constantly out of detergent, and they could use a scrub at the end of the day. Besides, you can be happy being a member. I hope someone, the right people, reads this.

Nice, very small gym. They have few class, interesting classes (abs workout, cycling, yoga, zumba). Love the Zumba teacher, she is absolutely amazing! Early morning classes are only virtual (with a TV).
Spa: clean and heated pool, few lounge chairs (most of time all occupied by people or just with their towel), very small Steam Room and a little
larger Sauna. The showers are also with warm and cold water (adjustable).
No jacuzzi :-/
They provide towels (a small one for gym and a big one for the Spa)!
They have a car parking, once you've taken a photo of the code at the reception, you need to enter it into the small computer located in the underground parking lot below the Hilton Hotel. Itâ€™s a bit annoying but necessary :) you can park free for 3 hours.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Boyfriend and I signed up and initially everything was great.

But the cracks quickly started to show.. The day after we'd signed up, a discount came out, I emailed both the manager and deputy manager asking if we could be apart of it but heard nothing back.

We went to cancel our membership and were greeted with awkward wording to try and keep us (such-as making it sound like it would cost to cancel. Only after questioning it, did he say there was no cost). Which then lead to no actual confirmation of cancellation. Boyfriend and I both just cancelled our direct debits instead.

The place itself isn't very clean.. especially during busy times around the pool. Sauna is far too small and relatively busy and the gym being 'reasonably priced' for the facilities means the demographic definitely changes. Most are respectable but you do get the 'lads lads lads' on Friday evening.. Sauna filled with men, joking about how much they'd creep on women in the ladies changing room if they could. Pool is also almost always quite busy and is very small.

Just overall, a very disappointing experience.
showerReviews.author: Sink Mince

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently visited this winter swimming pool, and it exceeded my expectations! The water temperature was ideal â€” warm enough to be comfortable even on the coldest days, but still refreshing. The pool area was clean and well-maintained, and the locker rooms were tidy with plenty of space.

What really stood out was the atmosphere: calm, relaxing, and perfect for both exercise and leisure. The staff were welcoming and always ready to help, ensuring everything ran smoothly. Whether youâ€™re a serious swimmer or just looking to unwind, this is the perfect spot for winter swimming. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back regularly this season!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great SPA; nicely organised and not too expensive. Very friendly staff.
Pool: it was at 24 degrees when we came. Quite cold but nice if you go into the sauna first.
Jacuzzi: much warmer, spent most of my time here. Low on bubbles and very relaxing.
Sauna: pretty large and spacious. You need your towel for this one.
Steam room: my preferred hot one. It got pretty steamy in there, especially if you stand up. Sitting down was easy.

We had breakfast there also and it was delicious; well worth our trip out from London.
showerReviews.author: Nico M

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had such a lovely spa day package including lunch yesterday.
So starting from the beginning:
Parking: is very limited depending what time you go. Thereâ€™s a public Ringo paid for car park out the front which is where I ended up going but if you can get into their car park I think itâ€™s free or cheaper.
The setting itself is quirky and buzzy and I loved it, the pool was a great temperature and the sauna was wonderful.
The jacuzzi was always busy and a little small and the steam room wasnâ€™t very steamy and in need of an update. The cold bucket was fun after the sauna too.
I wish they provided some flip flops as I forgot mine (even if theyâ€™re paid for) and wish there was more comfortable seating around to read a book as this seemed limited but didnâ€™t detract from my overall experience.
I also got very cold from being wet and sat outside before my massage and even after I showered I wish Iâ€™d brought an extra towel so I wasnâ€™t sat back in a wet robe (didnâ€™t think ahead).
I had a full body massage and the massage rooms sit above the edge of the pool. You can hear the indistinct chatter and clanging of cutlery but I actually found this to be really relaxing rather than it being so quiet with a bit of spa music. The massage was amazing and I came out feeling so relaxed and the masseuse took me to the tea room and offered a selection of herbal teas after and it helped warm me back up.
The lunch was unbelievable - service was good and quick and very tasty.
All in all - such an amazing value spa day and really well done - thereâ€™s a few minor things that could be done to make the experience 5* overall but you canâ€™t knock it!
Thank you so much
showerReviews.author: Jordan Moore

From beginning to end the whole experience of an incredible massage, beautiful nighttime swimming, sauna, steam and hot tub, finished off with an exquisite meal overlooking a truly enchanting, festive scene. Thank you all so much, I will be back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a great experience and so well organised.
Loved that there were no kids in there when I arrived at 5.30pm.

One thing I didnâ€™t realise was that it was a lap pool instead of just swimming/ chilling. It did get more relaxed towards the end.

They said it was 26 degrees but was freezing. You do eventually get used to the temperature. The hot tub was crowded and felt more like the temperature the pool should have been but was perfect on a warm day.

The food, drinks and service was impeccable. Canâ€™t wait to come back again and try the rest of it. Seriously so, so good!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros -

Really thoughtfully refurbished and brought back to life. Plenty of choice when it comes to packages, combo deals. I liked the eucalyptus scent in the steam room. It felt quite spacious, considering it was a Saturday lunchtime - pool area was split into fast lane, medium lane and â€œchill and chatâ€ lane. Sauna had a nice big window looking out onto the pool area, in fact generally speaking it felt quite light due to the big windows around the pool. 2 of us had neck, back, shoulder massage and facial (mine was by Michelle and my mum had Carole, who was also very good) and 1 of us had the exfoliator treatment, these were excellent and professional, felt super relaxed. Good quality herbal infusion made for us afterwards. I thought parking wasnâ€™t bad value (Â£11 for the whole day paid on departure, although first 3 hours are free. Caution as there is a small car park directly in front of the Lido car park, which I believe is run by a different company). Dinner as part of the package was very good, better than we had been expecting, given some reviews. We paid extra for the steak, and had desserts. Staff explained procedures and timings / what to expect. Towel and robe provided for massage packages only (no footwear). Relaxed vibe - didnâ€™t need to rush to get dressed post massage to enjoy our meal, we were able to eat whilst robed (I guess that could be off-putting for those only attending to eat).

Cons -

Overall online booking process I found quite long-winded. The main pool was much colder than we were expecting (great as a cold plunge after sauna though). Hot tub was quite small, and by far the most popular area. Didnâ€™t find jacuzzi that others mention in reviews, was there a button to activate in the hot tub? Car park is quite small, so limited availability. Some of the staff in the restaurant were not the most warm or welcoming. Would be lovely to have some fresh juices on the menu. Relax area post-massage was quite small, imagine it wouldnâ€™t be that relaxing on a busy day. No area to lounge out and read a book, but to be honest if you booked the â€œswim, massage, mealâ€ option Iâ€™m not sure where youâ€™d find time to lounge as youâ€™re so packed with activities and two hours pre-massage is just right to sample a little of all of the areas offered (sauna/steam/pool).
showerReviews.author: Alice G

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been taking my son to this place for swiming lessons for approx 9 months and he still doesn't know how to swim and is not confident enough to go into the pool by himself. Besides the fact that the teachers have set abosolutelly no swiming plan for him, the swimming teachers have been changed or gone for holidays without any explanation provided. The relevant Swiming Manager is never to be found on the phone or in person  because they are located in Newbury. They comunicate only via e-mails. In relation to the staff attitude at the location, if you have a question and there is a response in the system for them to read to you is all good otherwise, don't have any expectations. The facilities are average and if you expect to do some work while you wait for your child to finish their lessons, forget about it because the internet is almost inexistent. There is a Nuffield public network which you can log into but is not reliable and the staff will just tell you that it works only in some parts of the building without providing you with any alternatives. Otherwise, the location has good parking.
showerReviews.author: Cosmin Andone

showerReviews.reviewText:
We too our son who is on the spectrum to lessons here as other swimming baths were less sympathetic or well setup. Lessons have been absolutely excellent. He has made great progress. We've been able to use a changing room which means I can help him wash in a low sensory environment. When he started he was phobic about water on the face and hair, he has excelled with the help of an extremely supportive helpful instructor who is very understanding. Groups are just the right size and in the first few stages there are several extra staff in each lesson in the pool to help. My only frustration has been how difficult it can be to get spaces in a group that suits if you don't race other parents to the desk and the crammed viewing places, although they've recently allowed parents into an overflow to watch at times.

I would always recommend Bradfield swimming lessons over any others in West reading. It's worth the extra price because the teaching is so much better, the kids progress steadily and with confidence. The facilities are well maintained and staff happy to chat about child's progress.
showerReviews.author: KatandAndy Clark

What really stands out is the staff â€” the trainers are approachable and genuinely helpful, not pretending to help like Iâ€™ve experienced at other gyms. That makes a huge difference.

A special shout-out to Ben â€” he consistently goes above and beyond. Heâ€™s great with technique, always takes the time to explain things properly, and keeps workouts motivating. His positive energy really improves the experience.

Maddie - Thanks for setting up the account for me.

Just a couple of small suggestions for improvement:

The menâ€™s changing room can often stay quite wet, so keeping the floor drier throughout the day would be great. While I know staff constantly try to keep it dry but it needs some attention

While there is already a full body-measurement machine, adding a simple digital weight-only scale would make quick progress check-ins easier.

Overall, this is a fantastic gym with a supportive team. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Ravi Ku

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym has all brand new facilities and high tech equipment. It's currently not super crowded and I'm able to use any machine that would like. The changing rooms are very clean and is frequently cleaned. I notice the staff are constantly cleaning the changing rooms so I feel very comfortable with the floor not being muddy or filled with lint or hair.
The classes are not as diverse as was originally advertised. The offf peak class offeri gs can include more cardio or high intensity classes like body combat or body pump. I don't know where the spinning classes are at the moment or how they are because there are no classes offered during off peak hours. I signed up for off peak because of the supposedly large variety and offerings of classes but it currently isn't the same as in the example schedule. I can only book a reformer class if I am lucky to book at midnight when the bookings open up otherwise they are filled up within minutes.
The quality of classes that I've been to are excellent with excellent teachers!
The pool is very warm and not as large as shown in the previously advertised pictures. The steam room is large enough to be comfortable with at least 5-7 others in there and very clean. I am also happy with the special perks that are given from being a member.

Also there's hardly any equipment, the place is tiny and doesn't seem like it has any air con- I suspect it would get pretty smelly and stuffy when there's a few people there. However I doubt this gym has a lot of members, hardly anyone was there at the peak time of after work, there was 4 people there. I would seriously save your money if you're considering this gym. It's not worth it. It let's it's hotel down.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member at The Gym in Reading West, and I have to say, it's been a fantastic experience. The facility is always clean and well-maintained, which is something I really appreciate. The variety of equipment available is impressive, and I never have to wait too long to use the machines or weights.

The classes at The Gym are top-notch. The instructors are knowledgeable and motivating, and they really push you to reach your fitness goals. I've tried a few different classes, like spin and yoga, and they've all been great. The timetable offers a good range of options, so there's something for everyone.

One thing that stands out about The Gym is the friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The staff is always helpful and approachable, and I've made some new friends through the gym community. The locker rooms are clean and spacious, and there's plenty of parking available nearby.

Overall, I highly recommend The Gym in Reading West. It's a great place to work out, with a clean and well-equipped facility, excellent classes, and a friendly atmosphere. Give it a try if you're looking for a gym in the area!"

showerReviews.reviewText:
PSA: lockers are closed from 1am to 3am

Not bad but the music is far too loud. EDIT: unless I'm losing it, I noticed louder music after 10pm, which was recently this gym's previous closing time. Maybe the system resets?

It's nice that it's gone 24/7 recently, but I mirror other sentiments that there's too many people.

I don't like reading from others that they revoke your access immediately after cancelling your direct debit, but it would not surprise me. An official statement on this matter would alleviate customer concerns.

One positive point, I emailed them about a broken accessory (it was a barbell wrap) and they actually put a new one in a few weeks later.

locations.title: 365 Gym
locations.address: îƒˆ365 Gym, Meadway Shopping Centre, Tilehurst, Reading RG30 4AA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is dirty, outdated, dark and in need of a refit. A lot of old equipment that hardly works (stair master, hair driers, pullie machines, incomplete weight set and hardly working aircon upstairs). Sauna, showers and changing rooms are old and broken, you leave feeling icky and itchy. Changing room wall had insects on it. Reusable wipes are wet when taken out of clean pile, a breeding ground for bacteria.

The leaving policy needs to be reviewed from a legal perspective. Entering the gym means you lose the cooling off period, even if you've never been inside before. Day passes are available only during the limited office hours, forcing people into monthly contracts to enter and lose the cooling off period. But a monthly sign up means you need to stay for 2 months unless you cancel within 1 day.
showerReviews.author: Heleret Marilin

locations.address: îƒˆArchway Rd, Reading RG4 8HX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Joining Caversham Health Club has been one of the greatest investments I have ever made in myself. It is the best gym I have ever joined. The highlights for me are definitely the classes, with my favourites being the boxing and weight lifting classes. I recently also tried Reformer Pilates for the first time in their lovely new studio and enjoyed it a lot!

I also really appreciate the extras the gym has such as the sauna, complimentary drinks area and the ghd hairdryers in the womenâ€™s changing rooms and love the overall aesthetic of the place, I sometimes like going there just to read a book with a coffee before  my classes!

I love how passionate the owners Isaac and Sophie are and how involved they are in the day to day running of the gym. They should be really proud of what they have created! Also the trainers are fantastic, Ramone, Ben and Keenan are one of the many there that are just so friendly and welcoming. They really are there to motivate you to achieve your fitness goals. I feel Iâ€™ve gotten so much stronger and fitter since joining and being someone who is quite self conscious in a gym setting, Iâ€™ve felt so comfortable there and actually enjoying going!

One of my favourite things is how all the trainers there know your name and try to get to know you. It really makes you feel part of a little community and family there. Itâ€™s not just a gym, it really has formed a big part of my lifestyle and has been one of the best decisions Iâ€™ve made since moving to Caversham! Could not recommend this place enough!

One of my favourite things is how all the trainers there know your name and try to get to know you. It really makes you feel part of a little community and family there. Itâ€™s not just a gym, it really has formed a big part of my lifestyle and has been one of the best decisions Iâ€™ve made since moving to Caversham! Could not recommend this place enough!
