showerReviews.reviewText:
I can not believe how the couple who own the pool, not the swimming coach, speaks to the parents! I was on the phone to a parent while her child was swimming and suddenly I heard a women say get out I donâ€™t want you hear! She went completely mad even threatened to call the police! There is a bench in the garden for parents to sit on while waiting for their child etc. she abused my poor friend who did not have a clue why she was told to leave especially as her child was in his lesson. This is not the first time the women has hurled abuse at parents. Also it frightened the next child who was getting ready to go to her lesson and had special needs.
I could not believe what I was hearing and it upset me to hear someone speak to my dear friend in that manner.
Please avoid.
After her reply***
** I am very upset and concerned by your reply to my post! It is pure lies on your behalf I was on the phone and heard every word of abuse that came out of your mouth to my friend. You were vile. I told her to record your behaviour for evidence which she did do! The two children, waiting for their lesson always spoke to my friend and her son who is special needs and a gentle man. The coach has never or ever had any problems with my friend or son. It was discussed with the coach that she was better off outside on the bench provide for people waiting as her son had much better concentration due to autism. My friend was never told about any so called rules that you had to stay at the side of the pool and the coach was happy with her to be outside. You have been abusive to many coaches and clients which I can clearly see in all your reviews. Not once was my friend abusive or aggressive to you or anyone else in all the time she has been going there. That is not even in her nature. You are trying to degrade and make out that my friend is trouble when that is pure lies and itâ€™s you. My friend will go out of her way to be friendly, kind and caring about anyone especially special
Edit ****** After you have deleted your first reply and wrote another one which is worse than the one before!
So now you have deleted your last reply, and came up with more pure lies!! You have now involved the coach and even lied about her! It was the coach who asked my friend to sit outside as her son concentrated better without her there! Her son who is autistic and very gentle, the one you keep rudely referring to as a large size male! You also repeatedly say you do not want him unaccompanied near other people! I would like to know what you actually mean by that? As I said he is a very quiet, gentle vulnerable autistic adult.
You refer to â€œstaff â€œ when the only staff present was the one swimming coach who was with her son and who could not see outside due to being in the pool, teaching her son. This same swimming coach is the one who is frightened of you but can not say anything thing as she does not want to loose her job.  However she did tell my friend that this was not the first time you have shown such vile behaviour and to read your reviews! You have also said my friend made the right decision not to come back but previously you lied and said it was you who told her not to come back. At no time was my friend aggressive or threatened the coach or anyone else. My friend is not a nasty or violent person.
As for me harassing you that is more lies. I have only written the truth on here and when you were recommended on line I have told people to read the reviews before booking! That is not slander or harassment in any way. Like I said you have deleted your first reply and now come back with this disgraceful slanderous reply which is full of lies. Your first reply was a week after my review and you changed it last week which is two months after my review! I am concerned why you needed to delete your review and put this rubbish up which actually makes you look worse than before and proves my point that you have broken regulations.
As for commenting about my health I would just like to say my health is perfect thank you but I am concerned about yours.
showerReviews.author: Tee Marie

locations.title: GBS Swim School
locations.address: îƒˆLeighton Park School, Shinfield Rd, Reading RG2 7DG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
As the mother of a 7-year-old autistic daughter who is passionate about swimming, I was heartbroken to see her confidence and self-esteem begin to decline. She couldnâ€™t understand why she wasnâ€™t progressing like some of her peers in school swimming lessons.

Another parent recommended I reach out to Sandra at GBS for their summer crash course, and Iâ€™m so glad I did. From our very first phone call, Sandra was incredibly understanding and kind â€” I immediately felt reassured. I had a good feeling, but what followed completely exceeded my expectations.

From the very first lesson, I was blown away. The level of expertise, patience, and insight from the instructors was remarkable. In just one hour, my daughter made progress that she hadnâ€™t in months elsewhere. Weâ€™ve tried several swim schools before, but GBS truly stands in a league of its own.

The two teachers working with my daughter are nothing short of amazing. They know exactly how to connect with her and bring out the best in her without me constantly needing to explain her autism. For the first time, I feel at ease, and more importantly, my daughter feels seen, supported, and capable.

Iâ€™m beyond grateful to have found this swim school.
showerReviews.author: Emma Moore

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our daughter began swimming lessons with GBS Swim School in April 2025, and the progress she has made in such a short time is amazing.

Before joining, she struggled if she couldn't touch the floor and hadn't really learned how to swim. After just two terms, she's just earned her 7.5 metres independent swim certificate, a remarkable improvement compared to the two years she spent at a local leisure centre with little progress!

The classes are small, and the teachers are exceptionally supportive, attentive, and encouraging to the children while teaching.

We couldn't recommend GBS Swim School enough!

locations.title: Wasing Wild Swim & Sauna
locations.address: îƒˆBrimpton Common, Reading RG7 4RT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I organised my 30th birthday at Wasing Wild Swim â€“ I cannot recommend this place enough!

Not only were the office team (Tania & Monica) so kind and supportive, the attendants on the day, Tom and Raisie, went above and beyond to create a safe, supportive and fun experience for my guests. Their attentiveness & care was truly exceptional, and all of the people who joined specifically mentioned how they had made their experience so fulfilling.

A lot of the people who came had never wild swum before, and some had said they were quite nervous ahead of time! But with Tom and Raisie's support, everyone managed to get in the water, and not only that â€“ they properly enjoyed the experience, with first-time swimmers now total cold-water converts!

I also recognised and was so grateful to Tom and Raisie for all the behind-the-scenes work they did to ensure I could focus on enjoying the day, and less on hosting. They were checking in with my guests, offering tea and refreshments, maintaining the sauna & checking in with me at points throughout the day to make sure I felt comfortable. Looking back, I'm convinced they must be totally superhuman to have managed the experience so smoothly!

The magic of Wasing is that the moment I stepped away, I immediately missed it â€“ and part of that was the energy and experience that our hosts created. The scenery itself is stunning, deeply memorable and totally tranquil. I will always remember my 30th being full of joy (and forcing my loved ones to love wild swimming!)

Thanks to the whole team for everything they did â€“ I hope to be back for another birthday soon for more Wasing magic!
showerReviews.author: Carrie Watson

showerReviews.reviewText: JD Gyms in Reading. First trip on opening day. This is a great gym no denying it. Superb equipment. Open and spacious gym across 2 floors. Changing rooms are upstairs left for women right for men. Scan the QR code on the plaque by the turnstiles as you come in for fast WIFI - seamless add and login. Youâ€™ll need a padlock you canâ€™t have bags on the floor - buy one in the vending machine for okay price. Changing rooms really good. Sauna a bit odd, you all kind of sit in a glass box and stare out at everyone â€¦ no they are not mixed there is one in each changing room. Staff seem cool. It smells so new. Downstairs is Hammer Strength machine heaven. Upstairs is cardio and Matrix kit - the newer stuff. Itâ€™s well lit inside considering no windows or natural light source. Music is okay from considerable speaker system. Parking - good luck with that! And when leaving the tricky road layout is a white knuckle logic test for sure. Thanks to JD team member Marlena who was very helpful and answered a few questions while showing me round the gym on the first day!Recommended.
showerReviews.author: Rory Cantellow

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve been training at JD Gyms Basingstoke for a while now and absolutely love it. The space is huge with lots and lots of machinesâ€”whether youâ€™re into cardio, free weights, plate-loaded strength or functional training, youâ€™ll find everything you could want. According to their kit list they have 250+ machines, a large free weights & cardio area, an Eleiko functional rig, sled track, dedicated glute zone, etc.  ï¿¼

The staff are super supportive and friendly. From checking you in to helping you with equipment or just offering tips, they make the gym feel welcoming rather than intimidating.

Iâ€™m also a big fan of the sauna and luxury changing roomsâ€”theyâ€™re a real bonus after a tough session.

The only thing to note is that it can get quite busy on Monday and Tuesday evenings (and evenings in general). If you prefer a quieter session you might want to go a bit earlier or later.

Overall, for the quality of the facility, the variety of equipment, the free parking and 24/7 access, this gym is a fantastic choice in Basingstoke. Highly recommend!

locations.title: Crowne Plaza Reading by IHG
locations.address: îƒˆWharfedale Rd, Winnersh, Triangle, Reading RG41 5TS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived the staff have been very kind, helpful and professional. The food has been amazing. It was great that we could mix and match the British menu and Indian menu for our 3 course dinner. They even switched the set dessert for 3 scoops of ice cream, when my partner wasnâ€™t too keen on the choices.
The spa is also incredible. Iâ€™m not the biggest fan of massages, but I had a treatment come with the stay, so I picked the facial and back/shoulders/neck and head massage. My therapist, Elaine, was gentle and very soothing. I had a lovely time and it has definitely changed my mind on massages. Both parts were very relaxing and would highly recommend to everyone.
The room is very clean and comfortable. Lovely big window, with good blackout curtains. Has a lot of sockets, for a variety of cables, I would assume for those staying for business. Also has access to a good variety of TV channels.
Lovely aircon and a spacious bath with shower is a plus!
Very accommodating and professional hotel, definitely recommend.

locations.title: YHA Streatley-on-Thames
locations.address: îƒˆReading Rd, Streatley, Reading RG8 9JJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Perfect YHA to stay in - especially if you're a Ridgeway walker.

Stayed here for one night in May. It wasn't very busy. The room was clean and spacious, and not expensive. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful, showing me where everything was. There's a well-maintained kitchen here that I used to cook an evening meal, and multiple showers/bathrooms on all floors.

They also offer breakfast. As I was the only one there that early, the gentleman working was very attentive, and made me my own cafetiere of coffee. Plenty of breakfast to go around too - and again, not expensive.

The perfect spot to stay.
showerReviews.author: Jack Andrew Cribb

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely friendly hostel in a great location, very clean, comfy beds, plenty of showers and toilets and a large well equipped kitchen. We will definitely stay again!
showerReviews.author: clairenW7189IC

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely friendly hostel in a great location, very clean, comfy beds, plenty of showers and toilets and a large well equipped kitchen. We will definitely stay again!
showerReviews.author: clairenW7189IC

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a bad location. About a mile or so from the train station but in a straight line through the village. The location was quiet.

The hostel was quite quiet, not many people were booked in when I stayed but that could have been for a number of reasons, I hear a rowing club was booked in the weekend before.

Staff were friendly and professional.

My room was not ensuite. There was shared toilet and showers nearby although I understand some rooms do have their own showers. There are enough communal showers for when it is full.

One good thing for me is that you did not need to go too far from your room to the kitchen, so after a long walk when you have taken your coat and shoes off you just need to pop down one flight to the kitchen. I've stayed in hostels where my room has been on the other side of the building to the kitchen.

There is a self catering kitchen and also the option to have a cooked breakfast. I wasn't staying long so brought my own breakfast and ate at the pub next door or went to the Fish and Chip shop in Goring.

As the hostel was pretty quiet I was a bit apprehensive about staying there but I was assured that the managers were close by and I was told there is a number to call in an emergency, I felt a bit better after that.

It is in need of refurbishment and an update of furniture etc.

My only gripe was that it does need a good clean and dusting. There was a lot of dust on the skirting and windowsills. There was dust on the rungs of the bunk bed and it really bothered my allergies. I was only booked in for two nights but if I was there longer I would have bought some wipes to give my room an extra clean so that I wasn't affected too much. I understand some places gather dust more than others so this is not a bad comment against the managers who were extremely friendly and helpful.

I definitely would consider this hostel again if considering staying in the area again.
showerReviews.author: MsShelleyWilliams1

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at this hotel and these were my thoughts.

Positives:
- Very good heating system, the heating comes on quickly once you adjust it and it stays on for a long time

- Hotel rooms are spacious

- The hotel receptionists are friendly and pay considerate attention to you

- It's located very close to the high street so shops are not hard to get to

Negatives:

- Bathroom is unclean and looks outdated as does the hotel itself

- There were towels that had stains on them when I arrived before I used any myself

- The hotel was noisy a lot of the time with people watching television at loud volumes late in the night or people talking loudly in the corridors. Also the hotel room doors would creak whenever they are opened which was loud enough to wake me up from sleep

- On day of checking out cleaners will knock on your door at 12 PM sharp to remind you that you need to leave as if you didn't know already and as mentioned earlier it's not as if they do a good job with cleanliness anyway so it makes you wonder what they even do to require that level of pushiness.

- The walls in the hotel rooms are thin so it's easy to hear whatever is going on in the rooms next to you

- The pillows were quite hard and the bed wasn't too comfortable

So in summary you would be better off looking for an alternative option in Reading.
showerReviews.author: MUFC Legend

showerReviews.reviewText:
Worst Travelodge Iâ€™ve stayed in, and doesnâ€™t do the brand justice. We checked out before sleeping the night as we didnâ€™t feel at all safe and the room felt unclean. It seemed that many of the guests were junkies and the surrounding area is pretty sketchy too. The room was not clean, with stains on the mattress, bathroom counter and shower. It smelt of the restaurant below. The room was noisy as the outer windows (rooms are fitted with secondary glazing) were broken and wouldnâ€™t even vaguely shut, so the noise of the ring road penetrated the inner windows.

All in, the cheap rate is telling - thereâ€™s a reason itâ€™s so cheap despite its central location! Basically it seems to be a probation hostel that is long overdue a complete refit and rebrand. Come on Travelodge, you can do better than this!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Worst Travelodge Iâ€™ve stayed in, and doesnâ€™t do the brand justice. We checked out before sleeping the night as we didnâ€™t feel at all safe and the room felt unclean. It seemed that many of the guests were junkies and the surrounding area is pretty sketchy too. The room was not clean, with stains on the mattress, bathroom counter and shower. It smelt of the restaurant below. The room was noisy as the outer windows (rooms are fitted with secondary glazing) were broken and wouldnâ€™t even vaguely shut, so the noise of the ring road penetrated the inner windows.

All in, the cheap rate is telling - thereâ€™s a reason itâ€™s so cheap despite its central location! Basically it seems to be a probation hostel that is long overdue a complete refit and rebrand. Come on Travelodge, you can do better than this!
showerReviews.author: A B

locations.title: Reading Serviced Rooms
locations.address: îƒˆ164-166 Caversham Rd, Reading RG1 8AZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a lovely stay in a really roomy and comfy room.  The hotel had recently been renovated and upgraded top-to-bottom, so it was super-smart.  There was fast WiFi, an excellent smart TV, and even a high quality coffee-maker with coffee capsules provided too!

The beds and bed linen felt high quality, and the bathroom had a pumped shower with immediate hot water for a lovely, strong shower.

Checking in and gaining entry was interesting - there was no actual key or key card, we were given a personal access code for the rear and front doors and for our room.  Easy to use and v hi-tech, checking in was simply a case of entering our code and walking in.

We also reserved a space in the private car park to the rear - the access road was a little tight at the beginning, but we got through OK and the car park was easy to access (also with a code).

Our room was at the front and were a bit concerned about comments in earlier reviews re. road noise.  The road is certainly busy, but during the recent renovations they replaced the windows with acoustic glass and it seems to have made a big difference and we had no problem relaxing and sleeping.

Location-wise, it was a short walk to the town centre.  The riverside and park are even closer and made for a lovely stroll in the sun (we were lucky with the weather!).

Our room also had it's own fridge and microwave, but the hotel was surrounded by food and drink opportunities and we enjoyed drinks at The Moderation (nice atmosphere), dinner at the Standard Tandoori (great food and v friendly staff), and a delicious breakfast at the Richfields Deli.

Overall, a very nice stay in Reading.
showerReviews.author: Mark Davies

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife has already offered a review, but I just wanted to echo the experience. The secure car parking was excellent, check if you drive something really big, but the ad doesnâ€™t mention there were a couple of free spaces available on the road as well when we were there. I took the photo below because I had decided to add a review at breakfast the next day and hoped it might help someone. I would book parking again next time, but if they were full, Iâ€™d check the roadside before going to the station which is really close anyway. Lovely newly renovated place, good shower pressure on first floor is always important to me, good food nearby and an unexpected lovely walk down the river. All round, if you want Reading, hard to think of a more pleasant and better value option that has moved me to do a review - something I rarely do. These people have made an effortðŸ‘

locations.title: Travelodge Reading Whitley
locations.address: îƒˆ387 Basingstoke Rd, Reading RG2 0JE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spent a couple of weeks here
The rooms were large and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was was also large with plenty of hot water for the shower. The shower power was not the strongest but it was suitable. Noise? From people staying at the hotel it was very quiet, but the carpark is shared with the World Turned Upside Down pub and sometimes there was a bit of noise, but as it closed at 22.00 it was not a problem.
They do a breakfast box that consisted of a bowl of cornflakes, milk, bottle of water, flapjack and a pastry for 6.95 and I did a job in the morning
All of the staff are great here and very helpful

Easy walk to Henley and we had lovely dog walks, a great roast in the Bull and even got to sit outside at the Angel and enjoy the views. Only had a drink at the onsite cafe one evening. Food looked great so we will have to try that next time!

showerReviews.reviewText: Hurley Riverside Park has become one of our regular weekend sites because it is consistently good! The pitches are large and well spaced. Toilet and shower facilities are good. Warm and have good pressure providing you avoid the absolute peak times. The staff are always very friendly and the on site shop has essentials. The proximity to the Thames is also great for exercising and cooling off dogs and great for walking with pubs in either direction along the Thames path. Highly recommend this site!

showerReviews.reviewText: This is our 4 visit as we love how this site is taking care of. The location is brilliant for water sports and walking in the river. The pitches are are divided up in to smaller holdings making it a great space for everyone. The shower and toilet blocks are brilliant and so clean. There's a dog cleaning station and brilliant facilities to clean all your pots and pans. The staff are great and the shop is well stocked. A great open space to play games and has football goals, there's a park and nature trail on site a map is available for free. No music is to be played late evening so it's great for everyone for a good night's sleep. Overall a 5* stay

showerReviews.reviewText: This is our 4 visit as we love how this site is taking care of. The location is brilliant for water sports and walking in the river. The pitches are are divided up in to smaller holdings making it a great space for everyone. The shower and toilet blocks are brilliant and so clean. There's a dog cleaning station and brilliant facilities to clean all your pots and pans. The staff are great and the shop is well stocked. A great open space to play games and has football goals, there's a park and nature trail on site a map is available for free. No music is to be played late evening so it's great for everyone for a good night's sleep. Overall a 5* stay
showerReviews.author: Marie Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Positive: The park has everything you need. The price is reasonable. But that's about it. We were stuck in traffic on the M25 and called to ask if there was anything available. Check-in is until 7:30 p.m. (the office says 8:00 p.m.), and we said that we didn't know if we would make it because of the traffic. Any other campsite: No problem, book online and we'll send you a code. Or park somewhere and pay tomorrow. This one: Tough luck. We made it, and at the entrance there's a sign: Stop here, stay in your car, don't go to reception, someone will come. We stood there for a long time, but finally went to reception. There we were told that we should have driven one meter further so that the camera could see us! (The waiting area is right in front of the reception window...) The pitch was small.
The showers are reasonably sized, but there is no bench. They look modern, but they are a complete failure. Instead of a push button, there is a motion sensor. The idea is that when you stand under it, the shower runs â€“ which is actually good. But here you have to wave your hand directly in front of it, which makes it just as bad as a push button. Worse still, you can't stay in front of it because if you move again, the shower turns off. So you have to wait every time for it to turn off before you can restart itâ€”every few seconds, including temperature fluctuations. Great for washing your hair. I wonder if the people who came up with this idea have ever taken a shower in their lives! Overall, not a pleasant place.
showerReviews.author: Martin W

locations.title: Henley Four Oaks Caravan and Motorhome Club Campsite
locations.address: îƒˆMarlow Rd, Henley-on-Thames RG9 2HY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We decided to book a last-minute getaway between Christmas and New Year for a bit of relaxation. Â Unfortunately, the check-in process was neither welcoming nor smooth and took over 30 minutes. The receptionist wasn't too happy we drove straight in as the barrier was up ?
When I showed the lady my email confirmation, she asked for my membership card or proof on the app. I explained that we had just bought the motorhome and hadn't transferred everything from our old van yet. She advised me to download the app and log in to access the internet. By that time, I was flustered and had trouble remembering passwords. She insisted on seeing proof of identity, stating that failing to ask these questions would be discriminatory towards other site users. After turning our motorhome upside down, I found an old card, which proved to be useless and gave her the same info as the email ?

I preferred to pay in cash, as it was a Christmas gift, but was told that ID was required for cash payments. This was never mentioned in the paperwork and I had never been asked for ID before? The receptionist saw I wasn't happy and tried to change her tone by offering me a dry mince pie and flat Buck's Fizz. By then, I really needed a brandy and just wanted to get out of there.
I refused to return to the office, so my husband went in to ask if we could move. Despite there being six empty blue-pegged pitches, she made a fuss but agreed .

On a positive note, the site itself was pleasant , with clean and serviceable showers and toilets. However, cleaning at peak times between 10:30 AM and 12:00 PM was inconvenient. Although you can hear the busy road, the 20-minute walk into town makes it worthwhile, being so close to Henley. We will return and have everything to hand now we know . CAMC can you update your rules to prevent other members starting off their break miserably .

Sent from Outlook for iOS
showerReviews.author: SARAH FINN

showerReviews.reviewText: 1pm check in,  toilet block closed from 10.30-12 , why? .  Is it for the convenience of the customer clearly not, surely an earlier check in and later block clean benefits everyone , average/low quality showers small.  Its bang on a busy road obviously it's close to Henley so that helps.  Lots of the usual caravanning club posters don't do this don't do that.  A chap coming round to complain I hadn't made them aware of the pitch number id been there 20 minutes I was setting up , if it was that important he could have told reception himself .  Jobsworths which is a common theme in these sites.  In. Summary not a great site .

showerReviews.reviewText:
We loved this site! It was quiet, peaceful and with lots of space - just how we like it. We were on the Park Field with no electricity, which suited us as we have a solar panel for our campervan. We had all we needed - water, clean toilets and showers, with hot water for the showers and washing up sinks provided by gas cylinders. We were also provided (free) with logs for our fire pit.
Our lovely host went out of her way to help find my watch, which I had lost on a short walk to the nearby pub, tracking it down via Facebook and collecting it for me from the person who had found it! I'm eternally grateful to her!
Location was perfect - near to family in Taplow for a family celebration and near very pretty, quaint villages including Turville, used as the location for the Vicar of Dibley. We'd love to return one day!
showerReviews.author: Frankie Birchwood

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good baby classes for swimming and good soft play for a reasonable price. The baby pool is a good temperature. Good sized car park however not many baby and parent spaces (not that much of a big deal though). Most areas are generally clean and kept well presented.

The baby change is unsuitable, as there arenâ€™t enough for the babies that are in the classes or that clash with the next class. Several times Iâ€™ve had to bring a baby mat and change my baby on the floor as mothers take some time to change their babies and I didnâ€™t want mine to continue to be cold and wet. There are no areas to put baby other than the floor as the benches are too shallow, if the baby changes are busy - then I couldnâ€™t change myself as there wasnâ€™t space to even bring the baby into the changing room I could use. I stoped going to the swimming classes because of this - it was doable in summer but in winter baby would be way too cold.  Lots of the lockers are broken which made it hard also when youâ€™re carrying a baby and all your belongings (then opening lots to find one that works).

Cafe is wildly overpriced - a banana for Â£1, a bottle of drink for Â£3. The sausage bap was terrible - wet and stale roll, no serviettes available. The drinks machine was warm as it was not even turned on - not too big a deal generally by the one male member of staff that we saw did not even pretend to acknowledge or care about the drinks machine, or lack of high chairs. (Just a job a guess). For a place that caters for children with classes and soft play, they had only two high chairs in the building.
showerReviews.author: Jade Harding

Â£20 Speedo costume now been thrown away.

locations.title: BH Live Active, Pyramids
locations.address: îƒˆClarence Esplanade, Southsea, Portsmouth, Southsea PO5 3ST, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Kids enjoyed themselves with the waves and the slides, but...
One of the pools, the lowest, wasn't open for some reason, although the snake slide next to it was. Other parts of the place looked run down, with worrying looking rust patches quite noticeable. Some of the water sprays weren't working either.
Yet the worst part of the visit was the staff turning us out of the water and making us stand by the waters edge for five minutes or so. Eventually one of them started making an announcement that was near inaudible  - apparently there was no chlorine in the pool! Therefore everybody trapsed off to the changing rooms to get dressed; not enough room for the 100 or so to get to the showers, the lockers, etc. People appeared to take up residency in the family rooms so my young daughter and I stood for what felt like forever, waiting in a cold, breezy corridor. We are in a state of undress and the place is freezing!
Not the best visit.
showerReviews.author: David Garvey

locations.title: Ravelin Sports Centre
locations.address: îƒˆCambridge Rd, Portsmouth PO1 2SE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: An impressive, modern sports centre. We went for a lane swim as the centre is open to the public. Had to register in order to book online, but not too much of a problem. Paid parking underneath the building (pay on exit - use the machine as no mobile coverage down there). The basement houses a climbing wall and ski simulator. Ground floor has the gym, which looked to be very popular, a huge reception area with a Starbucks, and the 25m pool. Had to book in at reception to get a slip of paper to scan in to the pool changing facilities (remember to save it as you'll need it to scan out too). Changing facilities were clean with free lockers and warm showers. Pool is wide and has moveable floor - half being given over to aqua aerobics when we were there. The lanes are a uniform 2m depth, so no lounging around at the shallow end. Pool was clean and lifeguards were attentive. Would definitely visit again.
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: Took my son to his first swimming lesson on 25th Feb, receptionist was very efficient and friendly and facilities were very new and clean. The swimming teacher was also very friendly and my son warmed to her immediately which is saying something for him! Overall it was a very positive experience of a very lovely leisure centre.
showerReviews.author: Jessica Oâ€™Rourke

showerReviews.reviewText: Took my son to his first swimming lesson on 25th Feb, receptionist was very efficient and friendly and facilities were very new and clean. The swimming teacher was also very friendly and my son warmed to her immediately which is saying something for him! Overall it was a very positive experience of a very lovely leisure centre.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined at the beginning of the month and was quite taken with the whole set up of the centre - it's great because it's on my way back home from work too.

I've had sterling support at my time at the gym and took up personal training sessions which are really enjoyable. I found that I have received support from other personal trainers which is a really nice bonus. I can't fault this at all.

I am a great lover of swimming. I really like this pool as it's dimmed and I appreciate that after hours in harshly lit office light. The times that I've been able to go swimming I have thoroughly enjoyed my time there.
However (and this is a big however for me) I have come in twice this week to find that the main pool has no lanes so I'm not able to swim.
The lane swimming and adults only are at obscure times where I don't have the time to access so I can only go on the weekends - for adults only which is preferable that means coming in rather early or late. Both are not ideal for a weekend to rest.

My other gripe with the centre is that the women's changing rooms always seem to be filled with screaming children. I have nearly tripped over a couple of them running about and one child pushed the door shut so I couldn't access the changing rooms until the mum came to leave. I wouldn't mind children being in there if they behaved but a majority of time they aren't. A family changing area would be a good solution.

Overall; I'm glad I joined - particularly for the gym. But the centre is child-centric and not very accommodating towards child-free adults.
showerReviews.author: Anna Thomas

locations.title: Village Gym Portsmouth
locations.address: îƒˆLakeshore Dr, Cosham, Portsmouth PO6 3FR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Finn is what every gym needs more of. Here are the qualities that make Finn stand out:

Always approachable and enthusiastic. Whether itâ€™s early morning or a busy evening, Finn has a smile and makes you feel welcome.

Knows the equipment well. Not just the basics, but tips on form, alternatives, spotting when machines are mis-used, and offering helpful suggestions without being pushy.

Great with spotting/training help. If you ask Finn to check your form or spot you while lifting, you actually feel safer and more confident than with many other staff.

Proactive in ensuring cleanliness & order. Finn seems to notice when equipment needs attention, or when areas (such as around the pool or changing rooms) could use better upkeep, and either fixes it or reports it.

Friendly without being overbearing. Knowing when to chat, when to give space, when someone looks like they could use encouragement.

Finn definitely makes a difference. Often, experiences that might be â€œmehâ€ are pulled up by staff like Finn being attentive â€” it adds that human touch that really matters.
showerReviews.author: Abdul Hamim

showerReviews.reviewText:
I signed up today, I used to attend Mount batten gym which I didn't like and didn't feel welcome. I have a lot of health issues and it took courage to go back to another gym but after my first visit to nuffield I'm so pleased I made the decision to sign up as a member.

The receptionist staff are really welcoming and friendly, Jason in the gym is extremely helpfull, the swimming pool is lovely and warm, the sauna is ladies only which is nice.

Nuffield even have an on site bar and you can get food, they even do social events which is great if your looking to make new friends.

The atmosphere of Nuffield is so relaxed and friendly which really helped my anxiety.

I would highly recommend Nuffield health. â¤ï¸

showerReviews.reviewText: This facility in the hotel in open until 10pm. We can't fault this pool, when we went we were the only people in there so had the whole place to ourselves. The pool is shallow enough to touch the floor at both ends so much safer for children & nonswimmers like myself. The hottub was lovely too, only downside is the staff have to turn it on from behind their desk so you may have to wait until they see you in there or go find someone. The Sauna & Steamroom also really great. At the time we visited, the showers in the changing rooms had no hot water buy we simply showered on our rooms before & after instead, complimentary towels are always offered to hotel guests, simply ask at reception.
showerReviews.author: Vikkiee Bennett

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a good gym with equipment. It is also a dirty gym. Both my partner and I agree the male and female toilets leave a lot to be desired. Given that there are no sanitising towels, there is an element of gross that is combined with working out here (weâ€™ve had our membership a year).  They say they donâ€™t offer sanitisation wipes for sustainability (pure gym does wipe stations) but there are eco alternatives such as spray bottle stations with biodegradable towels, and biodegradable wipes. We bring our own towels of course but honestly the cleaners canâ€™t clean the equipment after every person. And, with how busy the gym is, the majority of people arenâ€™t wiping up after themselves. The cleaning seems like a cursory wipe and a push of the broom. The cleaners do make the rounds as we do see them. Butâ€¦ not often enough. Deep cleaning isnâ€™t looking like itâ€™s happening to the level it should at a gym where people sweat, bathe etc. Toilet cisterns have rings of dirt, sitting water on sinks, hairs all over the floor, greasy finger prints and body sweat marks, and broken locker locks. This busy gym is worn down and hygiene updates are desperately needed. The cost cutting is palpable. Please , at the very least, give us wipe stations! Especially in this post pandemic environment. Itâ€™s gross.
showerReviews.author: Veronica Lemonn

showerReviews.reviewText: This is very good location for a 24 hour gym. I've been a member of PureGym since 2013 and have used several locations. There is plenty of parking if you drive but be aware of time restrictions. The gym has a great selection of free weights and machines a big cross fit area and mats for stretching. The gym is clean but the showers were absolutely disgusting. I'm not sure why you guys leave your skiddy pants in the showers but grow up, mummy isn't cleaning up after you here. However with only one shower out of 5 working, the one that was was full of pubic hair and utterly vile. I told the manager who having plenty of time to restock profitable vending machines told me "we try our best". Well then Pure management is letting you down. Disgusting changing rooms, but decent gym. Advice - Shower at home, don't bother complaining either.
showerReviews.author: Leigh

showerReviews.reviewText: I went for a swim here a week ago on Saturday morning, it was glorious & I loved my swim. The pool was surprisingly warm, I thought as it was an old building the water would be chilly but not at all. My only regret was that after living all my life in Portsmouth, I'm now 63, I only wished I had used this venue before. It is delightful and all that anyone could possibly wish for. Lovely pool, good showers in changing room and easy free parking!!! Well done Pompey, got something worth having here. Thank you :-)

locations.title: Southsea Splash Pool
locations.address: îƒˆSouthsea, Portsmouth, Southsea PO5 3NS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic splash pool for all ages 0+
The pool boasts the benefits of newly added accessable/wheelchair access benches and 6 new shade canopies.
The filter room/box has also been fenced off.
It's an absolute highlight of living in the city with children, the pools are both clean and maintained impeccably.
When we attended there was a small tear in the rubber and the parks team were out IMMEDIATELY and within 5 minutes of it being reported ! It was entirely actioned and the fix initiated immediately, 2 full drying and fixing days later the public were back and the pool was as new.
There are some RARE intermittent days where the fountains aren't on consistently, however from what I understand they are on a timer, and technology is a  wonderful Invention when it works!
There are toilets in the tennis club cafe directly nextdoor, also in the public toilets a stone's throw away by the day carpark. The tennis club cafe is very highly recommended and reviewed also!
There's a nut-free ice cream van parked opposite (yes, it's their spot! So great for allergies) also deep blue chip shop.
There are plenty of places to sit across benches, grassy areas and sheltered benches across the far wall.
There is a small trampoline in the far right and also a lovley little "play house' type feature. An abundance of marine themed creatures decorate the rubber flooring, along with some 3d bubbles that are great to jump and climb on and use in role play. There a 'wobbily bridge' on the right along with more 3d bubbles.

I would mention that the cons are
There are metal water covers in the grassy area by the pump/filter/maintenance room that become EXTREMELY hot, this has been reported and I await an outcome.
The metal of the "wobbly bridge" is a daft idea considering the rest of the stepping  areas are wooden and the metal is, obviously slippy when wet.
In 2022 the pool rubber flooring, had not been pressure washed enough during the heatwave and an smelly slippery alge had built up, causing a lot of children to fall and become injured, the pool was closed and cleaned but this occoured twice more after the initial event, I hope that they have learned from the mistakes for following years/heatwaves
showerReviews.author: Georgia Rae

showerReviews.reviewText:
I use this gym only becouse I have 25% discount and close to my house ,mornings are nice and quiet this case convenient for me . Otherwise I wouldn't be a member.The reasons :
layout :not so good but you can get use to it .
Equipment: Not well positioned some of them doesn't work ,not 100% safe ,in bad shape or just simply nobody looks after them I guess .(Start lubricate the cables pls !)
Hygiene: Changing room stinks the water fountain out of order but even when it was I almost through up from the water. Was not clean at allðŸ¤¢(Bring your own drink guys ).Fans are dusty so you breathe in the dust constantly (in summer ).in my first 3 month I have looked at the same lost gym gloves on the floor (How often you sweep guys ?)ðŸ¤”
Music :You guys have bad music and speakers from the 90' . Way too loud and sound is distorted that's why everyone uses headphones. Especially if you go with friend it is really annoying not to hear each other etc.
Staff everyone nice but keep rotating .I only find couple of people really know things but they are amazing .
Health and safety: uncovered electric cables . wobbly benches (when you ballance heavy weights you need support not an extra thing you have to balance out.)fire alarm test at 12 o clock does not make sense to me .would be more comforting if it can be done before opening.No cameras no routine checks at least not when I'm in . Anything can happen to anyone and nobody would realize it for long time.
Temperature : Air-condition only in one of the rooms .The rest of the rooms- Summer time : dusty fans in and windows open which already confusing and unnecessary.Winter: all windows are  open and the temperature go way lower than should be . P.s This place could be really lovely with some extra organisation and attention ðŸ˜Š

locations.title: Hotwalls Beach
locations.address: îƒˆOld Portsmouth, Portsmouth PO1 2JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Hot walls and a hot beach set in a sun trap, even on a cold Winter's day. At low tides there is space for a large crowd to welcome warships home and at high tide the top of the walls provide a wonderful viewpoint to wave to returning sailors. But beware jumping off the round Tower or swimming off the beach is not wise as the sea is shallow close inshore and there is strong currents through the harbour mouth. And when big ships go past their wake makes larger waves than you might anticipate which has wet many a picnic! Toilets and parking are just the other side of the walls. The beach can be accessed bay a variety of doorways or stairs and slopes. So yes it is wheelchair accessible but not on the shingle of the beach. Children need to be kept an eye on in rough weather, just in case.
showerReviews.author: Nigel Huxtable

showerReviews.reviewText:
â­â­â­â­â­

Gym01 Portsmouth is absolutely fantastic!
From the moment you walk in, you feel welcomed and part of a community. The staff are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to help and support you in achieving your fitness goals. The variety of classes offered is impressive, and I personally love the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) and kickboxing classes. The coaches are exceptional, providing expert guidance and motivation.

What makes Gym01 even more special is that it's a great place for families. My two kids also attend Gym01, participating in the BJJ and kids' kickboxing classes. They always have a blast and are learning so much. The specialized sessions for juniors create a comfortable and inclusive environment for all ages.

The facilities are top-notch, with spacious matted floors, well-maintained equipment, and clean locker rooms and showers. The community here is supportive and encouraging, making every workout session enjoyable and rewarding. I can't recommend Gym01 enough â€“ it's the best gym in Portsmouth for both adults and kids!

How can business in this day and age , not provide access ?? I'm a lower leg amputee that's often wheelchair bound . If not for me . Please consider everyone equally .
showerReviews.author: Paul Kelly

A well thought out day from start to finish. Loved it!!!!

Save your money, youâ€™re better off staying in travelodge.

showerReviews.reviewText: This place is littered with silverfish; it has been a constant issue this year. The staff are often rude and unhelpful. My key stopped working one afternoon and I asked reception for help and they said in a rather rude and abrupt way to log it with maintenance and wait. I found this odd because usually maintenance requests take 3-5 days to fix and the receptionist didnâ€™t explain that this would be sorted quicker. I still waited 45 minutes to get into my room and this made me late to a lecture. Whenever there are issues with the washing machines the attitude of the staff is that it has nothing to do with them and they canâ€™t help, again in an abrupt way. When the power went out in our flat the receptionist said she couldnâ€™t help and weâ€™d have to move our food into the staff freezer, we later learned it was just a trip switch that the receptionist couldâ€™ve switched, a member of security came to fix it for us and told us â€œthe receptionist was just being lazyâ€. When one of my flatmates was constantly smoking in the flat it wasnâ€™t dealt with appropriately. Two security staff are incredibly rude and did not deal with an issue in our flat appropriately or professionally at all. They stood in our hallway shouting at us and talking over us any time we tried to explain something or ask a question. There was no need for their behaviour when we were trying to have a calm and reasonable conversation with them. Overall, I have had a really unpleasant experience at Catherine House and I cannot recommend it to anyone looking to stay here
showerReviews.author: Megan Lawes

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in their Portsmouth property for one night. Brand new building right next to Portsmouth and South sea station. I had 3rd floor room and stayed on a Saturday night but sound insulation was very poor and you could hear traffic and crowd coming out of centre of Portsmouth until about 4am. Rooms are good and comfortable with own shower. Communal kitchen only has a kettle and a mug and also has TV room.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in their Portsmouth property for one night. Brand new building right next to Portsmouth and South sea station. showerReviews.reviewText: Unfortunately my experience in Catherine House did not start well from day 1. As soon as I arrived in my flat I had to deal with a cold shower, a broken chair and a dusty room. The shower was fixed after two weeks, during which I managed by using a cup to pour hot water from the tap for my showers. The chair was replaced 2 months after. Rooms accumulate dust very quickly so you have to clean every once in a while. Some other problems are the noises, like the ones that come from a valve in the toilet. Doors have closers that make them close with force and some people just bang their doors. Also walls are made out of plasterboard so you can hear pretty much everything. You can hear your flat mates that just don't have the consciousness that they are in shared apartments or what time it is. Many were the nights that woke me up. Another major problem with the noise is the fire alarm. Before Christmas holidays it would go off every week and it's loud as hell. They have literally cameras in all common spaces except the hallway which is the most obvious place to place a camera so you can identify who is banging on your door and disrespecting the other flat mates. Lastly, it's very overpriced which means that you don't get what you pay for. I can't believe I paid 10K to live under these conditions. All these problems are pretty much common in all student halls so if you want to have a peaceful and healthy student life try to avoid them.
showerReviews.author: George N.

locations.title: Travelodge Portsmouth City Centre
locations.address: îƒˆStanhope Rd, Portsmouth PO1 1FB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked a Super Room for a family trip (me, the wife and two kids aged 6 and 11) and have to say there was absolutely nothing Super about it at all. Actually, I could make it work. The room itself was Super small - putting 2 additional beds was laughable as the room was barely large enough for the one double. The facilities were Super basic. Apparently, according to the front desk staff, the additional features of this room included a hair dryer - yes, really, apparently hair dryers are an upgrade - an iron and ironing board - we couldn't comment on this as they were in the wardrobe that we couldn't access as there was a bed in the way (did I mention the room was Super small?) - a coffee machine which didn't stop - Super annoying - and a comfy arm chair, which may have been Super comfy but we couldn't use it because there were beds in the way!
All in all a Super waste of money and Super dissappointing!
We were Super quick at identifying these issues and spoke to the Super staff and the front desk who was Super helpful but ultimately could do nothing as the hotel was Super busy! In fact all the staff were Super friendly!
So to summarise Super quickly, if you're thinking of booking a super room don't bother. If you have a family trip to Portsmouth - which is Super interesting - you may find more Super accomodation booking with a different well known, budget hotel. I won't say which, but I suggest your experience will be a Premier one!
showerReviews.author: Jonathan Gaskell

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually stay in no frills chains so know what to expect but this was well below par.
1. We arrived at 2:10pm but they had no luggage storage until our 3pm check-in, so we had to kill time outside with our cases. We came back at 2:55pm but could not check in until precisely 3pm, making a huge queue in reception for no good reason.
2. Breakfast was not until 8am - not ideal for people with an early start.
3. There was no hairdryer in my room and no phone to call down for one, so I had to go to the lobby at 7am with wet hair to ask for one.
4. The shampoo/soap dispenser in the shower did not work.
5. The shower curtain did not fit well, causing water to pool on the bathroom floor. The bathroom bin was rusty from previous guests having this problem.
6. No bag storage the next day meant we couldn't sightsee unless we paid for bag storage elsewhere.
Will choose the Premier Inn next door in future - they actually recommended them as a bag storage facility at Â£5/bag!
showerReviews.author: Lorna Nakashima

6. No bag storage the next day meant we couldn't sightsee unless we paid for bag storage elsewhere.
Will choose the Premier Inn next door in future - they actually recommended them as a bag storage facility at Â£5/bag!

showerReviews.reviewText: An amazing campsite run by amazing, kind, and extremely helpful people! We spent three nights in a tent, and the pitch was a good size, big enough for a big tent and two cars, offering just enough privacy. The grounds are very clean, and so are sanitary facilities with very nice showers (plenty of hot water and good pressure). Our 4 y o granddaughter loved the pool, too. Magnetic cards opening barriers are a very convenient solution. The atmosphere is that of a family picnic and we really enjoyed it. There's a big very well-stocked Lidl a short walk from the campsite and the beach is a 5-min drive away with plenty of parking spaces available. Our only recommendation would be to have the cafe open daily rather than 5 days a week. We will certainly return for a longer stay!
showerReviews.author: JD Pszyk

showerReviews.reviewText:
A real mixed bag here. My parents arrived before us and wanted to pay for our pitch but were not allowed to as we weren't there. Then they got talking to some neighbours who were pitching a tent on the pitch next to their van and they said it was for their daughter arriving later....so how come they were allowed and not us?

Then a member of staff came and told me dad he would have to pay Â£39 a night extra for a tiny bike tent that was by the van. So he took it down. Seriously there were BBQ setups that were bigger than this tent, how can they justify an extra Â£39 for a little tent clearly not big enough to be slept in when a full size awning attached to a caravan taking up half the pitch is only Â£5 a night?

A really sad experience that has meant after a good few years of my parents staying at Scott's farm they will no longer be visiting. Like others have said, if your face doesn't fit, they will have it in for you. It really put a downer on the weekend.

For the cost of the pitch, one would expect the toilet disposal area to be unblocked, and the toilets to be well stocked with toilet roll.

However, I will say it was very clean in the loos and showers most of the time, and the pitches are a really good size and it was quiet considering the enormity of the site!
showerReviews.author: Emma Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText: Called to say big group coming, 7 tents and a caravan, told no problem, call day before, we did, was told showers were not working, still wanted to give it a go as only 3 nights. Pitched up as told to when we called for gate code when we had arrived, owner turned up when we all set up to tell us it was Â£20 for tents, Â£30 for caravan, Â£5 for car and Â£20 for event shelter a night! This was not mentioned on any call to him and it was not on the facebook page, he has added the price of car now, have never been to a site that charges you for your car, extra cars yes. We were going to stay for a night and find somewhere else to move on to but too late for a big group, so we were stuck, he did knock a little off whole price, we decided to make best of it. Field was lovely and fire pits good idea, toilets had no proper lights, just solar lights that kept going off, 1 womans toilet, 2 mens and urinals which were clean but not kept topped up with toilet roll, nothing to dry hands on. A ram was in the field! Is that allowed!? No shelter, water was disgusting,  kids playing on field with his poop everywhere, and had to avoid it when putting tents up, he escaped under fence into road one morning and guy from our group followed it up road so it didn't get hurt, was gone nearly an hour before losing it, no thanks at all and was suggested gate was left open! You can see the wool stuck to the fence he went through! Owner was not welcoming and appeared to have a problem with us from the start when we questioned prices, told us you wouldn't get this price with what is there anywhere! Yes mate, you can  and we have! Had high hopes of a nice little site, but will not be going back.
showerReviews.author: nicola palmer

locations.title: Old Barn Touring Park
locations.address: îƒˆCheverton Farm, Newport Rd, Apse Heath, Sandown PO36 9PJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Although, on the plus, this site is well located. Is a very reasonable price and the (only ever saw one) staff member was very helpful. The pictures, I feel do not truly represent the site as it is now.
It's quite dated. Especially the toilets and shower ( they are clean).
The view is now obstructed as the hedgerows have been left to grow as with the general gardening and husbandry on the site.
Quite a bit of road noise and planes.
Lots of flies also on this site.
Although we were told there is seasonal pitches. They very much look like they are properly lived in as areas have been fenced or roped off. Grass and weeds are growing tall around the caravans and quite untidy. Resembles a travellers site in some parts.  These have been kept in the furthest parts of the site (but would make ideal pitches for genuine tourers)
Quite unkempt
No barrier at the entrance (a gate that remains open at all times.
And when busy could be a little cramped.
Believe new owners are in for next season so may well take on a new lease of life.
showerReviews.author: Andy corkill

showerReviews.reviewText: DO NOT GO! Went there with my children (10 and 14) and parents. Upon arrival the reception was shut, we had to phone for someone to come down. We then got placed to what can only be described as â€œshrekâ€™s swampâ€ yet pictures showed it being a pond. Toilets on the photos looked nice and clean. In reality they were dirty and run down and often out of toilet paper. My father even mentioned the was a piece of soap in the shower on the floor the whole 2 weeks we was there. We was constantly fighting the flys often having over 20 in the caravan at any one time! Including while eating our food. When asked for a refund as we found another campsite to take us at short notice we got refuse and told itâ€™s an island issue. It was not an island issue as they was not on the other site or the rest of the island it was the site issue! The park was run down and for children 10 and under. My son often has the owner throw him out of the park as he is a tall 10 year old. The last time he done it I was behind him to which he said â€œoh heâ€™s a big ladâ€ and walked off, no apology nothing! I would not recommend this site at all
showerReviews.author: Emma Meredith

locations.address: îƒˆ345 Main Rd, Southbourne, Emsworth PO10 8JH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited in early October. Friendly staff clean facilities, good showers. Fantastic location. Very close to a pub, a farm shop and a small coop. From this site we walked along the coast path to Langstone harbour , cycled to Fishbourne where we picked up the Salterns cycle path (mostly off road) to West wittering, and visited Bosham on the cycle back. Also close to Thorney Island which we walked around. We would return. Itâ€™s a great little site.
showerReviews.author: Sarah B

showerReviews.reviewText: A nice, clean and tidy site. Convenient for both Portsmouth and Chichester. Located on a fairly busy 30mph road you can hear the traffic, but TBH that really isn't an issue. All the usual and expected facilities (shower block etc. etc.), all of which were clean and in good working order. I didn't see a specific motorhome drainage point, although I did notice motorhomes filling with water from the water point. Dogs allowed on site, but I don't think they have a dog-walking area. I have no hesitation in returning next time.
showerReviews.author: Pete Jones

showerReviews.reviewText:
In my opinion, it's not suited to backpacking or bikepacking. The campsite has clean toilets and hot showers, but is dedicated to campervans. When I arrived, I was pitched next to a free camper van pitch (there are no designated pitches for tents). Late at night, while I was sleeping, I heard a motor very close to my tent and saw the lights of vehicles right on my tent. This woke me up instantly. Then the vehicle stopped right next to me and it took them 30 minutes to set up, making noise the whole time (plugging in electricity, walking around in the gravel, slamming doors, etc.). While the campsite is not responsible for the noise, they could have directed the camper van to another pitch â€” there were many other free ones.
Also, there are no sockets in the toilets or showers if you want to charge your phone.
In my opinion, the price is too high for the night spent.
To improve the camping experience, it would be good to have grass pitches for all tents rather than being placed between camper vans.
showerReviews.author: FranÃ§ois Dachelet

showerReviews.reviewText: Superb camping area. Very small but exceptionally clean and well looked after. The toilet and shower blocks are the best campsite facilities I've come across (though we live in Spain and most of our camping is in Spain or Portugal). Bear in mind they are closed from 10:30 to approx 12:00 for cleaning. There is a dog friendly pub just less than 5 mins walk from the site with super friendly staff. If you should get stuck in your van due to a torrential downpour (guess what happened to us ðŸ˜) then there is also a choice of Indian or Chinese restaurants that will deliver to the site. There is more around to look at but the weather wasn't good to us. Very near to Portsmouth if you need a pit stop and rest before you get a ferry across the water  ðŸ˜â›´ï¸

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely amazing campsite second to none. We stayed in Galahad, the helicopter unbelievable. I have nothing to say bad about the campsite only praying ryms, his professionalism and the campsite a must do in everyone's lifetime. A couple of suggestions. 1, maybe not having a toilet in the musical shower, so you can get changed easier. 2, swiping brush and pan in your accommodations, 3 in Galahad maybe increasing the head space to get into the master bedroom easier. To be fair you go above and beyond what you need to do, tea and milk in your accommodation and much more, fantastic idea. Thank you and all the team for a amazing weekend wish it was longee. See you again soon.

really great place for staying in Portsmouth. It's clean, cozy and offers everything you need such as a cooking hob and washing machine. The owner is incredibly friendly as well.

showerReviews.reviewText: We cannot praise Gordon enough for our stay between Christmas 2024 and New Year. Despite a storm moving in we were warm, cosy and comfortable in the caravan. Gordon kept in contact to arrange our welcome and the caravan was spotless on our arrival. My husband and son particularly enjoy the spacious shower as they both top 6'. Clean linen, kitchen well-stocked with utensils and crockery and comfortable beds. Useful welcome folder and local information from a lovely helpful host. Thank you Gordon, we can't wait to stay again. The submarine museum was closed so we have to come at least once more!
showerReviews.author: Anne

locations.title: Holiday Inn Portsmouth by IHG
locations.address: îƒˆPembroke Rd, Portsmouth PO1 2TA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: My family and I really enjoyed our stay. Excellent facilities including Swimming pool, Gym, Sauna and jacuzzi. parking available at Â£5 overnight, can get busy but permits are provided for road side parking if no parking space is available at the hotel's car park. We were booked in a premium room on the 5th floor with amazing views of Spinnaker Tower. The premium room had complimentary biscuits, drinking chocolate, tea, Pepsi, kit kats and bottled water. there was also a coffee machine and a mini fridge. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us some excellent recommendations for local excursions. This was our third stay at this hotel and will definitely stay here again when visiting Portsmouth.
showerReviews.author: Bob Karuku

showerReviews.reviewText: My family and I really enjoyed our stay. Excellent facilities including Swimming pool, Gym, Sauna and jacuzzi. parking available at Â£5 overnight, can get busy but permits are provided for road side parking if no parking space is available at the hotel's car park. We were booked in a premium room on the 5th floor with amazing views of Spinnaker Tower. The premium room had complimentary biscuits, drinking chocolate, tea, Pepsi, kit kats and bottled water. there was also a coffee machine and a mini fridge. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us some excellent recommendations for local excursions. This was our third stay at this hotel and will definitely stay here again when visiting Portsmouth.
showerReviews.author: Bob Karuku

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here when we went to the Victorious Festival during the August Bank Holiday weekend. Really easy access to the site from the hotel.
The rooms were a little on the small side - or perhaps just overly furnished? I think some space could've been created by having the TV on the wall & the huge table desk removed. Staff were lovely though. Breakfast was good (although we were directed to sit at an uncleared table one morning with the promise it would be cleaned...and it wasn't ðŸ˜•). Shower was good. Room was hot & air-con didn't seem to work. But heavy curtains and fan helped. Overall- good stay - if perhaps a tad pricey.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Popped to Portsmouth for family and a production, ended up with a sleep over, not to much not to little in atmosphere just right, not noisy, great welcoming staff, helpful and in a shar d twin with unexpected disability shower access, worth its weight in gold, clean, comfortable, tv, side lights, port holes, (lived the naval take  upon the hotel windows that unlatch) quite quaint. Beds a bit narrow but we never fell off, beds a bit close so don't sleep next to a avid night time sleep walk type puncher ( you could always tip and tail) large full length mirror. I desk and chair a wee coffee table and a wee bench, also available fan, hairdryer and spare pillow. Can request from receptionist more tea/coffee/sugar/milk.

Booked in advance well worth the cost with the breakfast added at time of booking (not keen on their sausages) pretty much self service.

Accidentally pressed help call alarm, sat to the back of bed found it behind pillow, staff member attended with polite knock and call out through the door, had no clue it was there. But so good to know they work and reaction time fabulous.
Lifts available.

Really enjoyed stating the night.

Post visit photos, all tidy and tucked away in arrival.
showerReviews.author: Sharron Blake

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room was extremely small â€” much smaller than expected â€” with almost no wardrobe or storage space, which made it uncomfortable for two people. The shower area was very compact and poorly isolated, so water leaked outside easily. The breakfast was quite limited, mainly heavy fried food, and items were often missing until refilled. The reception doesnâ€™t really feel like a hotel reception, more like a simple desk in a corner.

Housekeeping was inconsistent and once entered our room without knocking, which was very unpleasant. Overall, the hotel feels very basic and not worth the price, though itâ€™s convenient if you just need a quick overnight stay near the train station.

showerReviews.reviewText: Warner's holiday weekend, highlight being David Essex who was really good. Accomodations was lovely, smart decor, comfortable beds and shower room was excellent. As always the food was good but they do need to keep an eye on the food under the hot light as the lights dry out the food! My favourite were the omlettes as they were cooked for you at the food bar and they tasted excellent. All in all a very good long weekend experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked a caravan stay and paid extra for an upgrade that was supposed to include two toiletsâ€”a feature I confirmed multiple times before arrival. However, what I got was just a separate toilet and bath, not two toilets as promised. This was misleading and felt like a complete rip-off.
I also made it very clearâ€”both during booking and in follow-up callsâ€”that my son has a cat allergy, and since there were no non-pet caravans available, I requested a thorough cleaning. Despite this, the carpet was full of pet hair. Every time I swept, I collected clumps of hair, which made our stay extremely uncomfortable and stressful.
The arcade and swimming pool toilets were in terrible conditionâ€”smelly, wet floors, and clearly not maintained properly. While the staff were kind and tried to help, the facilities were far below expectations. The pool water was very cold too.
Overall, I feel cheatedâ€”I paid for an upgrade that didnâ€™t deliver, and my specific health-related requests were ignored. I would not recommend this place to anyone, especially families with allergies or those expecting clean and well-maintained amenities.
showerReviews.author: Shruti Shah

It was perfect for my 3 year old and 9 month old- my toddler loved the swimming, soft play, park, arcade and making slime activity. The staff were great and very friendly. Other holidaymakers were also very pleasant so they were clearly having a good time too! The caravan had everything we needed and was stylish and clean. We would definitely come here again!

showerReviews.reviewText:
So we arrived the evening of Halloween 31st October at 4pm. On arrival, we pulled up outside what we thought was our caravan and my husband got out the car to go and see which number it was and we were approached by a white maintenance vehicle. The person tooted as he couldnâ€™t get passed. A man with a long beard got out of this vehicle who I guess was staff and said to my husband in a rude manner, â€˜mate you canâ€™t park thereâ€™ he was literally just seeing what number the caravan was. How rude! We had a leak the first night through the vent in the roof, no big deal but this was a constant drip. We reported the next day to the young girl on the reception desk who didnâ€™t really seem to care and said she would get someone round. No one came! The swimming pool was freezing and I would say is not suitable for anyone under the age of 2. Her lips were blue!!
I have no complaints about the entertainment at all. The team were amazing and we saw the best tribute to BeyoncÃ© Iv ever seen!!
Canâ€™t comment on the restaurant because we didnâ€™t eat in there but the pub down the road is insane for a roast.
Would I go back? Yes I would but maybe in the summer so we can enjoy the outdoors a bit more.
showerReviews.author: Lucy Dewhurst

showerReviews.reviewText: Just had yet another really annoying swimming experience at Kingsmead - arrived for the only Lane Swim available in the middle of the day to find 1 lane closed for staff training ! No warningâ€¦.. so 20+ members having to use 2 lanes. This I have been told is a monthly â€œthingâ€; so this is on top of the fact that every school break/holiday we totally loose the middle of the day Lane Swim option for weeks on endâ€¦.. Am I really being unreasonable to float the idea that this is not fulfilling the companies side of our membership? Kingsmead: Please book staff training for the many periods when the pool is not open to fee paying members; And preserve at least 1 middle of the day Lane Swim option during all school holidays. The policy is geared to penalise members quick enough if for some reason we fail to attend a prebooked session, please have the courtesy to fulfil our membership agreementâ€¦.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined the centre as I wanted to get fitter and loose weight.
My favourite method of exercise is swimming, so disappointed to find out that there is not a only swimming membership.

Unfortunately ringing the centre was frustrating as no one answers the phone and no one responded to the voicemail I left.

The centre itself is very modern and recently refurbished.
The changing rooms are plentyful and light and spacious.

All the staff that I have seen on my two visits have been helpful and friendly.

Beware, if you wish to leave your belongings in a locker, you need to buy a wristband for Â£5.00, which is not mentioned anywhere on the website and was not mentioned when taking out membership

Parking is free for 2 hours, as long as you log your registration when you arrive.

Great opening hours, 7 days a week.
showerReviews.author: T Hurcombe

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member of King's Rec on and off for the last 7 years or so, as I like a quiet, clean environment to just get on with my exercise.

The standards now (end 2024) have dropped beyond recognition - as have the behaviours and attitudes of both staff and other members!

The swimming pool changing rooms are particularly disgusting and poorly maintained, and they appear to have taken on too many new members for the size of the facilities and booking slots. The receptionists are at best lackadaisical, but are often rude -- it feels out of habit rather than personal, but leaves a bad impression. If you're not a pretentious retiree or king's school mother attending for social / status reasons, give this one a miss... It's no longer enjoyable if you just want to exercise without being disturbed.
showerReviews.author: Marie-Claire M

Parking has been outsourced to a well known rogue parking company (look up Parking Eye online if you want to judge for yourself) and now we are having to deal with deranged aggressive staff screaming and shouting at our 11 year child with ASD with comments such as he was â€œswimming like an idiotâ€. Not sure how much longer parents will be prepared to put up with this direction of travel and the terminal decline of the place seems inevitable.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot recommend this place highly enough from a swimming lesson perspective. My son (now 7) has been coming here for a few years now and over this time has grown in confidence so much. He has had a variety of instructors over that time and all of them have been encouraging and professional. Shout out to Rob who is amazing!

The rest of the staff are equally lovely with reception staff helping and the car parking attendant being polite and friendly.

Changing rooms are kept in very good condition. There are a few individual cubicles but mostly its shared changing space. There are clean toilets and showers available too.

Outside reception there are a couple of vending machines as well. Upstairs is a cafe but i've never used it so can't comment!
showerReviews.author: Jennie Whittaker

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot recommend this place highly enough from a swimming lesson perspective. My son (now 7) has been coming here for a few years now and over this time has grown in confidence so much. He has had a variety of instructors over that time and all of them have been encouraging and professional. Shout out to Rob who is amazing!

The rest of the staff are equally lovely with reception staff helping and the car parking attendant being polite and friendly.

Changing rooms are kept in very good condition. There are a few individual cubicles but mostly its shared changing space. There are clean toilets and showers available too.

Outside reception there are a couple of vending machines as well. Upstairs is a cafe but i've never used it so can't comment!
showerReviews.author: Jennie Whittaker

showerReviews.reviewText: CCCU sports centre is a fantastic gym to belong to too. After returning to the gym following a twenty year absence I immediately felt at home which was primarily due to the fantastic team that they have there. All the staff are very friendly and always willing to help with any support you need. They created a programme specifically for me, taking into account my recent injury, and then provided a very thorough induction. The gym is very clean and tidy and you will regularly see the staff cleaning all areas. The equipment is well maintained and since I joined in April this year I have never seen anything â€œout of orderâ€. The changing rooms are spacious with trolly token operated lockers and showers. There are many classes available too which are easily booked via the app. I donâ€™t think you will find any other gym in Canterbury with such a friendly and more dedicated team.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful gym! The standards are way below what should be expected for the price you pay.
The pool is freezing, there is always one jacuzzi out of service, unclean gym, the sauna is filthy and falling apart and the changing rooms need a complete update.
The atmosphere is unfriendly and most of the staff are unhelpful and unapproachable!
Also, it is completely impossible to cancel your membership and if you do they will ring/text/email you constantly threatening you with debt collection agencies etc!
Would not recommend to anyone!

I have tried to cancel my gym membership but this can't be done at the gym, I'd have to call their cancellation call centre. Really not worth the Â£42/m I'm paying!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice gym overall. Came here on a free day pass promotion and enjoyed working out here for the day. Machines felt very smooth to use and went up to a good enough weight. There is a wide array of free weights to use and quite a few moveable benches available too. Also a few squat racks as well, which is always nice. I went on a bank holiday during peak hours and it was quite busy to be honest, but didnâ€™t spend any time waiting around. Changing rooms very clean as well. My only negative takeaway from my experience is that it was quite warm in the gym, and the AC wasnâ€™t that strong, but honestly not a terrible thing as Iâ€™m yet to visit a gym in England with decent AC haha!

Overall would recommend this gym, definitely use a free day pass to try it out!
