Minging!!

Absolutely disgusting! Changing rooms gross... Rude staff, bossy and unapproachable..

First time here. Will certainly be the last... Rusty steps to the jacuzzi, rust around the pool tiles, grime... The changing rooms are gross. The floor is filthy black and disgusting.  Licker keys Rusty, and the bracelets on the verge of snapping with no tab to keep them on... Staff, when told the changing rooms are gross shrugged and seemed such an effort to get someone to clean it. No apology. Utter minging!

The street is cleaner than that pool/changing room
Do better!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visiting Whistable with young children and phoned to book a session as online not user- friendly. Pricey, but used to prices in the north, so not duch a surprise. Also had to pay to park.
Changing room crowded and grubby. Floor tiles dirty and evidence of green mould apparent.  Wet surfaces meant clothes got saturated. Lockers needed coins too - admittedly returned, but not convenient with hands full. Had to leave children in the ( communal! Personal privacy not a consideration!) shower after swimming to retrieve shampoo......overall a cold and unpleasant experience.
I'm sure local authority rates are high in that part of Kent, but the people of Whitstable are definitely being short- changed on swimming 'facilities'.
Staff were nice.
showerReviews.author: Jenny Newell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Katy has been teaching our daughter to swim for a few months now. Before she started swimming lessons even bath times were a struggle. After her first lesson it was remarkable to see the change in her, she was so much more confident in the water. After a few lessons she was on her back, getting her hair wet and blowing bubbles on the surface of the water. She's just earned her Duckling 1 award.

We couldn't recommend Katy enough as a swimming teacher for little ones. She has a great way with children, very patient and encouring. Our daughter really looks forward to her swimming lessons and bath times are now a breeze!

In terms of the swimming pool itself, it's warm for small ones, clean and the changing facilities are good. The viewing gallery is great too, very close to the pool, so you can see progress and is reassuring for the children to see you're not far away.
showerReviews.author: Warren Ashfield

Went into the pool today and was met by very friendly and approachable staff. Would like to name Adele and personally thank her for being so helpful and friendly.You are an asset to your team and I am looking forward to going back. (Your smile made my day).

I'm half way through my Padi course and it has been excellent. Clean toilets, shower area and pool. And another good point is the deep and shallow end (which you don't get at many pools in Kent).
Thank you again, and I hope to visit you again soon and bring someone else!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Went into the pool today and was met by very friendly and approachable staff. Would like to name Adele and personally thank her for being so helpful and friendly.You are an asset to your team and I am looking forward to going back. (Your smile made my day).

I'm half way through my Padi course and it has been excellent. Clean toilets, shower area and pool. And another good point is the deep and shallow end (which you don't get at many pools in Kent).
Thank you again, and I hope to visit you again soon and bring someone else!

showerReviews.reviewText: First time swimming for years. The staff are very well trained and helpful, l think that they're pleased to be back. It's necessary to call to book a lane - there are three double lanes, slow, medium and jaws - due to limited numbers of swimmers, 40 l believe. It was very clean, the water was warm and the showers were hot! I think it opens before 7a.m. There's a managed gym and a selection of drink dispensers and one can sit and relax before heading off. A positive experience and l hope to go 2 - 3 times a week. Can't upload pics as they're not allowed.

showerReviews.reviewText: I am delighted to be a member of this leisure centre at Dover I had a good tour of the whole place with a lovely member of staff called Bridie she was so kind and caring and listened to all my questions with patience Bridie was most helpful and empathetic towards my needs I give her 10/10 she is indeed an asset to the company, this leisure centre has lots to offer plenty of parking spaces a large entrance plenty of facilities for wheelchair users including toilets showers and cafÃ© it's a lovely clean and spacious centre with everything you need the swimming pool is large and has beautiful views of the countryside and fields with same views from the fitness rooms they also have a sauna and steam room a separate children's pool, squash courts, football pitches, climbing facilities and the people are very friendly and courteous I compared this centre with the Bannatyne in Broadstairs and I can honestly say there was a huge difference between the two with the private centre Bannatyne costing Â£72. A month and looking like a rundown public centre on the other hand  the Dover  leisure centre  is free to use for the public there are no costly contracts cancel any time, there was no upgrade in decor or facilities at Bannatyne which you would expect for a private centre, the Dover centre costs Â£45. For the full package and the centre it's self is so much better. The decor the space the facilities the cleanliness friendliness and amount of changing rooms showers lockers ect never failed me this is what I'd expect from a private centre but I must say Bannatyne in Ashford Kent is a good large centre in my experience it's only been the Broadstairs centre that let's them down. ðŸ˜€

showerReviews.reviewText: Having just renewed my annual membership for this pool today, it seemed a good time to acknowledge what a  truly Talented Team Community they have. A Very friendly warm welcome at Reception for my first swim years back made me commit then to an annual membership. The same welcome very much features in 2025. This complete with Vigilant, helpful Lifeguards and their Seniors, The Swimming Teachers, A great housekeeper, and all the behind the scenes Management team. Its a fun place to come. I'm a lanes swimmer each weekday morning. There are so many other great locals of all abilities that come together then, with our "Tribe" gaining new members all the time. Thank You to ALL
showerReviews.author: keith russell

locations.title: Aylesham Welfare Sports Club
locations.address: îƒˆSpinney Ln, Aylesham, Canterbury CT3 3BE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Sadly, for the price there are better gyms locally.  On the plus side side staff are friendly and it's close to home,  on the down side, one treadmill (out of only 3 in there) has been out of use for ages and the equipment could do with a good hoover and wash down and some general tlc.  The machines all have broken ports, should you wish to plug earphones in, but don't worry, some members have the music on the laptop on at mega volume so it won't be quiet in there.  I did send a message on messenger querying the cleaning schedule but no one ever replied, I emailed saying I wished to cancel and again heard nothing back, no asking my reasons or whatever.  I don't like leaving a bad review on here but for less money you can join Bannatynes at Broadstairs which has multiple machines - all working, all immaculate.
showerReviews.author: Tina Collins

Sturry Road

locations.title: Exclusive Fitness
locations.address: îƒˆUnit 2 Simmonds Rd, Canterbury CT1 3RA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Just amazing. I work with Leon but I've also had sessions with other trainers and it's such a great team, even down to the on site physio - perfect for sports massage after workouts. I train regularly and it has surprised me how much I enjoy it and how it has become such an important part of my life. It goes beyond physical fitness, with Leon's support the mindset has filtered through to my diet and my lifestyle choices and I'm so happy with the results. If you don't like public gyms, want genuine and sustainable health benefits or just want to work out with a great team and transform how you look and feel, this is the place for you. There's even two large private changing/shower rooms and on site parking, it has it all.
showerReviews.author: Ben Fitter-Harding

showerReviews.reviewText: Very good few hours. Looks like we are on holiday. Lazy river all around the out side (take a rubber ring), cafe inside for drinks etc. Slide down all around the outside into the lazy river. Good park outside (free) to enjoy before or after swimming. Parking was reasonable, about Â£5 for six hours. Only downside was that the splash pad outside that is also free wasn't working which is common when reading other reviews. Also if possible, take your own umbrella as there is very little shade inside the pool.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A fun day our for kids and adults alike. The salt water element was a nice surprise as I prefer that to chlorinated water. Punctuality is key here as its the best way to find a spot to place your belongings. It's kept fairly clean and even has food available to purchase, though I've never tried it.

The facilities outside the pool are a major benefit as well as the kids can tire themselves out even more before or after swimming on the play equipment.

showerReviews.reviewText: What a lovely place. Saw it on a reel and decided to take my granddaughter the next day. We travelled from Suffolk and booked the afternoon session. Stopped for some lunch on the way. Lovely day out. Pool has a lazy river, kids pool and adult pool, changing rooms, toilets, cafe. Lots of space to set up camp for the afternoon but not a lot of shade. Water was cold but we knew that before coming. Absolutely nothing to complain about. All very reasonably priced. Huge play park outside and a splash pad which was free.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to visit here for soooo long! Finally got the perfect excuse and brought my best friend for her birthday. We were greeted at reception and given a quick tour of the facilities. We were given a robe and a towel each and we changed into these before going up to the massage waiting room. We were collected by our massage therapists and taken into our own private rooms for the massage. The treatment was lovely and the hour passed by way too quickly! We then were taken to a relaxation are and made a cup of tea which was lovely after the massage.

I would like to offer a pro tip at this point, there was an autumnal nip in the air and we hadn't remembered to take flipflops but the floor was super chilly on the toes! If you feel the cold like I do, remember your sandals or flipflops!

After we had booked time to use the pool and facilities. We had the best time popping between the sauna, pool, hot tub, and steam room. It was never too busy in any of the areas and they were all clean. We were incredibly fortunate with the weather and it literally felt like we had gone on holiday for the day!

We hadn't booked in for lunch but the smells coming from the kitchen were making us both hungry so we asked if they took walk ins at the spa reception and the lady said yes. We popped through a little door and were in the restaurant and were seated at a lovely table in 10 mins. Our waitress was lovely and we ordered some of the small plates and some lovely refreshing drinks. The food came out relatively quickly considering how busy it was (it was peak lunch time 1.30pm) and was well presented and oh so delicious! I don't often eat out so to me the food was amazing! The tapas style food we picked was so flavourful and the perfect amount for sharing. We were recommended a delicious pudding and enjoyed every mouthful!

My friend and I have been on a few different spa days together around Bristol and this by far took the number 1 spot! Thank you to all who made our treat day so wonderful! We will be back!
showerReviews.author: Ellie Coombs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for Â£3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked the swim and breakfast package as we were spending a week in Bristol and seemed a nice thing to do . I must say we were blown away by the whole experience more queens club than David Lloydâ€™s and with bells on . This lido was refurbished and reopened to the public in 2007 . Architecturally beautiful and lovingly restored with incredible attention to detail from the pool side cubicle changing curtains to the tasteful period furniture in the upper floors . The members and staff , friendly and charming shared their special place with us and we very much appreciated . Pool , steam , sauna and jacuzzi left us refreshed and ready for breakfast. Changing rooms and shower  areas were super clean and tidy . Then to breakfast well !!! This was another level and unexpected , ibÃ©rico chop with Catalan beans duck egg , morcilla and membrillo was a Hispanic combination I would have only expected to find in heaven , congratulations to the genius who pulled that baby to the pass at menu development . As in many cases sadly wonderful food not matched by service , would you like some toast with that or anything else we can get you would have been nice and a simple upsell , regardless come to expect these things and move on albeit annoying. Having said that the food quality setting and environment made for one of the most memorable breakfast. Thank you .
showerReviews.author: GastronomÃ­a Europa

locations.title: Shepton Mallet Lido
locations.address: îƒˆShaftgate Ave, Shepton Mallet BA4 5YA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: What a smashing pool! The 25m, heated pool is over 100 years old, originally starting life as a brewing reservoir for the cider brewery next door. The staff are friendly and helpful, telling us that until recently the pool was heated by the brewing process! Despite its long history the pool is immaculately clean, the water was probably around 25Â° when we visited, and the site is well maintained. Lockers are available on site, traditional changing cubicles with hot showers and toilets, a tuck shop, picnic tables, children's play area, and an additional small pool for toddlers means that there's something for everyone. Parking is free, although I assume that the car park will fill quickly on hot days. We went for a lane swim - one fast, two medium, and a double-width slow lane were available with a very attentive life guard looking on throughout. We really enjoyed our visit ðŸ’•

showerReviews.reviewText: What a lovely gem and so much better and more relaxing than the one in Street! Great, helpful, friendly staff and lots of fun in the pool for children (unlike the Street one where children cannot play!) There were floats, beach balls, toys for little children and lots of acrobatics. The life guards were reasonable and kept everyone safe without being militant (like at the Street one) The water is slightly cooler and changing facilities not perhaps as good as Greenbanks, but we preferred it as the fun two hours were so much more enjoyable than the day pass at Greenbanks. We shall return many a times I'm sure! Thoroughly recommend it to families with children!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful place. A very bad experience from start to finish. I took my children who were excited to spend a few hours there and we end up leaving in 15 minutes.

Very run down place and hygiene is not great. The pool is filled with trees leaves and ants.

They didnâ€™t allow my 7 and halt year to go on the blue slide saying the rule is 8+ while most water parks around the world look the height as this safer and staff can verify. I saw other children who were much younger and when asked the staff they said we appreciate you didnâ€™t lie like others. I didnâ€™t come across any of these rules prior on the website which meant I wasted time and money going there.

It was around 14:30 and all the sudden they shut the doors to the slides with no notice displayed or anything explained.

Steer away. Not worth a penny. I would give it 0 star.

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a huge outdoor, unheated pool. Sections of the pool, which is an irregular shape, are divided into  slides/splash area, an area for families, and a section for lane swimming. The outdoor pool is part of a leisure centre with indoor pool, but access to the outdoor pool is separate to the leisure centre and can be reached via the car park. Plenty of free parking. We went for an early morning lane swim - there were only 4 of us in the pool, so plenty of space and the local/regular swimmers made us feel really welcome (even giving us 'Friends of Aldershot Lido' swimming caps, which were a lovely souvenir of our visit). The laned section of the pool is about 25-30m & fairly deep. Pool is well maintained and lovely to see the traditional fountain in operation. Changing facilities are basic but clean & clean toilets and hot showers. Lockers available poolside, but bring padlock. Overall we really enjoyed our visit ðŸ˜Š

locations.title: TOR Spa Retreat
locations.address: îƒˆWickham Ln, Canterbury CT3 1RD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a day spa retreat and so although I can't comment on the overnight accommodation, I can confirm that the relaxation areas were very comfortable, well presented and clean. There was plenty of seating suitable for small and larger groups. I was in a group of 5 and we were able to comfortably sit together in the sitting room and around the pool area.

The pool was lovely and warm and the sauna was great too. There were plenty of showering facilities, so I didn't need to wait for a turn and overall everything was well presented.

There were tea and coffee making facilities available with unlimited access and plenty of water  stations dotted around. The lunch was delicious, we had a daal curry and a fruity posset.

I had a full body massage, which was wonderful. The therapist had just the right amount of pressure, she checked in with me as to whether I wanted my feet and tummy massaged too, which I did and overall I came out feeling super relaxed and well after a lovely day.

I'll definitely be going back with my partner in the future and now I know where it is, it'll be a little easier to find as the road sign was a little small for me and I didn't see it at first from the direction I came in.

locations.title: The Gym Group Gillingham
locations.address: îƒˆUnit 4, Ambley Rd, Gillingham Business Park, Gillingham ME8 0PU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First of all, I feel some personal information is needed. This will be brief. (if youâ€™re just looking for key points of information about the gym, they our set up as bullet points further down)

Three years ago, I was nineteen stone and eating my feelings away instead of dealing with them in a healthy way.
I made the change to start working out at home and eating better.
I has been a long and difficult road.
I have in those three years been working out at home buying free weights to train however I hit a wall.
I was no longer possible to progress without paying a large amount into equipment so... I did something I was avoiding and joined a gym.
Now before I breakdown this gym into some key points I want to be clear that all of my fears and worries about joining a have vanished and I now feels almost silly for having them. The staff at The Gym Group in Gillingham have been nothing but kind and supportive in my transition to using a public gym.

-Equipment
I have yet to find any exercise or workout I cannot complete at this gym. They have plenty of dedicated machines and free weights along with a studio upstairs and a hyrax section downstairs. Even when there was 96 people using the gym at the same time as me it didn't feel crowded, and I had no problems working out.

-Staff
very supportive and more than happy to answer any questions. Because of my lack of experience in a commercial gym I have relied on them to show me how to safety use the equipment and save myself from doing it wrong.

-classes
I cannot believe they are not an addition cost. There are so many options to choose from. I tried out some of the classes thinking "why not as its part of my membership" now they have become part of my workouts each week.

-Facilities
They have plenty of lockers all over the gym and the changing rooms have more than enough room even when its peek time. They have normal water stations to fill up your bottle from and vending machines with snacks and drinks.

cleaning-
Now this gym is always in use by members (I also use the gym at 3 am and seen others there) itâ€™s unrealistic to think it going to be perfect all the time because not every person using the gym is clean up a station after using it. In saying all that the staff do a great job at cleaning down the equipment and keeping the place tidying. You will find some plates left here or there but please understand the staff are also teaching classes and doing personal training sessions.

Parking-
I cannot see you ever having a problem finding a place to park and if youâ€™re worried about crossing there is zebra crossings marks on the road at the main roundabout to get you across.

-Price
I pay for their most expensive option for a membership, and I personally feel like Itâ€™s a complete steal. I also use their hydration stations a well. I cannot believe I don't pay more. I want the gym to start selling merch or something so I can help pay for more equipment and show my support.

In conclusion from someone who has never used a commercial gym I have never felt or performed this good before. I don't feel like I'm being jugged, and I feel like I could ask any other member to help spot me or work in with them. This gym is great.
showerReviews.author: Charles Hooper

showerReviews.reviewText:
SUPER MODERN GYM AT A LOW PRICE!
If youâ€™re a member at JD Gyms Hempstead Valley, I recommend paying the extra money to use both facilities as this is a lush gym! If youâ€™re not a member at all, definitely come and check this place out.

Massive floor space with lots of weights and weightlifting equipment downstairs, Eleiko kit is super cool here. And the upstairs is your cardio area, changing rooms, toning areas & a studio for classes so if youâ€™re the self-conscious type, you could easily spend your entire workout upstairs without encountering the bodybuilder types downstairs.

The gym seems to go on forever, so if you like a modern workout space without feeling claustrophobic, this is the place for you. The fit and finish is definitely superior to any other gym you've been to.

Saunas and 24-hour access is included in the package, but the parking outside can get a little busy, so consider parking at the overflow car park where Homebase is.

Other than that, itâ€™s definitely one of the best gyms in the area.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This brand new gym is excellent!
Located right next to Sainsbury's with plenty of free parking, this gym has it all.

Brand new, loads of equipment and there's some cool things that you probably haven't seen in other gyms, like the quirky mood lighting and the foliage on the walls.

I don't think you'll struggle to find equipment to use (see the pictures) and people seem to enjoy the fitness classes, which are included in the cost of membership.

I also like the saunas in the changing room!

Overall, this is definitely worth the money - have a look around if you're not sure about joining. But I guarantee that you won't regret it!

showerReviews.reviewText: A great place to park near london, showers and toilets are clean, you also get a food voucher every 24h that is worth 6Â£, there is an ASDA store nearby (~30min walk) and you can also catch a train to london from swanscombe or greenhithe stations (~12Â£ for a train ticket, or a bus for around 8Â£). The only things that people may not like is that the parking appears to not be paved, so there might be a lot of dust if it hasnt been raining for a while, also there is a lot of potholes on the way to the parking lot, and the surrounding areas are full of trash, but the parking lots are kept clean.

locations.title: Riverside | Student Accommodation Canterbury
locations.address: îƒˆSturry Rd, Canterbury CT1 1JX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve been staying here since September 2023 and have had a great time so far with only a few issues.
Iâ€™ve noticed people talking about the vending machines, Iâ€™ve never had any issues or had them break on me, theyâ€™re always working for me at least.
People are saying our AM, Maria, is rude, however Iâ€™ve never had this problem with her, she is friendly and always up for a chat, like most of the reception staff too. If you treat them with respect then theyâ€™ll treat you the same way back.

The main few issues are the washing and drying machines. Iâ€™ve only used them a few times as I take my washing home most weekends, but whenever I use them thereâ€™s either an issue with draining from the washing machine and I have to call up the company, or the dryers donâ€™t actually dry my clothes. Also give the machines about 5-10 more minutes than it says on the app as it goes on for longer. However itâ€™s an outside company called Wash Station and itâ€™s nothing to really do with Novel.
In the contract and if you go on tours before moving in, youâ€™re told you have bike hires, however this isnâ€™t true, they have no bikes in the shed at the moment.
The study area I feel needs to be a bit more closed off as itâ€™s directly next to the cinema room and private kitchen, where people have parties/watch films/listen to music, and you can hear everything.
There was a previous issue with someone blasting music from their window at full volume at all hours of the day, I rang a few times on different days but eventually went downstairs and our lovely security guard sorted it and I havenâ€™t had any issues with loud music since.

Overall itâ€™s a lovely place to live, with a small area behind with a Battle Bar, Desserts Restaurant, and a few other restaurants. Thereâ€™s also Curzon cinema which is great too. Directly underneath E block/right next to the accommodation thereâ€™s a Fireway pizza which is good and a Starry Mart which sells Asian food and toys, which is also nice. The cinema room is nice and a great way to meet new friends, the gym is also good with lots of equipment, thereâ€™s also pool, fooÃŸall, and table tennis/ping pong which are fun to use.
showerReviews.author: Isobelle Hart (Izzi)

locations.title: Canterbury Student Village
locations.address: îƒˆ22, Parham Rd, Canterbury CT1 1TA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a good experience at all with cloud student homes. I applied for accommodation here and first impressions were not good. Cobwebs and insects in the corner of the bedroom and a mattress so springy and uncomfortable. The keycard to my room didnâ€™t even work on my first night there. On my 2nd day there I was just chilling on my bed when some worker just opened my door. I mean what if I was just getting out the shower or changing. It is so unacceptable! When he opened the door (literally wide open!) he said, â€œoh sorryâ€ and I said, â€œare you here to fix my keycard for my roomâ€ he said â€œyesâ€ and shut the door and just left and didnâ€™t do anything. Regardless of whether him opening the door was a mistake or not, it is not ok for an unauthorised entry into my room to occur. Especially when Iâ€™m paying 7k for it. And in my section, all the rooms that were clearly unoccupied had their doors fully open and the beds up (as they are storage beds that can be lifted). And my room is right at the end and one room opposite me and one room next to me the doors were fully shut clearly indicating they were occupied so it was quite silly for someone to walk past many unoccupied rooms and used a keycard to open it with no knock or anything.
I told my mum about this, and she was not happy at all as well and she wanted me to leave straight away after this incident had happened. After re-reading the contract again it was a clear breach when the guy opened my door without prior, written notice therefore, we should have the tenancy cancelled and not be liable for rent. As firstly why am I going to pay rent for a place that does things like that and clearly doesnâ€™t clean the room before a new tenant moves in. We spoke to the property manager who was helpful, and she said to me and mum that the tenancy would be cancelled. That was all ok initially, but they have been trying to take the rent from me which I should not have to pay, so I went back telling them that I have received notifications about rent and then the property manager said to me that you still must pay rent until a replacement tenant is found. This is understandable if I was just no longer wanting to stay there. However, due to what happened it should not make me have to find a replacement and still pay rent. The tenancy should just be cancelled and thatâ€™s that.
Overall, I wouldnâ€™t sign a contract here, Just Donâ€™t Do It! The reviews on their page are already bad Iâ€™m only adding fuel to the fire.
showerReviews.author: Saira Shinwari

showerReviews.reviewText: A lot to say about this place. The fact this accommodation had a 2.6 rating a few weeks ago and itâ€™s suddenly jumped to 3.8 is telling, despite there being only one 5 star review in this timeframe. The only good things about this place are its prices and ok room size. The cons, thereâ€™s a lot of cons. Trying to communicate with Cloud student homes is like trying to talk to a ghost. They respond to emails incredibly slow and they wonâ€™t even pick up the phone. Upon arriving in my room, the floor was dirty, the toilet had human waste in it and on the toilet seat. The drawers still had food inside and dust was everywhere. When I questioned the manager she told me I should have booked an appointment of arrival so it could be cleaned properly. Even though I did book an appointment scheduled 2 hours before I actually got into my room. For the next 2 weeks my cluster didnâ€™t have a microwave for 2 whole weeks. For 5 days, the building didnâ€™t have running hot water. For nearly 2 days there wasnâ€™t any working WiFi. As I write now the WiFi isnâ€™t working and even if it does, sometimes itâ€™s slow to the point my phone will connect to mobile data instead. I also had to wait 2 weeks for my clusterâ€™s stove to be replaced and the cleaners barely do any work in the kitchen. Iâ€™d like to be generous but thereâ€™s far too many issues to be ignored and my experience going by the other reviews isnâ€™t unique either. I would advise living at this accommodation unless you need to save money. God bless.
showerReviews.author: Godwins Braimoh

showerReviews.reviewText:
My experience at Canterbury Student Village has been extremely disappointing and concerning from the very start. When I first moved in, my flat and room were in an unliveable condition â€” there was dirt swept behind the bed, the kitchen contained mouldy, decayed food frozen to the fridge, and it was clear no cleaning staff had entered since the previous occupants left. The state of the flat felt borderline a biohazard.

When I raised this issue, the staff member on duty initially tried to justify the situation by saying this was â€œthe cheapest accommodation in Canterbury,â€ which is not true and completely irrelevant â€” no level of pricing excuses giving students a filthy, unsafe room. After a long discussion, I was only offered a room change when the manager arrived. The managerâ€™s response was unprofessional, even suggesting I cancel my booking because she thought I would â€œgive her a headacheâ€ later for reporting issues.

The second room I received was only slightly better. It still had spiders, stains on the carpet, and an old mattress, but at least it was somewhat habitable. However, the problems continued. A few weeks later, the blinds fell down â€” they had been attached with a single screw, a clear safety hazard.

Other ongoing issues include:

Weak, unreliable Wi-Fi that has gone down multiple times, making studying extremely difficult.

Poor parcel handling â€” parcels arriving over the weekend arenâ€™t collected, and even when they are, you often have to wait more than a day for a QR code before being allowed to pick them up.

Visible neglect in the building, such as a hole in the wall near the entrance that was â€œrepairedâ€ by crudely hammering a piece of wood over it, and a persistent unpleasant smell on entry.

Most recently, no hot water for two days, and when I asked staff what to do, I was told to â€œuse a kettleâ€ to heat water â€” a completely unsafe and unacceptable suggestion. When I asked for temporary access to another room to shower, they refused to help, saying I could only do so during reception hours.

Itâ€™s clear that serious health, safety, and management issues exist here, and many problems are either ignored or handled very slowly. Iâ€™m genuinely considering taking this matter to small claims court due to the poor living conditions, lack of duty of care, and negligence Iâ€™ve experienced.

I would strongly advise future students to avoid Canterbury Student Village until major improvements are made in cleanliness, safety, and management professionalism.
showerReviews.author: jj

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID AT ALL COST! 5 STAR REVIEWS GOT TO BE FAKE !
ive been living here for a good month now and have been trying to find every way to move out. The money paid for an ensuite here isnt worth a penny , stupid pricing for it to be this far out , have 0 to no facilities , ping pong and pool table shown in pictures were a lie ( they dont exist ) , outside benches and areas are broken and always disgusting .
Let alone the rooms and apartments.....
I moved in to the delightful information of "we havent cleaned since the last tenants "
- the walls are dirty , scratched up , full of blue tack (and this isnt just my room)
- the carpet was never thoroughly cleaned
- THEY TRIED TO GET ME TO KEEP THE OLD TENANTS MATTRESS
- Full of bedbugs and mites
- Furniture in the kitchen and rooms are either broken or barely working

The toilets are also grimy and hadn't been cleaned , only got cleaned after 4 times of asking and still wasnt a great job .
- The shower is cold , water doesnt run hot at all .
The Staff and Maintenece team are practically useless , they dont reply to tickets unless you plead for them to come by the reception , and thats if you dont get ignored.

Then comes the WIFI . For a **STUDENT** Accom you would expect the wifi to be of standards at the VERY least .. its almost impossible to dowload files without it crashing on you and disconnecting , and FORGET about playing games since the ping is always 100ms +.
Genuinley hope people see this post and avoid coming here these lot do not deserve a penny of anyones money .
showerReviews.author: m rby

showerReviews.reviewText:
Literally the most disgusting place to even consider.

They threw away our stuff, no warnings, no heads up. Literally straight away THREW our stuff into the garbage when it to move out as a part of their "cleaning" routine, and it had items our families sent from overseas, HAD LITERAL KITCHEN APPLIANCES that they just DISCARDED WITHOUT CONSENT, and so much stuff costing a substantial amount of money, especially seeing as this is supposed to be an accommodation for STUDENTS.

Literally brought tears to our eyes it was SO horrible and inhumane I have no clue how a single 5 star review could possibly exist for this hell.

Please don't fall for it, they're all paid/fake reviews. These people are luck to not be sued by us (given the mental toll me and my family has already taken, I didn't want anything to do with these disgusting group of "people").

DONT EVEN GET ME STARTED ON THE LIVING CONDITIONS, i.. have gotten the worst medical conditions of my life in this hellhole, there's BEDBUGS (PLURAL) THAT WILL BITE YOU REPEATEDLY AND THE REQUESTS ARE IGNORED, WINDOWS ARE BROKEN IN EXTREME WEATHER AND THEY REFUSE TO HELP

THE FLIPPIN' GENERAL HYGIENE IS NON EXISTENT THAT I LITERALLY "DEVELOPED" A HIVES BREAKOUT WHICH IS UNDESCRIBABLY PAINFUL BECAUSE YOU ARE A STUDENT, POSIBLY IN A BRAND NEW COUNTRY, FOR THE FIRST TIME, ALONE IN THIS ACCOCMOADATION WHICH IS QUITE FRANKLY !!HELL ON EARTH!!

Avoid at all cost, it's not worth risking your actual life to save a few pounds. There's much better accommodations that wouldn't scar you physically and emotionally for life. I am back for my post graduate studies this year, and have chosen a nearby accommodation which i wouldn't be disclosing the name of here, but just check nearby ratings on maps, and please go for something that's above 4 stars at least this is still criminally high sitting at 3.9 while this place should be absolutely reported and taken down

showerReviews.reviewText:
I dropped off my daughter here nearly 2 weeks ago and she was one of the first to move in.  This is my honest opinions as a Father.

Cleanliness on Arrival:  The whole unit was dirty with lots of dead insects, cobwebs and dust in the rooms and communal areas.
State of Room: Terrible.  The mattress was the worst mattress I have ever seen and I could fold it like a slice of bread.  Sitting on it was like sitting on a piece of cardboard.  It had no buoyancy at all and is long past its usable state.  Many things do not work correctly like the mini fridge and shower and although this has all been documented in an online inventory form, apart from an acknowledgement email, no further communication has been received as to if, and when any of these will be fixed.

Urban Student Life:  The worst thing I have found about this place is the way the management of Urban Student Life is actually setup.  When Students contract with USL, they think they are contracting with USL and will receive a similar service to everyone else living there.  In fact, the rooms are split up and owned by seperate investors and depending on which investor owns your block, your experience can be very different.  For example, my daughter's room is actually owned and managed by cloudstudenthomes.co.uk.  She has this terrible mattress (and still does), but literally in the rooms next door (which are owned by different investors), they have newer comfortable mattresses (see pictures).  Another example is the Cloud Homes rooms did not have a Student Welcome Box (with a few drinks and snacks) or welcome information leaflet which was actually branded as USL.  The latter actually had very useful information like Fire Evacuation information and emergency numbers.  Other investor owned rooms did have this.  After phoning the office, we did secure a welcome box, but this should be provided by Cloud Homes as standard, especially as it contains Health and Safety information and as it is branded USL, which is who we thought we had contracted with.

On-Site Staff: I literally do not know what the staff are there for except to loan out the Vacuum cleaners and provide keys.  Any questions about the room or flats and you are met with the standard answer â€œYou'll have to contact the investorsâ€, in our case, Cloud Homes, who when you contact apologise for not being up to standard, but have failed to act so far.  No replacement mattress has come despite repeated emails and calls or any response on problematic items from the inventory.  I have actually had my daughter crying down the phone to me because she cannot sleep, due to the poor mattress.

So in summary for all you prospective students, foreign students and parents, I would not recommend this place and if you do come here, I would perform due. diligence about who you are actually contracting with and what differences you can expect as you'll be paying the same rent, but won't have the same experience!  Should the experience improve, I will gladly change my review to reflect any improvement.
showerReviews.author: Hitesh Sharma

showerReviews.reviewText: Avoid if possible. Flats in Tallis court are mouldy due to leaks and the doors lack security to the point where anyone can walk into your accommodation. Fridge has been broken since before I moved in over 6 months ago and still has not been fixed despite numerous complaints. They provided us with mini fridges, which is pointless since electrical appliances only work when you are in the room. I have lost around Â£200 in spoiled groceries due to refrigeration issues. Wifi is slow and unreliable. The reception is bad to the point where you can only make phone calls when you stand in a specific corner of your room. At one point problems with the boiler resulted in no heating or hot water for months. Landlords often show up to your room with little to no notice, and will enter your room if you donâ€™t respond fast enough. No elevator. Flatmates will make constant noise at all times and steal your belongings when possible. Wardrobe is small and there is a lack of space to store things.
showerReviews.author: ThunderBot62

showerReviews.reviewText:
Super welcome. Very clean facilities. Excellent location - calm, lots of trees, feels like the countryside but only a 25 minute walk downhill into town. Next to a bus stop if you don't feel like walking back up the hill.
Make sure to arrive through the town using main roads as the alternative approach is via a very narrow B road which becomes an extremely narrow lane with blind corners and not many passing points.
Canterbury is beautiful; well worth a visit.

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice site with plenty of space. Staff let it down. Not very friendly and very unorganized. The 2nd shower block was closed for half of our stay and when opened again it was clear they could have closed of the area being maintained. In addition when the showers were reopened they failed to put the water back on so I had to dress and pack up my stuff and go to the other shower block. Cleaning was done each morning between 10.30 and 12. I've never been on a site that takes that long especially with the number of staff they have. Also people still want to use the facilities at 10.30 so why they couldn't do it later. Also we saw one male site assistant walking along just in front of a female staff member and she was pushing all the gardening equipment in a wheelbarrow whilst he walked along empty handed. From what we saw the women staff did most of the work on this site
showerReviews.author: Lisa Merrison

showerReviews.reviewText:
Once again a lovely stay at Nethergong. This time we hired one of their bell tents with all the bells and whistles (very much intended), it came with everything we could ever need. We just needed to turn up with clothes and food and we were set.

Facilities are bang on. Toilets and showers are clean and perfectly functional. Shop is small but has everything you'd need, also does good coffee and food.

We pre-ordered pizza on the Friday and Alberto's Italian on the Saturday, both of which were delicious.

The cocktails are also great, with a caravan bar open through the late afternoon/evening.

The site is very safe and the kids can roam, for hours without trouble. The staff are friendly and welcoming, as are all the other guests on site.

We'll see you again next year!
showerReviews.author: Dan Finn

showerReviews.reviewText: The Sunnyfield hosts are just lovely - so friendly and helpful. We stayed in one of their bell tents and they were well thought out, table/benches, gas stove, all cooking utensils etc provided. The site is just beautiful and the kids loved watching the rabbits, hearing the owl and all the other wildlife. The compost toilets were actually perfectly alright and super clean. Hot water for handwashing and washing up & plenty of drinking water. We didn't use the shower as only stayed for one night, but they are located in old horse trailers and are super cute. Would highly recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a quiet sheltered pitch where we could put up 3 tents for 3 nights. We don't like big sites  this had a smaller campsite feel due to the layout.  The pitch was a long way from the car park so we had to make several long trips with wheelbarrows which wasn't ideal but once sorted we could relax. It's a bit of a pain packing away as you have to ferry stuff to the car and then repack to fit the tent in but it works.  The Compost toilets and solar powered showers seemed ok most of the time. It's just a case of catching the hot water. I think  it's  a bit pricey at Â£34 per night compared to other really scenic lovely small sites we have been to in Dorset and Devon at Â£20-Â£25 per night with  traditional facilities (toilet and shower blocks, etc) . Fire wood is Â£9 per bag compared to the Â£5 per bag we paid in Dorset but we had a fire 3 nights in a row.  Overall a nice weekend but it seems that 'off grid' is an expensive way to camp ðŸ˜”.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We really loved our stay at this peaceful, countryside site. The pitches comprise a hardstand with a grass area next to it which was plenty big enough to accommodate our large, family sized tent.

The toilet and bathroom facilities were separate rather than in a block, in fact you get your own enclosed spacious bathroom with toilet, sink and shower - there are two to choose from and there's a separate WC.  The dishwashing area is in the same building as the bathrooms, and here you can also find a fridge, books and DVDs, all of which are lovely extra touches.  All the facilities were kept spotlessly clean at all times.

The walk to Chilham is about 1.5 miles - it's a beautiful little town, well worth a visit with a pub and hotel - the food at the hotel was excellent.

We would definitely recommend the site and hope to return soon.
showerReviews.author: Anne Holland

showerReviews.reviewText: This is quite a nice site located only about  5 miles from Canterbury  it well located for visiting all the coastal places of interest. We were on this site for 2 weeks and while we like a quiet site this was too quiet only about 2 pitches occupied at any time, I cant understand why,  Pete who owned the site was a lovely chap and couldn't be more helpful, the shower block didn't seem quite finished or in need of some repair, the shower were very nice better than most sites we have visited in the last 30 years, there is a security camera system that we found out later doesn't work. These site fees are very reasonable so I would still recommend this site.

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed for four nights at Sunnyside Farm last week and had a fantastic time. The site is so relaxed and quiet it was just what I needed for a few days' break.  There's only a small number of pitches and they're clean and level, my one had electric (although I didn't use it) and its own water tap. Facilities were clean and tidy and it was great having your own mini bathroom with a shower, loo and sink all in one room.  There's some great pubs nearby in Chilham and Chartham. Definitely recommended and I'm hoping to get back there again.

showerReviews.reviewText: We have just arrived home after an amazing night glamping at fleets paddock, upon arrival our beds were clean and made up, cups, cutlery plates, bowls and a picnic set with blanket were included in our tent to use and came in very handy. A gas stove was also included to use, we brought our own camping kettle however there is one available to use in the little kitchenette. Wood or a disposable bbq was also available for a small fee which came in very handy for us. The facilities were clean and tidy and the showers came with a lovely view. The viewing deck was a nice little touch for watching the sunset, and the lights on the tents/shepherd huts and around camp made the night time magical for the children, the paddock is safe away from the main roads so it was safe for our children to run around play badminton and on the swings. The owner is very responsive and it was lovely to meet her mum on site, we will definitely be returning.

showerReviews.reviewText:
As avid and regular campers, we are always keen to try out new sites. Unfortunately Fleets Paddock is not one we will be returning to. It's a site with a few lovely elements to it, but in our opinion, there is definitely room for improvement.

Upon driving up to the site there was very little signage to welcome you to the site, or to advise where to park, or check-in instructions. We only realised we were in the right place because there was a tent already in the field.  You cannot park next to your tent, or even unload the car in the camping field, but the owners have helpfully provided a selection of wheelbarrows. Luckily it's not a huge field to traipse all your stuff across.

During our visit the whole site was waterlogged and this made it very difficult to pick a suitable pitch, and the only walk-way in and out of the site was like a pond and got increasingly worse with the foot traffic. Due to the lack of check in instructions, we just unloaded and set up camp where we wanted, however we later noticed a sign near the toilets which stated we should have contacted "Alex" before doing anything! There was no contact number for Alex, so not sure how we were meant to do that! There was also a list of site rules but these signs were at the furthest part of the site, which were only seen when using the toilet block.

The site itself is very peaceful, loads of birdsong throughout the day and very little passing traffic. There are 2 swing seats for all to use, and a treehouse/viewing platform up in the trees. The field next door was in full bloom which was a lovely sight, and it was less than 10mins to walk to the local pub, which did really delicious food! The toilet block and showers were very modern, flushing toilets and the showers looked out over the field. There is also a tree with items you can borrow, such as pots and pans, which we thought was a nice touch. The outdoor sink was great for washing up, but the indoor sink leaked onto the floor every time the water was run.

We were there for 3 nights and only once had any contact with someone, who we assumed was the owner - they didn't introduce themselves, nor did they offer any firewood etc - we sourced our own elsewhere.

There is a communal firepit in the middle of the site, but we used our own, next to our tent.

There are no bins on site; while we understand the reasons for this and Fleets Paddock's intention to be back-to-basics, there was nowhere for firepit or bbq ash to be disposed of, so a small bin would have been useful. There was also no sanitary waste bins in the toilet area.

In our opinion, there needs to be more signage, clearer instructions for check-in/setting up and more of a presence from the owners. A sprinkle of sawdust across the field or even just at the walkway, would have helped with the bogginess. Overall, it just feels a bit unfinished.
showerReviews.author: Eloise Wickens

showerReviews.reviewText:
As avid and regular campers, we are always keen to try out new sites. Unfortunately Fleets Paddock is not one we will be returning to. It's a site with a few lovely elements to it, but in our opinion, there is definitely room for improvement.

Upon driving up to the site there was very little signage to welcome you to the site, or to advise where to park, or check-in instructions. We only realised we were in the right place because there was a tent already in the field.  You cannot park next to your tent, or even unload the car in the camping field, but the owners have helpfully provided a selection of wheelbarrows. Luckily it's not a huge field to traipse all your stuff across.

During our visit the whole site was waterlogged and this made it very difficult to pick a suitable pitch, and the only walk-way in and out of the site was like a pond and got increasingly worse with the foot traffic. Due to the lack of check in instructions, we just unloaded and set up camp where we wanted, however we later noticed a sign near the toilets which stated we should have contacted "Alex" before doing anything! There was no contact number for Alex, so not sure how we were meant to do that! There was also a list of site rules but these signs were at the furthest part of the site, which were only seen when using the toilet block.

The site itself is very peaceful, loads of birdsong throughout the day and very little passing traffic. There are 2 swing seats for all to use, and a treehouse/viewing platform up in the trees. The field next door was in full bloom which was a lovely sight, and it was less than 10mins to walk to the local pub, which did really delicious food! The toilet block and showers were very modern, flushing toilets and the showers looked out over the field. There is also a tree with items you can borrow, such as pots and pans, which we thought was a nice touch. The outdoor sink was great for washing up, but the indoor sink leaked onto the floor every time the water was run.

We were there for 3 nights and only once had any contact with someone, who we assumed was the owner - they didn't introduce themselves, nor did they offer any firewood etc - we sourced our own elsewhere.

There is a communal firepit in the middle of the site, but we used our own, next to our tent.

There are no bins on site; while we understand the reasons for this and Fleets Paddock's intention to be back-to-basics, there was nowhere for firepit or bbq ash to be disposed of, so a small bin would have been useful. There was also no sanitary waste bins in the toilet area.

In our opinion, there needs to be more signage, clearer instructions for check-in/setting up and more of a presence from the owners. A sprinkle of sawdust across the field or even just at the walkway, would have helped with the bogginess. Overall, it just feels a bit unfinished.
showerReviews.author: Eloise Wickens

showerReviews.reviewText: Disappointing as nothing what has been promised online, neither it looked like in the pictures. We had tent 6 with a lake view. You  don't even have a lake. I would of expected that this is washed after each visitors. Lakes fenced up and no chance of seeing it. Best pictures attached. No soap in one of the toilets for whole our stay. Neither shower gel in one of the showers. Tents so close and all facing main path so everyone can see you. It's very overlooked. Tents so close you can hear people's conversation. Overpriced stay and food. Yoga is not free at all. Coffee is not free at all. Would not stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We loved the vibe here!
Although we had some wet weather it felt very relaxed and we had such a warm welcome. My wife and I both had a face and neck massage from Lizzie in the Luna tent and owner Daniel made sure we had everything we needed.
Our 4yo son loved playing with Clare and Daniel's daughter Talis. We played tennis and a few lawn games such a pÃ©tanque.
The large feild is a mix or wild and treated to allow a relaxed 'off grid' feel to reaching our elegantly decorated bell tent. Very smart in decor, we loved it.

The free bottles of water at the terrace bar and the golf ball lights around the terrace are a nice touch.

No need to bring food, drinks, blankets or even cosmetics for washing. It's all there for you and even the showers (lovely and hot btw) use products that help us look after the planet.

This place ticks all the boxes!
We'll be back when the sun is shining and cant wait.

Thanks Daniel, Clare, Talis, Claire, Lizzie and Jake for making us feel like part of the family Quaives XXx
showerReviews.author: Daniel Watts

We went in the summer holidays, it was full with over 30 pitches occupied, so perhaps 60+ campers sharing 2 showers and 3 toilets, plus 2 more toilets in the shower cubicles. The showers and toilets were basic and really some investment is needed to bring these up to modern standards. The pitches were cramped, our guy ropes were almost touching those of the next tent.
Charging campsite prices for CL facilities, in fact many CLâ€™s offer better facilities.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A bad start. We booked up last minute to stay at Hawk place in our camper van and awning. When we arrived we were told by the proprietor that there was no record of our booking.
Eventually pitched up and was very disappointed with the general state of the toilets and showers. In the three days we were there, no one had cleaned up the wet toilet paper on the floor. For some time there was no toilet paper or hand soap in either toilet.. I really didn't fancy having a shower there as the two showers didn't look that clean either.  No hot water for washing up, there is a kettle to boil. Not easy when there are a few people needing to clean dishes.  The elsan disposal is not pleasant, covered in weeds with the danger of getting a 'splash back' By the number of people we saw on site, I am sure the owners could re invest a little money in bringing this site up to standard. We left a day early and certainly would not return.
showerReviews.author: Min Marshall

locations.title: Cobbs Meadow Caravan CL
locations.address: îƒˆBekesbourne Ln, Canterbury CT4 5DY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Great location less than 30 minutes from the ferry terminal at Dover. A good walk to a selection of three pubs in Bridge. Check the ordnance survey map for footpaths before you set out - it's possible to get there using only a couple of very short bits of road without a footpaths, the rest is on good paths through farmland. Look for the path that crosses the A2, it goes through an underpass so no dangerous road crossing (returning from Bridge the footpath leaves the far edge of the recreation ground by the A2 and runs alongside it for a few hundred metres before going through the underpass.) The site is equipped with electricity, but no toilets, showers or waste disposal, but as long as you know this in advance it's fine. The field is flat with cut grass and the electricity outlets position around the edges. The road that runs along the side of the field is a bit of a rat run and cars do come through at a bit of a lick. At night you can hear traffic on the A2 in the distance, but you also get to hear owls so not all bad. The people that run the site are nice and helpful; they do not live on-site, but are easily available by phone. This site is a good place to stop if you are on the way to France or if you want to stay longer and explore a beautiful part of the world which is riddled with footpaths.
showerReviews.author: Jnib

locations.title: Canterbury Reach Lodge Retreat
locations.address: îƒˆStone St, Canterbury CT4 5PL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed in Appledore Lodge as 6 adults and a dog visiting family for birthday celebrations and a trip to Marlowe theatre for the panto - location was excellent for where we needed to get to.

Lodge was spacious, clean and comfortable.  Nice that bath towels were large full-sized ones and not the standard small size you often get at holiday parks. The main bathroom had a heated towel rail, but the en-suite had nothing,  could really have done with a couple of hooks on wall between door and shower just for hanging towels on to dry. The wardrobes in twin rooms only had 2 hangers.

Kitchen was mostly well stocked, I was able to prepare a birthday brunch for everyone.  Just a shame the glasses were all different shapes / sizes and there was only 3 mugs or you had to use a tea cup.

We used the washer dryer, but the door jammed and we couldn't get our clean clothes out. Reception didn't know what to do. We eventually googled and found an override lever by the filter. Was a bit stressful!

Overall a nice stay, if weather had been nicer we'd have walked round the site but it poured all weekend.  We would definitely come back though.
showerReviews.author: J W

showerReviews.reviewText:
Clean, good sized lodge. Perfectly placed for exploring Kent - but be aware that you need to drive everywhere. There is no village, pub or restaurant within walking distance.
Other comments reflect those of previous guests, so it is a shame that these have not been addressed. More crockery/cutlery is needed. There aren't enough to warrant using the dishwasher. We had 2 wine glasses - one very small, one very large - which caused arguments!
The 'local info' file is very out of date. The QR code on the wall gives very little info.

We have stayed on several similar sites previously (booked via Hoseasons) and usually the staff are very welcoming. Here, however, we were greeted by a very surly man. I said we were there to check in. His only question was 'Have you been here before?' I replied no, expecting this to lead to a conversation, but we were then simply given our key and pointed in the direction of our lodge!
A few more customer service skills required!

All in all we had an excellent week exploring Kent
showerReviews.author: Darran Gale

showerReviews.reviewText:
++ Very friendly, honest manager. He even made an evening round, making sure all the guests were settled well and asking how they were doing.
++ Campsite 30m drive from Dover ferry but in a quiet area with many trees etc. around
+ Pitches flat and bigger than expected, rectangular field.
+/- Showers and toilets OK, showers have a saloon door and are likely to flood

Don't expect much facilities beside toilets, washing up block and showers. Perfect for 1 night but probably not much longer.
